bnx2x_main.c
00001 /* bnx2x_main.c: Broadcom Everest network driver.
00002  *
00003  * Copyright (c) 2007-2009 Broadcom Corporation
00004  *
00005  * This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
00006  * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
00007  * the Free Software Foundation.
00008  *
00009  * Maintained by: Eilon Greenstein <eilong@broadcom.com>
00010  * Written by: Eliezer Tamir
00011  * Based on code from Michael Chan's bnx2 driver
00012  * UDP CSUM errata workaround by Arik Gendelman
00013  * Slowpath and fastpath rework by Vladislav Zolotarov
00014  * Statistics and Link management by Yitchak Gertner
00015  *
00016  */
00017

00101 #if defined(BNX2X_UPSTREAM) && !defined(BNX2X_USE_INIT_VALUES) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00102 #include <linux/firmware.h>
00103 #include "bnx2x_fw_file_hdr.h"
00104 /* FW files */
00105 #define FW_FILE_VERSION                 \
00106     __stringify(BCM_5710_FW_MAJOR_VERSION) "."  \
00107     __stringify(BCM_5710_FW_MINOR_VERSION) "."  \
00108     __stringify(BCM_5710_FW_REVISION_VERSION) "."   \
00109     __stringify(BCM_5710_FW_ENGINEERING_VERSION)
00110 #define FW_FILE_NAME_E1     "bnx2x-e1-" FW_FILE_VERSION ".fw"
00111 #define FW_FILE_NAME_E1H    "bnx2x-e1h-" FW_FILE_VERSION ".fw"
00112 #else

00123 /* Time in jiffies before concluding the transmitter is hung */
00124 #if defined(__VMKLNX__) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00125 /* On VMware ESX there is a possibility that that netdev watchdog thread
00126  * runs before the reset task if the machine is loaded.  If this occurs
00127  * too many times, these premature watchdog triggers will cause a PSOD
00128  * on a VMware ESX beta build */
00129 #define TX_TIMEOUT      (20*HZ)
00130 #else
00131 #define TX_TIMEOUT      (5*HZ)
00132 #endif

00248 #endif

00257 static const struct pci_device_id bnx2x_pci_tbl[] = {
00258     { PCI_VDEVICE(BROADCOM, PCI_DEVICE_ID_NX2_57710), BCM57710 },
00259     { PCI_VDEVICE(BROADCOM, PCI_DEVICE_ID_NX2_57711), BCM57711 },
00260     { PCI_VDEVICE(BROADCOM, PCI_DEVICE_ID_NX2_57711E), BCM57711E },
00261     { 0 }

00266 /****************************************************************************
00267 * General service functions
00268 ****************************************************************************/
00269 
00270 /* used only at init
00271  * locking is done by mcp
00272  */
00273 void bnx2x_reg_wr_ind(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 addr, u32 val)
00274 {
00275     pci_write_config_dword(bp->pdev, PCICFG_GRC_ADDRESS, addr);
00276     pci_write_config_dword(bp->pdev, PCICFG_GRC_DATA, val);
00277     pci_write_config_dword(bp->pdev, PCICFG_GRC_ADDRESS,
00278                    PCICFG_VENDOR_ID_OFFSET);
00279 }
00280 
00281 static u32 bnx2x_reg_rd_ind(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 addr)
00282 {
00283     u32 val;
00284 
00285     pci_write_config_dword(bp->pdev, PCICFG_GRC_ADDRESS, addr);
00286     pci_read_config_dword(bp->pdev, PCICFG_GRC_DATA, &val);
00287     pci_write_config_dword(bp->pdev, PCICFG_GRC_ADDRESS,
00288                    PCICFG_VENDOR_ID_OFFSET);
00289 
00290     return val;
00291 }
00292 
00293 static const u32 dmae_reg_go_c[] = {
00294     DMAE_REG_GO_C0, DMAE_REG_GO_C1, DMAE_REG_GO_C2, DMAE_REG_GO_C3,
00295     DMAE_REG_GO_C4, DMAE_REG_GO_C5, DMAE_REG_GO_C6, DMAE_REG_GO_C7,
00296     DMAE_REG_GO_C8, DMAE_REG_GO_C9, DMAE_REG_GO_C10, DMAE_REG_GO_C11,
00297     DMAE_REG_GO_C12, DMAE_REG_GO_C13, DMAE_REG_GO_C14, DMAE_REG_GO_C15
00298 };
00299 
00300 /* copy command into DMAE command memory and set DMAE command go */
00301 static void bnx2x_post_dmae(struct bnx2x *bp, struct dmae_command *dmae,
00302                 int idx)
00303 {
00304     u32 cmd_offset;
00305     int i;
00306 
00307     cmd_offset = (DMAE_REG_CMD_MEM + sizeof(struct dmae_command) * idx);
00308     for (i = 0; i < (sizeof(struct dmae_command)/4); i++) {
00309         REG_WR(bp, cmd_offset + i*4, *(((u32 *)dmae) + i));
00310 
00311         DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "DMAE cmd[%d].%d (0x%08x) : 0x%08x\n",
00312            idx, i, cmd_offset + i*4, *(((u32 *)dmae) + i));
00313     }
00314     REG_WR(bp, dmae_reg_go_c[idx], 1);
00315 }
00316 
00317 void bnx2x_write_dmae(struct bnx2x *bp, dma_addr_t dma_addr, u32 dst_addr,
00318               u32 len32)
00319 {
00320     struct dmae_command dmae;
00321     u32 *wb_comp = bnx2x_sp(bp, wb_comp);
00322     int cnt = 200;
00323 
00324     if (!bp->dmae_ready) {
00325         u32 *data = bnx2x_sp(bp, wb_data[0]);
00326 
00327         DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "DMAE is not ready (dst_addr %08x  len32 %d)"
00328            "  using indirect\n", dst_addr, len32);
00329         bnx2x_init_ind_wr(bp, dst_addr, data, len32);
00330         return;
00331     }
00332 
00333     memset(&dmae, 0, sizeof(struct dmae_command));
00334 
00335     dmae.opcode = (DMAE_CMD_SRC_PCI | DMAE_CMD_DST_GRC |
00336                DMAE_CMD_C_DST_PCI | DMAE_CMD_C_ENABLE |
00337                DMAE_CMD_SRC_RESET | DMAE_CMD_DST_RESET |
00338 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN
00339                DMAE_CMD_ENDIANITY_B_DW_SWAP |
00340 #else
00341                DMAE_CMD_ENDIANITY_DW_SWAP |
00342 #endif
00343                (BP_PORT(bp) ? DMAE_CMD_PORT_1 : DMAE_CMD_PORT_0) |
00344                (BP_E1HVN(bp) << DMAE_CMD_E1HVN_SHIFT));
00345     dmae.src_addr_lo = U64_LO(dma_addr);
00346     dmae.src_addr_hi = U64_HI(dma_addr);
00347     dmae.dst_addr_lo = dst_addr >> 2;
00348     dmae.dst_addr_hi = 0;
00349     dmae.len = len32;
00350     dmae.comp_addr_lo = U64_LO(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, wb_comp));
00351     dmae.comp_addr_hi = U64_HI(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, wb_comp));
00352     dmae.comp_val = DMAE_COMP_VAL;
00353 
00354     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "DMAE: opcode 0x%08x\n"
00355        DP_LEVEL "src_addr  [%x:%08x]  len [%d *4]  "
00356             "dst_addr [%x:%08x (%08x)]\n"
00357        DP_LEVEL "comp_addr [%x:%08x]  comp_val 0x%08x\n",
00358        dmae.opcode, dmae.src_addr_hi, dmae.src_addr_lo,
00359        dmae.len, dmae.dst_addr_hi, dmae.dst_addr_lo, dst_addr,
00360        dmae.comp_addr_hi, dmae.comp_addr_lo, dmae.comp_val);
00361     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "data [0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x]\n",
00362        bp->slowpath->wb_data[0], bp->slowpath->wb_data[1],
00363        bp->slowpath->wb_data[2], bp->slowpath->wb_data[3]);
00364 
00365     mutex_lock(&bp->dmae_mutex);
00366 
00367     *wb_comp = 0;
00368 
00369     bnx2x_post_dmae(bp, &dmae, INIT_DMAE_C(bp));
00370 
00371     udelay(5);
00372 
00373     while (*wb_comp != DMAE_COMP_VAL) {
00374         DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "wb_comp 0x%08x\n", *wb_comp);
00375 
00376         if (!cnt) {
00377             BNX2X_ERR("DMAE timeout!\n");
00378             break;
00379         }
00380         cnt--;
00381         /* adjust delay for emulation/FPGA */
00382         if (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
00383             msleep(100);
00384         else
00385             udelay(5);
00386     }
00387 
00388     mutex_unlock(&bp->dmae_mutex);
00389 }
00390 
00391 void bnx2x_read_dmae(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 src_addr, u32 len32)
00392 {
00393     struct dmae_command dmae;
00394     u32 *wb_comp = bnx2x_sp(bp, wb_comp);
00395     int cnt = 200;
00396 
00397     if (!bp->dmae_ready) {
00398         u32 *data = bnx2x_sp(bp, wb_data[0]);
00399         int i;
00400 
00401         DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "DMAE is not ready (src_addr %08x  len32 %d)"
00402            "  using indirect\n", src_addr, len32);
00403         for (i = 0; i < len32; i++)
00404             data[i] = bnx2x_reg_rd_ind(bp, src_addr + i*4);
00405         return;
00406     }
00407 
00408     memset(&dmae, 0, sizeof(struct dmae_command));
00409 
00410     dmae.opcode = (DMAE_CMD_SRC_GRC | DMAE_CMD_DST_PCI |
00411                DMAE_CMD_C_DST_PCI | DMAE_CMD_C_ENABLE |
00412                DMAE_CMD_SRC_RESET | DMAE_CMD_DST_RESET |
00413 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN
00414                DMAE_CMD_ENDIANITY_B_DW_SWAP |
00415 #else
00416                DMAE_CMD_ENDIANITY_DW_SWAP |
00417 #endif
00418                (BP_PORT(bp) ? DMAE_CMD_PORT_1 : DMAE_CMD_PORT_0) |
00419                (BP_E1HVN(bp) << DMAE_CMD_E1HVN_SHIFT));
00420     dmae.src_addr_lo = src_addr >> 2;
00421     dmae.src_addr_hi = 0;
00422     dmae.dst_addr_lo = U64_LO(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, wb_data));
00423     dmae.dst_addr_hi = U64_HI(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, wb_data));
00424     dmae.len = len32;
00425     dmae.comp_addr_lo = U64_LO(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, wb_comp));
00426     dmae.comp_addr_hi = U64_HI(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, wb_comp));
00427     dmae.comp_val = DMAE_COMP_VAL;
00428 
00429     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "DMAE: opcode 0x%08x\n"
00430        DP_LEVEL "src_addr  [%x:%08x]  len [%d *4]  "
00431             "dst_addr [%x:%08x (%08x)]\n"
00432        DP_LEVEL "comp_addr [%x:%08x]  comp_val 0x%08x\n",
00433        dmae.opcode, dmae.src_addr_hi, dmae.src_addr_lo,
00434        dmae.len, dmae.dst_addr_hi, dmae.dst_addr_lo, src_addr,
00435        dmae.comp_addr_hi, dmae.comp_addr_lo, dmae.comp_val);
00436 
00437     mutex_lock(&bp->dmae_mutex);
00438 
00439     memset(bnx2x_sp(bp, wb_data[0]), 0, sizeof(u32) * 4);
00440     *wb_comp = 0;
00441 
00442     bnx2x_post_dmae(bp, &dmae, INIT_DMAE_C(bp));
00443 
00444     udelay(5);
00445 
00446     while (*wb_comp != DMAE_COMP_VAL) {
00447 
00448         if (!cnt) {
00449             BNX2X_ERR("DMAE timeout!\n");
00450             break;
00451         }
00452         cnt--;
00453         /* adjust delay for emulation/FPGA */
00454         if (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
00455             msleep(100);
00456         else
00457             udelay(5);
00458     }
00459     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "data [0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x]\n",
00460        bp->slowpath->wb_data[0], bp->slowpath->wb_data[1],
00461        bp->slowpath->wb_data[2], bp->slowpath->wb_data[3]);
00462 
00463     mutex_unlock(&bp->dmae_mutex);
00464 }
00465 
00466 void bnx2x_write_dmae_phys_len(struct bnx2x *bp, dma_addr_t phys_addr,
00467                    u32 addr, u32 len)
00468 {
00469     int dmae_wr_max = DMAE_LEN32_WR_MAX(bp);
00470     int offset = 0;
00471 
00472     while (len > dmae_wr_max) {
00473         bnx2x_write_dmae(bp, phys_addr + offset,
00474                  addr + offset, dmae_wr_max);
00475         offset += dmae_wr_max * 4;
00476         len -= dmae_wr_max;
00477     }
00478 
00479     bnx2x_write_dmae(bp, phys_addr + offset, addr + offset, len);
00480 }
00481 
00482 /* used only for slowpath so not inlined */
00483 static void bnx2x_wb_wr(struct bnx2x *bp, int reg, u32 val_hi, u32 val_lo)
00484 {
00485     u32 wb_write[2];
00486 
00487     wb_write[0] = val_hi;
00488     wb_write[1] = val_lo;
00489     REG_WR_DMAE(bp, reg, wb_write, 2);
00490 }
00491 
00492 #ifdef USE_WB_RD
00493 static u64 bnx2x_wb_rd(struct bnx2x *bp, int reg)
00494 {
00495     u32 wb_data[2];
00496 
00497     REG_RD_DMAE(bp, reg, wb_data, 2);
00498 
00499     return HILO_U64(wb_data[0], wb_data[1]);
00500 }
00501 #endif
00502 
00503 static int bnx2x_mc_assert(struct bnx2x *bp)
00504 {
00505     char last_idx;
00506     int i, rc = 0;
00507     u32 row0, row1, row2, row3;
00508 
00509     /* XSTORM */
00510     last_idx = REG_RD8(bp, BAR_XSTRORM_INTMEM +
00511                XSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX_OFFSET);
00512     if (last_idx)
00513         BNX2X_ERR("XSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX 0x%x\n", last_idx);
00514 
00515     /* print the asserts */
00516     for (i = 0; i < STROM_ASSERT_ARRAY_SIZE; i++) {
00517 
00518         row0 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_XSTRORM_INTMEM +
00519                   XSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i));
00520         row1 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_XSTRORM_INTMEM +
00521                   XSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 4);
00522         row2 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_XSTRORM_INTMEM +
00523                   XSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 8);
00524         row3 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_XSTRORM_INTMEM +
00525                   XSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 12);
00526 
00527         if (row0 != COMMON_ASM_INVALID_ASSERT_OPCODE) {
00528             BNX2X_ERR("XSTORM_ASSERT_INDEX 0x%x = 0x%08x"
00529                   " 0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x\n",
00530                   i, row3, row2, row1, row0);
00531             rc++;
00532         } else {
00533             break;
00534         }
00535     }
00536 
00537     /* TSTORM */
00538     last_idx = REG_RD8(bp, BAR_TSTRORM_INTMEM +
00539                TSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX_OFFSET);
00540     if (last_idx)
00541         BNX2X_ERR("TSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX 0x%x\n", last_idx);
00542 
00543     /* print the asserts */
00544     for (i = 0; i < STROM_ASSERT_ARRAY_SIZE; i++) {
00545 
00546         row0 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_TSTRORM_INTMEM +
00547                   TSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i));
00548         row1 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_TSTRORM_INTMEM +
00549                   TSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 4);
00550         row2 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_TSTRORM_INTMEM +
00551                   TSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 8);
00552         row3 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_TSTRORM_INTMEM +
00553                   TSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 12);
00554 
00555         if (row0 != COMMON_ASM_INVALID_ASSERT_OPCODE) {
00556             BNX2X_ERR("TSTORM_ASSERT_INDEX 0x%x = 0x%08x"
00557                   " 0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x\n",
00558                   i, row3, row2, row1, row0);
00559             rc++;
00560         } else {
00561             break;
00562         }
00563     }
00564 
00565     /* CSTORM */
00566     last_idx = REG_RD8(bp, BAR_CSTRORM_INTMEM +
00567                CSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX_OFFSET);
00568     if (last_idx)
00569         BNX2X_ERR("CSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX 0x%x\n", last_idx);
00570 
00571     /* print the asserts */
00572     for (i = 0; i < STROM_ASSERT_ARRAY_SIZE; i++) {
00573 
00574         row0 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_CSTRORM_INTMEM +
00575                   CSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i));
00576         row1 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_CSTRORM_INTMEM +
00577                   CSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 4);
00578         row2 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_CSTRORM_INTMEM +
00579                   CSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 8);
00580         row3 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_CSTRORM_INTMEM +
00581                   CSTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 12);
00582 
00583         if (row0 != COMMON_ASM_INVALID_ASSERT_OPCODE) {
00584             BNX2X_ERR("CSTORM_ASSERT_INDEX 0x%x = 0x%08x"
00585                   " 0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x\n",
00586                   i, row3, row2, row1, row0);
00587             rc++;
00588         } else {
00589             break;
00590         }
00591     }
00592 
00593     /* USTORM */
00594     last_idx = REG_RD8(bp, BAR_USTRORM_INTMEM +
00595                USTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX_OFFSET);
00596     if (last_idx)
00597         BNX2X_ERR("USTORM_ASSERT_LIST_INDEX 0x%x\n", last_idx);
00598 
00599     /* print the asserts */
00600     for (i = 0; i < STROM_ASSERT_ARRAY_SIZE; i++) {
00601 
00602         row0 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_USTRORM_INTMEM +
00603                   USTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i));
00604         row1 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_USTRORM_INTMEM +
00605                   USTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 4);
00606         row2 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_USTRORM_INTMEM +
00607                   USTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 8);
00608         row3 = REG_RD(bp, BAR_USTRORM_INTMEM +
00609                   USTORM_ASSERT_LIST_OFFSET(i) + 12);
00610 
00611         if (row0 != COMMON_ASM_INVALID_ASSERT_OPCODE) {
00612             BNX2X_ERR("USTORM_ASSERT_INDEX 0x%x = 0x%08x"
00613                   " 0x%08x 0x%08x 0x%08x\n",
00614                   i, row3, row2, row1, row0);
00615             rc++;
00616         } else {
00617             break;
00618         }
00619     }
00620 
00621     return rc;
00622 }
00623 
00624 static void bnx2x_fw_dump(struct bnx2x *bp)
00625 {
00626     u32 addr;
00627     u32 mark, offset;
00628     __be32 data[9];
00629     int word;
00630 
00631     if (BP_NOMCP(bp)) {
00632         BNX2X_ERR("NO MCP - can not dump\n");
00633         return;
00634     }
00635 
00636     addr = bp->common.shmem_base - 0x0800 + 4;
00637     mark = REG_RD(bp, addr);
00638     mark = MCP_REG_MCPR_SCRATCH + ((mark + 0x3) & ~0x3) - 0x08000000;
00639     printk(KERN_ERR PFX "begin fw dump (mark 0x%x)\n" KERN_ERR, mark);
00640 
00641     for (offset = mark; offset <= bp->common.shmem_base; offset += 0x8*4) {
00642         for (word = 0; word < 8; word++)
00643             data[word] = htonl(REG_RD(bp, offset + 4*word));
00644         data[8] = 0x0;
00645         printk(KERN_CONT "%s", (char *)data);
00646     }
00647     for (offset = addr + 4; offset <= mark; offset += 0x8*4) {
00648         for (word = 0; word < 8; word++)
00649             data[word] = htonl(REG_RD(bp, offset + 4*word));
00650         data[8] = 0x0;
00651         printk(KERN_CONT "%s", (char *)data);
00652     }
00653     printk("\n" KERN_ERR PFX "end of fw dump\n");
00654 }
00655 
00656 static void bnx2x_panic_dump(struct bnx2x *bp)
00657 {
00658     int i;
00659     u16 j, start, end;
00660 
00661     bp->stats_state = STATS_STATE_DISABLED;
00662     DP(BNX2X_MSG_STATS, "stats_state - DISABLED\n");
00663 
00664     BNX2X_ERR("begin crash dump -----------------\n");
00665 
00666     /* Indices */
00667     /* Common */
00668     BNX2X_ERR("def_c_idx(0x%x)  def_u_idx(0x%x)  def_x_idx(0x%x)"
00669           "  def_t_idx(0x%x)  def_att_idx(0x%x)  attn_state(0x%x)"
00670           "  spq_prod_idx(0x%x)\n",
00671           bp->def_c_idx, bp->def_u_idx, bp->def_x_idx, bp->def_t_idx,
00672           bp->def_att_idx, bp->attn_state, bp->spq_prod_idx);
00673 
00674     /* Rx */
00675     for_each_queue(bp, i) {
00676         struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = &bp->fp[i];
00677 
00678         BNX2X_ERR("fp%d: rx_bd_prod(0x%x)  rx_bd_cons(0x%x)"
00679               "  *rx_bd_cons_sb(0x%x)  rx_comp_prod(0x%x)"
00680               "  rx_comp_cons(0x%x)  *rx_cons_sb(0x%x)\n",
00681               i, fp->rx_bd_prod, fp->rx_bd_cons,
00682               le16_to_cpu(*fp->rx_bd_cons_sb), fp->rx_comp_prod,
00683               fp->rx_comp_cons, le16_to_cpu(*fp->rx_cons_sb));
00684         BNX2X_ERR("     rx_sge_prod(0x%x)  last_max_sge(0x%x)"
00685               "  fp_u_idx(0x%x) *sb_u_idx(0x%x)\n",
00686               fp->rx_sge_prod, fp->last_max_sge,
00687               le16_to_cpu(fp->fp_u_idx),
00688               fp->status_blk->u_status_block.status_block_index);
00689     }
00690 
00691     /* Tx */
00692     for_each_queue(bp, i) {
00693         struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = &bp->fp[i];
00694 
00695         BNX2X_ERR("fp%d: tx_pkt_prod(0x%x)  tx_pkt_cons(0x%x)"
00696               "  tx_bd_prod(0x%x)  tx_bd_cons(0x%x)"
00697               "  *tx_cons_sb(0x%x)\n",
00698               i, fp->tx_pkt_prod, fp->tx_pkt_cons, fp->tx_bd_prod,
00699               fp->tx_bd_cons, le16_to_cpu(*fp->tx_cons_sb));
00700         BNX2X_ERR("     fp_c_idx(0x%x)  *sb_c_idx(0x%x)"
00701               "  tx_db_prod(0x%x)\n", le16_to_cpu(fp->fp_c_idx),
00702               fp->status_blk->c_status_block.status_block_index,
00703               fp->tx_db.data.prod);
00704     }
00705 
00706     /* Rings */
00707     /* Rx */
00708     for_each_queue(bp, i) {
00709         struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = &bp->fp[i];
00710 
00711         start = RX_BD(le16_to_cpu(*fp->rx_cons_sb) - 10);
00712         end = RX_BD(le16_to_cpu(*fp->rx_cons_sb) + 503);
00713         for (j = start; j != end; j = RX_BD(j + 1)) {
00714             u32 *rx_bd = (u32 *)&fp->rx_desc_ring[j];
00715             struct sw_rx_bd *sw_bd = &fp->rx_buf_ring[j];
00716 
00717             BNX2X_ERR("fp%d: rx_bd[%x]=[%x:%x]  sw_bd=[%p]\n",
00718                   i, j, rx_bd[1], rx_bd[0], sw_bd->skb);
00719         }
00720 
00721         start = RX_SGE(fp->rx_sge_prod);
00722         end = RX_SGE(fp->last_max_sge);
00723         for (j = start; j != end; j = RX_SGE(j + 1)) {
00724             u32 *rx_sge = (u32 *)&fp->rx_sge_ring[j];
00725             struct sw_rx_page *sw_page = &fp->rx_page_ring[j];
00726 
00727             BNX2X_ERR("fp%d: rx_sge[%x]=[%x:%x]  sw_page=[%p]\n",
00728                   i, j, rx_sge[1], rx_sge[0], sw_page->page);
00729         }
00730 
00731         start = RCQ_BD(fp->rx_comp_cons - 10);
00732         end = RCQ_BD(fp->rx_comp_cons + 503);
00733         for (j = start; j != end; j = RCQ_BD(j + 1)) {
00734             u32 *cqe = (u32 *)&fp->rx_comp_ring[j];
00735 
00736             BNX2X_ERR("fp%d: cqe[%x]=[%x:%x:%x:%x]\n",
00737                   i, j, cqe[0], cqe[1], cqe[2], cqe[3]);
00738         }
00739     }
00740 
00741     /* Tx */
00742     for_each_queue(bp, i) {
00743         struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = &bp->fp[i];
00744 
00745         start = TX_BD(le16_to_cpu(*fp->tx_cons_sb) - 10);
00746         end = TX_BD(le16_to_cpu(*fp->tx_cons_sb) + 245);
00747         for (j = start; j != end; j = TX_BD(j + 1)) {
00748             struct sw_tx_bd *sw_bd = &fp->tx_buf_ring[j];
00749 
00750             BNX2X_ERR("fp%d: packet[%x]=[%p,%x]\n",
00751                   i, j, sw_bd->skb, sw_bd->first_bd);
00752         }
00753 
00754         start = TX_BD(fp->tx_bd_cons - 10);
00755         end = TX_BD(fp->tx_bd_cons + 254);
00756         for (j = start; j != end; j = TX_BD(j + 1)) {
00757             u32 *tx_bd = (u32 *)&fp->tx_desc_ring[j];
00758 
00759             BNX2X_ERR("fp%d: tx_bd[%x]=[%x:%x:%x:%x]\n",
00760                   i, j, tx_bd[0], tx_bd[1], tx_bd[2], tx_bd[3]);
00761         }
00762     }
00763 
00764     bnx2x_fw_dump(bp);
00765 #ifndef BNX2X_UPSTREAM /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00766     bp->msglevel |= NETIF_MSG_PROBE;
00767     BNX2X_ERR("Idle check (1st round) ----------\n");
00768     bnx2x_idle_chk(bp);
00769     BNX2X_ERR("Idle check (2nd round) ----------\n");
00770     bnx2x_idle_chk(bp);
00771 #endif
00772     bnx2x_mc_assert(bp);
00773     BNX2X_ERR("end crash dump -----------------\n");
00774 }
00775 
00776 static void bnx2x_int_enable(struct bnx2x *bp)
00777 {
00778     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
00779     u32 addr = port ? HC_REG_CONFIG_1 : HC_REG_CONFIG_0;
00780     u32 val = REG_RD(bp, addr);
00781     int msix = (bp->flags & USING_MSIX_FLAG) ? 1 : 0;
00782     int msi = (bp->flags & USING_MSI_FLAG) ? 1 : 0;
00783 
00784     if (msix) {
00785         val &= ~(HC_CONFIG_0_REG_SINGLE_ISR_EN_0 |
00786              HC_CONFIG_0_REG_INT_LINE_EN_0);
00787         val |= (HC_CONFIG_0_REG_MSI_MSIX_INT_EN_0 |
00788             HC_CONFIG_0_REG_ATTN_BIT_EN_0);
00789     } else if (msi) {
00790         val &= ~HC_CONFIG_0_REG_INT_LINE_EN_0;
00791         val |= (HC_CONFIG_0_REG_SINGLE_ISR_EN_0 |
00792             HC_CONFIG_0_REG_MSI_MSIX_INT_EN_0 |
00793             HC_CONFIG_0_REG_ATTN_BIT_EN_0);
00794     } else {
00795         val |= (HC_CONFIG_0_REG_SINGLE_ISR_EN_0 |
00796             HC_CONFIG_0_REG_MSI_MSIX_INT_EN_0 |
00797             HC_CONFIG_0_REG_INT_LINE_EN_0 |
00798             HC_CONFIG_0_REG_ATTN_BIT_EN_0);
00799 
00800         DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "write %x to HC %d (addr 0x%x)\n",
00801            val, port, addr);
00802 
00803         REG_WR(bp, addr, val);
00804 
00805         val &= ~HC_CONFIG_0_REG_MSI_MSIX_INT_EN_0;
00806     }
00807 
00808     DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "write %x to HC %d (addr 0x%x)  mode %s\n",
00809        val, port, addr, (msix ? "MSI-X" : (msi ? "MSI" : "INTx")));
00810 
00811     REG_WR(bp, addr, val);
00812     /*
00813      * Ensure that HC_CONFIG is written before leading/trailing edge config
00814      */
00815     mmiowb();
00816     barrier();
00817 
00818     if (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp)) {
00819         /* init leading/trailing edge */
00820         if (IS_E1HMF(bp)) {
00821             val = (0xee0f | (1 << (BP_E1HVN(bp) + 4)));
00822             if (bp->port.pmf)
00823                 /* enable nig and gpio3 attention */
00824                 val |= 0x1100;
00825         } else
00826             val = 0xffff;
00827 
00828         REG_WR(bp, HC_REG_TRAILING_EDGE_0 + port*8, val);
00829         REG_WR(bp, HC_REG_LEADING_EDGE_0 + port*8, val);
00830     }
00831 
00832     /* Make sure that interrupts are indeed enabled from here on */
00833     mmiowb();
00834 }
00835 
00836 static void bnx2x_int_disable(struct bnx2x *bp)
00837 {
00838     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
00839     u32 addr = port ? HC_REG_CONFIG_1 : HC_REG_CONFIG_0;
00840     u32 val = REG_RD(bp, addr);
00841 
00842     val &= ~(HC_CONFIG_0_REG_SINGLE_ISR_EN_0 |
00843          HC_CONFIG_0_REG_MSI_MSIX_INT_EN_0 |
00844          HC_CONFIG_0_REG_INT_LINE_EN_0 |
00845          HC_CONFIG_0_REG_ATTN_BIT_EN_0);
00846 
00847     DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "write %x to HC %d (addr 0x%x)\n",
00848        val, port, addr);
00849 
00850     /* flush all outstanding writes */
00851     mmiowb();
00852 
00853     REG_WR(bp, addr, val);
00854     if (REG_RD(bp, addr) != val)
00855         BNX2X_ERR("BUG! proper val not read from IGU!\n");
00856 }
00857 
00858 static void bnx2x_int_disable_sync(struct bnx2x *bp, int disable_hw)
00859 {
00860 #ifdef CONFIG_PCI_MSI /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00861     int msix = (bp->flags & USING_MSIX_FLAG) ? 1 : 0;
00862     int i, offset;
00863 #endif
00864 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020618) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00865     int j;
00866 #endif
00867 
00868     /* disable interrupt handling */
00869     atomic_inc(&bp->intr_sem);
00870     smp_wmb(); /* Ensure that bp->intr_sem update is SMP-safe */
00871 
00872     if (disable_hw)
00873         /* prevent the HW from sending interrupts */
00874         bnx2x_int_disable(bp);
00875 
00876     /* make sure all ISRs are done */
00877 #ifdef CONFIG_PCI_MSI /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00878     if (msix) {
00879         synchronize_irq(bp->msix_table[0].vector);
00880         offset = 1;
00881 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
00882         offset++;
00883 #endif
00884         for_each_queue(bp, i)
00885             synchronize_irq(bp->msix_table[i + offset].vector);
00886     } else
00887 #endif
00888         synchronize_irq(bp->pdev->irq);
00889 
00890     /* make sure sp_task is not running */
00891 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020618) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00892     cancel_delayed_work(&bp->sp_task);
00893     flush_workqueue(bnx2x_wq);
00894 #else
00895     j = 0;
00896     smp_mb(); /* sp_running is set by sp_task */
00897     while (bp->sp_running) {
00898         if (!(++j % 1000))
00899             BNX2X_ERR("sp_running (j %d)\n", j);
00900         msleep(1);
00901         smp_mb();
00902     }
00903 #endif
00904 }
00905 
00906 /* fast path */
00907 
00908 /*
00909  * General service functions
00910  */
00911 
00912 static inline void bnx2x_ack_sb(struct bnx2x *bp, u8 sb_id,
00913                 u8 storm, u16 index, u8 op, u8 update)
00914 {
00915     u32 hc_addr = (HC_REG_COMMAND_REG + BP_PORT(bp)*32 +
00916                COMMAND_REG_INT_ACK);
00917     struct igu_ack_register igu_ack;
00918 
00919     igu_ack.status_block_index = index;
00920     igu_ack.sb_id_and_flags =
00921             ((sb_id << IGU_ACK_REGISTER_STATUS_BLOCK_ID_SHIFT) |
00922              (storm << IGU_ACK_REGISTER_STORM_ID_SHIFT) |
00923              (update << IGU_ACK_REGISTER_UPDATE_INDEX_SHIFT) |
00924              (op << IGU_ACK_REGISTER_INTERRUPT_MODE_SHIFT));
00925 
00926 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020600) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
00927     /* x86's writel() in 2.4.x does not have barrier(). */
00928     barrier();
00929 #endif
00930     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "write 0x%08x to HC addr 0x%x\n",
00931        (*(u32 *)&igu_ack), hc_addr);
00932     REG_WR(bp, hc_addr, (*(u32 *)&igu_ack));
00933 
00934     /* Make sure that ACK is written */
00935     mmiowb();
00936     barrier();
00937 }
00938 
00939 static inline void bnx2x_update_fpsb_idx(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
00940 {
00941     struct host_status_block *fpsb = fp->status_blk;
00942 
00943     barrier(); /* status block is written to by the chip */
00944     fp->fp_c_idx = fpsb->c_status_block.status_block_index;
00945     fp->fp_u_idx = fpsb->u_status_block.status_block_index;
00946 }
00947 
00948 static u16 bnx2x_ack_int(struct bnx2x *bp)
00949 {
00950     u32 hc_addr = (HC_REG_COMMAND_REG + BP_PORT(bp)*32 +
00951                COMMAND_REG_SIMD_MASK);
00952     u32 result = REG_RD(bp, hc_addr);
00953 
00954     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "read 0x%08x from HC addr 0x%x\n",
00955        result, hc_addr);
00956 
00957     return result;
00958 }
00959 
00960 
00961 /*
00962  * fast path service functions
00963  */
00964 
00965 static inline int bnx2x_has_tx_work_unload(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
00966 {
00967     /* Tell compiler that consumer and producer can change */
00968     barrier();
00969     return (fp->tx_pkt_prod != fp->tx_pkt_cons);
00970 }
00971 
00972 /* free skb in the packet ring at pos idx
00973  * return idx of last bd freed
00974  */
00975 static u16 bnx2x_free_tx_pkt(struct bnx2x *bp, struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
00976                  u16 idx)
00977 {
00978     struct sw_tx_bd *tx_buf = &fp->tx_buf_ring[idx];
00979     struct eth_tx_start_bd *tx_start_bd;
00980     struct eth_tx_bd *tx_data_bd;
00981     struct sk_buff *skb = tx_buf->skb;
00982     u16 bd_idx = TX_BD(tx_buf->first_bd), new_cons;
00983     int nbd;
00984 
00985     /* prefetch skb end pointer to speedup dev_kfree_skb() */
00986     prefetch(&skb->end);
00987 
00988     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "pkt_idx %d  buff @(%p)->skb %p\n",
00989        idx, tx_buf, skb);
00990 
00991     /* unmap first bd */
00992     DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "free bd_idx %d\n", bd_idx);
00993     tx_start_bd = &fp->tx_desc_ring[bd_idx].start_bd;
00994     pci_unmap_single(bp->pdev, BD_UNMAP_ADDR(tx_start_bd),
00995              BD_UNMAP_LEN(tx_start_bd), PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
00996 
00997     nbd = le16_to_cpu(tx_start_bd->nbd) - 1;
00998 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
00999     if ((nbd - 1) > (MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 2)) {
01000         BNX2X_ERR("BAD nbd!\n");
01001         bnx2x_panic();
01002     }
01003 #endif
01004     new_cons = nbd + tx_buf->first_bd;
01005 
01006     /* Get the next bd */
01007     bd_idx = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_idx));
01008 
01009     /* Skip a parse bd... */
01010     --nbd;
01011     bd_idx = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_idx));
01012 
01013     /* ...and the TSO split header bd since they have no mapping */
01014     if (tx_buf->flags & BNX2X_TSO_SPLIT_BD) {
01015         --nbd;
01016         bd_idx = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_idx));
01017     }
01018 
01019     /* now free frags */
01020     while (nbd > 0) {
01021 
01022         DP(BNX2X_MSG_OFF, "free frag bd_idx %d\n", bd_idx);
01023         tx_data_bd = &fp->tx_desc_ring[bd_idx].reg_bd;
01024         pci_unmap_page(bp->pdev, BD_UNMAP_ADDR(tx_data_bd),
01025                    BD_UNMAP_LEN(tx_data_bd), PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
01026         if (--nbd)
01027             bd_idx = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_idx));
01028     }
01029 
01030     /* release skb */
01031     WARN_ON(!skb);
01032     dev_kfree_skb(skb);
01033     tx_buf->first_bd = 0;
01034     tx_buf->skb = NULL;
01035 
01036     return new_cons;
01037 }
01038 
01039 static inline u16 bnx2x_tx_avail(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
01040 {
01041     s16 used;
01042     u16 prod;
01043     u16 cons;
01044 
01045     barrier(); /* Tell compiler that prod and cons can change */
01046     prod = fp->tx_bd_prod;
01047     cons = fp->tx_bd_cons;
01048 
01049     /* NUM_TX_RINGS = number of "next-page" entries
01050        It will be used as a threshold */
01051     used = SUB_S16(prod, cons) + (s16)NUM_TX_RINGS;
01052 
01053 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
01054     WARN_ON(used < 0);
01055     WARN_ON(used > fp->bp->tx_ring_size);
01056     WARN_ON((fp->bp->tx_ring_size - used) > MAX_TX_AVAIL);
01057 #endif
01058 
01059     return (s16)(fp->bp->tx_ring_size) - used;
01060 }
01061 
01062 static inline int bnx2x_has_tx_work(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
01063 {
01064     u16 hw_cons;
01065 
01066     /* Tell compiler that status block fields can change */
01067     barrier();
01068     hw_cons = le16_to_cpu(*fp->tx_cons_sb);
01069     return hw_cons != fp->tx_pkt_cons;
01070 }
01071 
01072 static int bnx2x_tx_int(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
01073 {
01074     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
01075 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01076     struct netdev_queue *txq;
01077 #endif
01078     u16 hw_cons, sw_cons, bd_cons = fp->tx_bd_cons;
01079 
01080 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
01081     if (unlikely(bp->panic))
01082         return -1;
01083 #endif
01084 
01085 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01086     txq = netdev_get_tx_queue(bp->dev, fp->index);
01087 #endif
01088     hw_cons = le16_to_cpu(*fp->tx_cons_sb);
01089     sw_cons = fp->tx_pkt_cons;
01090 
01091     while (sw_cons != hw_cons) {
01092         u16 pkt_cons;
01093 
01094         pkt_cons = TX_BD(sw_cons);
01095 
01096         /* prefetch(bp->tx_buf_ring[pkt_cons].skb); */
01097 
01098         DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_DONE, "hw_cons %u  sw_cons %u  pkt_cons %u\n",
01099            hw_cons, sw_cons, pkt_cons);
01100 
01101 /*      if (NEXT_TX_IDX(sw_cons) != hw_cons) {
01102             rmb();
01103             prefetch(fp->tx_buf_ring[NEXT_TX_IDX(sw_cons)].skb);
01104         }
01105 */
01106         bd_cons = bnx2x_free_tx_pkt(bp, fp, pkt_cons);
01107         sw_cons++;
01108     }
01109 
01110     fp->tx_pkt_cons = sw_cons;
01111     fp->tx_bd_cons = bd_cons;
01112 
01113     /* TBD need a thresh? */
01114 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01115     if (unlikely(netif_tx_queue_stopped(txq))) {
01116 
01117         /*
01118          * Need to make the tx_bd_cons update visible to start_xmit()
01119          * before checking for netif_tx_queue_stopped().  Without the
01120          * memory barrier, there is a small possibility that
01121          * start_xmit() will miss it and cause the queue to be stopped
01122          * forever.
01123          */
01124         smp_mb();
01125 
01126         if ((netif_tx_queue_stopped(txq)) &&
01127             (bp->state == BNX2X_STATE_OPEN) &&
01128             (bnx2x_tx_avail(fp) >= MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 3))
01129             netif_tx_wake_queue(txq);
01130     }
01131 #else
01132     if (unlikely(netif_queue_stopped(bp->dev))) {
01133 
01134         /* See above */
01135         smp_mb();
01136 
01137         if (netif_queue_stopped(bp->dev) &&
01138             (bp->state == BNX2X_STATE_OPEN) &&
01139             (bnx2x_tx_avail(fp) >= MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 3))
01140             netif_wake_queue(bp->dev);
01141     }
01142 #endif
01143     return 0;
01144 }
01145 
01146 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
01147 static void bnx2x_cnic_cfc_comp(struct bnx2x *bp, int cid);
01148 #endif
01149 
01150 static void bnx2x_sp_event(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
01151                union eth_rx_cqe *rr_cqe)
01152 {
01153     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
01154     int cid = SW_CID(rr_cqe->ramrod_cqe.conn_and_cmd_data);
01155     int command = CQE_CMD(rr_cqe->ramrod_cqe.conn_and_cmd_data);
01156 
01157     DP(BNX2X_MSG_SP,
01158        "fp %d  cid %d  got ramrod #%d  state is %x  type is %d\n",
01159        fp->index, cid, command, bp->state,
01160        rr_cqe->ramrod_cqe.ramrod_type);
01161 
01162     bp->spq_left++;
01163 
01164     if (fp->index) {
01165         switch (command | fp->state) {
01166         case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_CLIENT_SETUP |
01167                         BNX2X_FP_STATE_OPENING):
01168             DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP, "got MULTI[%d] setup ramrod\n",
01169                cid);
01170             fp->state = BNX2X_FP_STATE_OPEN;
01171             break;
01172 
01173         case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_HALT | BNX2X_FP_STATE_HALTING):
01174             DP(NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN, "got MULTI[%d] halt ramrod\n",
01175                cid);
01176             fp->state = BNX2X_FP_STATE_HALTED;
01177             break;
01178 
01179         default:
01180             BNX2X_ERR("unexpected MC reply (%d)  "
01181                   "fp[%d] state is %x\n",
01182                   command, fp->index, fp->state);
01183             break;
01184         }
01185         mb(); /* force bnx2x_wait_ramrod() to see the change */
01186         return;
01187     }
01188 
01189     switch (command | bp->state) {
01190     case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_PORT_SETUP | BNX2X_STATE_OPENING_WAIT4_PORT):
01191         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP, "got setup ramrod\n");
01192         bp->state = BNX2X_STATE_OPEN;
01193         break;
01194 
01195     case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_HALT | BNX2X_STATE_CLOSING_WAIT4_HALT):
01196         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN, "got halt ramrod\n");
01197         bp->state = BNX2X_STATE_CLOSING_WAIT4_DELETE;
01198         fp->state = BNX2X_FP_STATE_HALTED;
01199         break;
01200 
01201     case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_CFC_DEL | BNX2X_STATE_CLOSING_WAIT4_HALT):
01202         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN, "got delete ramrod for MULTI[%d]\n", cid);
01203         bnx2x_fp(bp, cid, state) = BNX2X_FP_STATE_CLOSED;
01204         break;
01205 
01206 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
01207     case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_CFC_DEL | BNX2X_STATE_OPEN):
01208         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN, "got delete ramrod for CID %d\n", cid);
01209         bnx2x_cnic_cfc_comp(bp, cid);
01210         break;
01211 #endif
01212 
01213     case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_SET_MAC | BNX2X_STATE_OPEN):
01214     case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_SET_MAC | BNX2X_STATE_DIAG):
01215         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP, "got set mac ramrod\n");
01216         bp->set_mac_pending--;
01217         smp_wmb();
01218         break;
01219 
01220     case (RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_SET_MAC | BNX2X_STATE_CLOSING_WAIT4_HALT):
01221         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN, "got (un)set mac ramrod\n");
01222         bp->set_mac_pending--;
01223         smp_wmb();
01224         break;
01225 
01226     default:
01227         BNX2X_ERR("unexpected MC reply (%d)  bp->state is %x\n",
01228               command, bp->state);
01229         break;
01230     }
01231     mb(); /* force bnx2x_wait_ramrod() to see the change */
01232 }
01233 
01234 static inline void bnx2x_free_rx_sge(struct bnx2x *bp,
01235                      struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp, u16 index)
01236 {
01237     struct sw_rx_page *sw_buf = &fp->rx_page_ring[index];
01238     struct page *page = sw_buf->page;
01239     struct eth_rx_sge *sge = &fp->rx_sge_ring[index];
01240 
01241     /* Skip "next page" elements */
01242     if (!page)
01243         return;
01244 
01245     pci_unmap_page(bp->pdev, pci_unmap_addr(sw_buf, mapping),
01246                SGE_PAGE_SIZE*PAGES_PER_SGE, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01247     __free_pages(page, PAGES_PER_SGE_SHIFT);
01248 
01249     sw_buf->page = NULL;
01250     sge->addr_hi = 0;
01251     sge->addr_lo = 0;
01252 }
01253 
01254 static inline void bnx2x_free_rx_sge_range(struct bnx2x *bp,
01255                        struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp, int last)
01256 {
01257     int i;
01258 
01259     for (i = 0; i < last; i++)
01260         bnx2x_free_rx_sge(bp, fp, i);
01261 }
01262 
01263 static inline int bnx2x_alloc_rx_sge(struct bnx2x *bp,
01264                      struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp, u16 index)
01265 {
01266     struct page *page = alloc_pages(GFP_ATOMIC, PAGES_PER_SGE_SHIFT);
01267     struct sw_rx_page *sw_buf = &fp->rx_page_ring[index];
01268     struct eth_rx_sge *sge = &fp->rx_sge_ring[index];
01269     dma_addr_t mapping;
01270 
01271     if (unlikely(page == NULL))
01272         return -ENOMEM;
01273 
01274     mapping = pci_map_page(bp->pdev, page, 0, SGE_PAGE_SIZE*PAGES_PER_SGE,
01275                    PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01276 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061b) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01277     if (unlikely(dma_mapping_error(&bp->pdev->dev, mapping))) {
01278 #else
01279     if (unlikely(dma_mapping_error(mapping))) {
01280 #endif
01281         __free_pages(page, PAGES_PER_SGE_SHIFT);
01282         return -ENOMEM;
01283     }
01284 
01285     sw_buf->page = page;
01286     pci_unmap_addr_set(sw_buf, mapping, mapping);
01287 
01288     sge->addr_hi = cpu_to_le32(U64_HI(mapping));
01289     sge->addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(U64_LO(mapping));
01290 
01291     return 0;
01292 }
01293 
01294 static inline int bnx2x_alloc_rx_skb(struct bnx2x *bp,
01295                      struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp, u16 index)
01296 {
01297     struct sk_buff *skb;
01298     struct sw_rx_bd *rx_buf = &fp->rx_buf_ring[index];
01299     struct eth_rx_bd *rx_bd = &fp->rx_desc_ring[index];
01300     dma_addr_t mapping;
01301 
01302     skb = netdev_alloc_skb(bp->dev, bp->rx_buf_size);
01303     if (unlikely(skb == NULL))
01304         return -ENOMEM;
01305 
01306     mapping = pci_map_single(bp->pdev, skb->data, bp->rx_buf_size,
01307                  PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01308 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061b) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01309     if (unlikely(dma_mapping_error(&bp->pdev->dev, mapping))) {
01310 #else
01311     if (unlikely(dma_mapping_error(mapping))) {
01312 #endif
01313         dev_kfree_skb(skb);
01314         return -ENOMEM;
01315     }
01316 
01317     rx_buf->skb = skb;
01318     pci_unmap_addr_set(rx_buf, mapping, mapping);
01319 
01320     rx_bd->addr_hi = cpu_to_le32(U64_HI(mapping));
01321     rx_bd->addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(U64_LO(mapping));
01322 
01323     return 0;
01324 }
01325 
01326 /* note that we are not allocating a new skb,
01327  * we are just moving one from cons to prod
01328  * we are not creating a new mapping,
01329  * so there is no need to check for dma_mapping_error().
01330  */
01331 static void bnx2x_reuse_rx_skb(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
01332                    struct sk_buff *skb, u16 cons, u16 prod)
01333 {
01334     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
01335     struct sw_rx_bd *cons_rx_buf = &fp->rx_buf_ring[cons];
01336     struct sw_rx_bd *prod_rx_buf = &fp->rx_buf_ring[prod];
01337     struct eth_rx_bd *cons_bd = &fp->rx_desc_ring[cons];
01338     struct eth_rx_bd *prod_bd = &fp->rx_desc_ring[prod];
01339 
01340     pci_dma_sync_single_for_device(bp->pdev,
01341                        pci_unmap_addr(cons_rx_buf, mapping),
01342                        RX_COPY_THRESH, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01343 
01344     prod_rx_buf->skb = cons_rx_buf->skb;
01345     pci_unmap_addr_set(prod_rx_buf, mapping,
01346                pci_unmap_addr(cons_rx_buf, mapping));
01347     *prod_bd = *cons_bd;
01348 }
01349 
01350 #if !defined(__NO_TPA__) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01351 static inline void bnx2x_update_last_max_sge(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
01352                          u16 idx)
01353 {
01354     u16 last_max = fp->last_max_sge;
01355 
01356     if (SUB_S16(idx, last_max) > 0)
01357         fp->last_max_sge = idx;
01358 }
01359 
01360 static void bnx2x_clear_sge_mask_next_elems(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
01361 {
01362     int i, j;
01363 
01364     for (i = 1; i <= NUM_RX_SGE_PAGES; i++) {
01365         int idx = RX_SGE_CNT * i - 1;
01366 
01367         for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
01368             SGE_MASK_CLEAR_BIT(fp, idx);
01369             idx--;
01370         }
01371     }
01372 }
01373 
01374 static void bnx2x_update_sge_prod(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
01375                   struct eth_fast_path_rx_cqe *fp_cqe)
01376 {
01377     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
01378     u16 sge_len = SGE_PAGE_ALIGN(le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->pkt_len) -
01379                      le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->len_on_bd)) >>
01380               SGE_PAGE_SHIFT;
01381     u16 last_max, last_elem, first_elem;
01382     u16 delta = 0;
01383     u16 i;
01384 
01385     if (!sge_len)
01386         return;
01387 
01388     /* First mark all used pages */
01389     for (i = 0; i < sge_len; i++)
01390         SGE_MASK_CLEAR_BIT(fp, RX_SGE(le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->sgl[i])));
01391 
01392     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS, "fp_cqe->sgl[%d] = %d\n",
01393        sge_len - 1, le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->sgl[sge_len - 1]));
01394 
01395     /* Here we assume that the last SGE index is the biggest */
01396     prefetch((void *)(fp->sge_mask));
01397     bnx2x_update_last_max_sge(fp, le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->sgl[sge_len - 1]));
01398 
01399     last_max = RX_SGE(fp->last_max_sge);
01400     last_elem = last_max >> RX_SGE_MASK_ELEM_SHIFT;
01401     first_elem = RX_SGE(fp->rx_sge_prod) >> RX_SGE_MASK_ELEM_SHIFT;
01402 
01403     /* If ring is not full */
01404     if (last_elem + 1 != first_elem)
01405         last_elem++;
01406 
01407     /* Now update the prod */
01408     for (i = first_elem; i != last_elem; i = NEXT_SGE_MASK_ELEM(i)) {
01409         if (likely(fp->sge_mask[i]))
01410             break;
01411 
01412         fp->sge_mask[i] = RX_SGE_MASK_ELEM_ONE_MASK;
01413         delta += RX_SGE_MASK_ELEM_SZ;
01414     }
01415 
01416     if (delta > 0) {
01417         fp->rx_sge_prod += delta;
01418         /* clear page-end entries */
01419         bnx2x_clear_sge_mask_next_elems(fp);
01420     }
01421 
01422     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS,
01423        "fp->last_max_sge = %d  fp->rx_sge_prod = %d\n",
01424        fp->last_max_sge, fp->rx_sge_prod);
01425 }
01426 
01427 static inline void bnx2x_init_sge_ring_bit_mask(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
01428 {
01429     /* Set the mask to all 1-s: it's faster to compare to 0 than to 0xf-s */
01430     memset(fp->sge_mask, 0xff,
01431            (NUM_RX_SGE >> RX_SGE_MASK_ELEM_SHIFT)*sizeof(u64));
01432 
01433     /* Clear the two last indices in the page to 1:
01434        these are the indices that correspond to the "next" element,
01435        hence will never be indicated and should be removed from
01436        the calculations. */
01437     bnx2x_clear_sge_mask_next_elems(fp);
01438 }
01439 
01440 static void bnx2x_tpa_start(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp, u16 queue,
01441                 struct sk_buff *skb, u16 cons, u16 prod)
01442 {
01443     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
01444     struct sw_rx_bd *cons_rx_buf = &fp->rx_buf_ring[cons];
01445     struct sw_rx_bd *prod_rx_buf = &fp->rx_buf_ring[prod];
01446     struct eth_rx_bd *prod_bd = &fp->rx_desc_ring[prod];
01447     dma_addr_t mapping;
01448 
01449     /* move empty skb from pool to prod and map it */
01450     prod_rx_buf->skb = fp->tpa_pool[queue].skb;
01451     mapping = pci_map_single(bp->pdev, fp->tpa_pool[queue].skb->data,
01452                  bp->rx_buf_size, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01453     pci_unmap_addr_set(prod_rx_buf, mapping, mapping);
01454 
01455     /* move partial skb from cons to pool (don't unmap yet) */
01456     fp->tpa_pool[queue] = *cons_rx_buf;
01457 
01458     /* mark bin state as start - print error if current state != stop */
01459     if (fp->tpa_state[queue] != BNX2X_TPA_STOP)
01460         BNX2X_ERR("start of bin not in stop [%d]\n", queue);
01461 
01462     fp->tpa_state[queue] = BNX2X_TPA_START;
01463 
01464     /* point prod_bd to new skb */
01465     prod_bd->addr_hi = cpu_to_le32(U64_HI(mapping));
01466     prod_bd->addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(U64_LO(mapping));
01467 
01468 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
01469     fp->tpa_queue_used |= (1 << queue);
01470 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01471 #ifdef _ASM_GENERIC_INT_L64_H
01472     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS, "fp->tpa_queue_used = 0x%lx\n",
01473 #else
01474     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS, "fp->tpa_queue_used = 0x%llx\n",
01475 #endif
01476 #else
01477 #if defined(__powerpc64__) || defined(_ASM_IA64_TYPES_H)
01478     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS, "fp->tpa_queue_used = 0x%lx\n",
01479 #else
01480     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS, "fp->tpa_queue_used = 0x%llx\n",
01481 #endif
01482 #endif
01483        fp->tpa_queue_used);
01484 #endif
01485 }
01486 
01487 static int bnx2x_fill_frag_skb(struct bnx2x *bp, struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
01488                    struct sk_buff *skb,
01489                    struct eth_fast_path_rx_cqe *fp_cqe,
01490                    u16 cqe_idx)
01491 {
01492     struct sw_rx_page *rx_pg, old_rx_pg;
01493     u16 len_on_bd = le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->len_on_bd);
01494     u32 i, frag_len, frag_size, pages;
01495     int err;
01496     int j;
01497 
01498     frag_size = le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->pkt_len) - len_on_bd;
01499     pages = SGE_PAGE_ALIGN(frag_size) >> SGE_PAGE_SHIFT;
01500 
01501     /* This is needed in order to enable forwarding support */
01502     if (frag_size)
01503         skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_size = min((u32)SGE_PAGE_SIZE,
01504                            max(frag_size, (u32)len_on_bd));
01505 
01506 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
01507     if (pages > min_t(u32, 8, MAX_SKB_FRAGS)*SGE_PAGE_SIZE*PAGES_PER_SGE) {
01508         BNX2X_ERR("SGL length is too long: %d. CQE index is %d\n",
01509               pages, cqe_idx);
01510         BNX2X_ERR("fp_cqe->pkt_len = %d  fp_cqe->len_on_bd = %d\n",
01511               fp_cqe->pkt_len, len_on_bd);
01512         bnx2x_panic();
01513         return -EINVAL;
01514     }
01515 #endif
01516 
01517     /* Run through the SGL and compose the fragmented skb */
01518     for (i = 0, j = 0; i < pages; i += PAGES_PER_SGE, j++) {
01519         u16 sge_idx = RX_SGE(le16_to_cpu(fp_cqe->sgl[j]));
01520 
01521         /* FW gives the indices of the SGE as if the ring is an array
01522            (meaning that "next" element will consume 2 indices) */
01523         frag_len = min(frag_size, (u32)(SGE_PAGE_SIZE*PAGES_PER_SGE));
01524         rx_pg = &fp->rx_page_ring[sge_idx];
01525         old_rx_pg = *rx_pg;
01526 
01527         /* If we fail to allocate a substitute page, we simply stop
01528            where we are and drop the whole packet */
01529         err = bnx2x_alloc_rx_sge(bp, fp, sge_idx);
01530         if (unlikely(err)) {
01531             fp->eth_q_stats.rx_skb_alloc_failed++;
01532             return err;
01533         }
01534 
01535         /* Unmap the page as we r going to pass it to the stack */
01536         pci_unmap_page(bp->pdev, pci_unmap_addr(&old_rx_pg, mapping),
01537                   SGE_PAGE_SIZE*PAGES_PER_SGE, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01538 
01539         /* Add one frag and update the appropriate fields in the skb */
01540         skb_fill_page_desc(skb, j, old_rx_pg.page, 0, frag_len);
01541 
01542         skb->data_len += frag_len;
01543         skb->truesize += frag_len;
01544         skb->len += frag_len;
01545 
01546         frag_size -= frag_len;
01547     }
01548 
01549     return 0;
01550 }
01551 
01552 static void bnx2x_tpa_stop(struct bnx2x *bp, struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
01553                u16 queue, int pad, int len, union eth_rx_cqe *cqe,
01554                u16 cqe_idx)
01555 {
01556     struct sw_rx_bd *rx_buf = &fp->tpa_pool[queue];
01557     struct sk_buff *skb = rx_buf->skb;
01558     /* alloc new skb */
01559     struct sk_buff *new_skb = netdev_alloc_skb(bp->dev, bp->rx_buf_size);
01560 
01561     /* Unmap skb in the pool anyway, as we are going to change
01562        pool entry status to BNX2X_TPA_STOP even if new skb allocation
01563        fails. */
01564     pci_unmap_single(bp->pdev, pci_unmap_addr(rx_buf, mapping),
01565              bp->rx_buf_size, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01566 
01567     if (likely(new_skb)) {
01568         /* fix ip xsum and give it to the stack */
01569         /* (no need to map the new skb) */
01570 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
01571         int is_vlan_cqe =
01572             (le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.pars_flags.flags) &
01573              PARSING_FLAGS_VLAN);
01574         int is_not_hwaccel_vlan_cqe =
01575             (is_vlan_cqe && (!(bp->flags & HW_VLAN_RX_FLAG)));
01576 #endif
01577 
01578         prefetch(skb);
01579         prefetch(((char *)(skb)) + 128);
01580 
01581 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
01582         if (pad + len > bp->rx_buf_size) {
01583             BNX2X_ERR("skb_put is about to fail...  "
01584                   "pad %d  len %d  rx_buf_size %d\n",
01585                   pad, len, bp->rx_buf_size);
01586             bnx2x_panic();
01587             return;
01588         }
01589 #endif
01590 
01591         skb_reserve(skb, pad);
01592         skb_put(skb, len);
01593 
01594         skb->protocol = eth_type_trans(skb, bp->dev);
01595         skb->ip_summed = CHECKSUM_UNNECESSARY;
01596 
01597 #ifdef HAVE_PF_RING
01598         {
01599           int debug = 0;
01600           struct pfring_hooks *hook = (struct pfring_hooks*)bp->dev->pfring_ptr;
01601           
01602           if(hook && (hook->magic == PF_RING)) {
01603             /* Wow: PF_RING is alive & kickin' ! */
01604             int rc;
01605               
01606             if(debug)
01607               printk(KERN_INFO "[PF_RING] alive [%s][len=%d][queue=%d/%d]\n",
01608                  bp->dev->name, skb->len,
01609                  fp->index  /* queue */, BNX2X_NUM_QUEUES(bp));
01610               
01611             if(*hook->transparent_mode != standard_linux_path) {
01612               rc = hook->ring_handler(skb, 1, 1, queue, BNX2X_NUM_QUEUES(bp));
01613               if(rc >= 1 /* Packet handled by PF_RING */) {
01614             if(*hook->transparent_mode == driver2pf_ring_non_transparent) {
01615               /* PF_RING has already freed the memory */
01616               goto next_pkt;
01617             }
01618               }
01619             } else {
01620               if(debug) printk(KERN_INFO "[PF_RING] present but transparent_mode=0\n");
01621             }
01622           } else {
01623               if(debug) printk(KERN_INFO "[PF_RING] not present on %s [hook=%p]\n",
01624                        bp->dev->name, hook);
01625           }
01626         }
01627 #endif
01628 
01629         {
01630             struct iphdr *iph;
01631 
01632             iph = (struct iphdr *)skb->data;
01633 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
01634             /* If there is no Rx VLAN offloading -
01635                take VLAN tag into an account */
01636             if (unlikely(is_not_hwaccel_vlan_cqe))
01637                 iph = (struct iphdr *)((u8 *)iph + VLAN_HLEN);
01638 #endif
01639             iph->check = 0;
01640             iph->check = ip_fast_csum((u8 *)iph, iph->ihl);
01641         }
01642 
01643         if (!bnx2x_fill_frag_skb(bp, fp, skb,
01644                      &cqe->fast_path_cqe, cqe_idx)) {
01645 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
01646             if ((bp->vlgrp != NULL) && is_vlan_cqe &&
01647                 (!is_not_hwaccel_vlan_cqe))
01648                 vlan_gro_receive(&fp->napi, bp->vlgrp,
01649                          le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.
01650                                  vlan_tag), skb); 
01651             else
01652 #endif
01653                 napi_gro_receive(&fp->napi, skb);
01654         } else {
01655             DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS, "Failed to allocate new pages"
01656                " - dropping packet!\n");
01657             dev_kfree_skb(skb);
01658         }
01659 
01660 #ifdef HAVE_PF_RING
01661     next_pkt:
01662 #endif
01663 
01664 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061b) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01665         bp->dev->last_rx = jiffies;
01666 #endif
01667 
01668         /* put new skb in bin */
01669         fp->tpa_pool[queue].skb = new_skb;
01670 
01671     } else {
01672         /* else drop the packet and keep the buffer in the bin */
01673         DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS,
01674            "Failed to allocate new skb - dropping packet!\n");
01675         fp->eth_q_stats.rx_skb_alloc_failed++;
01676     }
01677 
01678     fp->tpa_state[queue] = BNX2X_TPA_STOP;
01679 }
01680 #endif
01681 
01682 static inline void bnx2x_update_rx_prod(struct bnx2x *bp,
01683                     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
01684                     u16 bd_prod, u16 rx_comp_prod,
01685                     u16 rx_sge_prod)
01686 {
01687     struct ustorm_eth_rx_producers rx_prods = {0};
01688     int i;
01689 
01690     /* Update producers */
01691     rx_prods.bd_prod = bd_prod;
01692     rx_prods.cqe_prod = rx_comp_prod;
01693     rx_prods.sge_prod = rx_sge_prod;
01694 
01695     /*
01696      * Make sure that the BD and SGE data is updated before updating the
01697      * producers since FW might read the BD/SGE right after the producer
01698      * is updated.
01699      * This is only applicable for weak-ordered memory model archs such
01700      * as IA-64. The following barrier is also mandatory since FW will
01701      * assumes BDs must have buffers.
01702      */
01703     wmb();
01704 
01705     for (i = 0; i < sizeof(struct ustorm_eth_rx_producers)/4; i++)
01706         REG_WR(bp, BAR_USTRORM_INTMEM +
01707                USTORM_RX_PRODS_OFFSET(BP_PORT(bp), fp->cl_id) + i*4,
01708                ((u32 *)&rx_prods)[i]);
01709 
01710     mmiowb(); /* keep prod updates ordered */
01711 
01712     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS,
01713        "queue[%d]:  wrote  bd_prod %u  cqe_prod %u  sge_prod %u\n",
01714        fp->index, bd_prod, rx_comp_prod, rx_sge_prod);
01715 }
01716 
01717 static int bnx2x_rx_int(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp, int budget)
01718 {
01719     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
01720     u16 bd_cons, bd_prod, bd_prod_fw, comp_ring_cons;
01721     u16 hw_comp_cons, sw_comp_cons, sw_comp_prod;
01722     int rx_pkt = 0;
01723 
01724 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
01725     if (unlikely(bp->panic))
01726         return 0;
01727 #endif
01728 
01729     /* CQ "next element" is of the size of the regular element,
01730        that's why it's ok here */
01731     hw_comp_cons = le16_to_cpu(*fp->rx_cons_sb);
01732     if ((hw_comp_cons & MAX_RCQ_DESC_CNT) == MAX_RCQ_DESC_CNT)
01733         hw_comp_cons++;
01734 
01735     bd_cons = fp->rx_bd_cons;
01736     bd_prod = fp->rx_bd_prod;
01737     bd_prod_fw = bd_prod;
01738     sw_comp_cons = fp->rx_comp_cons;
01739     sw_comp_prod = fp->rx_comp_prod;
01740 
01741     /* Memory barrier necessary as speculative reads of the rx
01742      * buffer can be ahead of the index in the status block
01743      */
01744     rmb();
01745 
01746     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS,
01747        "queue[%d]:  hw_comp_cons %u  sw_comp_cons %u\n",
01748        fp->index, hw_comp_cons, sw_comp_cons);
01749 
01750     while (sw_comp_cons != hw_comp_cons) {
01751         struct sw_rx_bd *rx_buf = NULL;
01752         struct sk_buff *skb;
01753         union eth_rx_cqe *cqe;
01754         u8 cqe_fp_flags;
01755         u16 len, pad;
01756 
01757         comp_ring_cons = RCQ_BD(sw_comp_cons);
01758         bd_prod = RX_BD(bd_prod);
01759         bd_cons = RX_BD(bd_cons);
01760 
01761         /* Prefetch the page containing the BD descriptor
01762            at producer's index. It will be needed when new skb is
01763            allocated */
01764         prefetch((void *)(PAGE_ALIGN((unsigned long)
01765                          (&fp->rx_desc_ring[bd_prod])) -
01766                   PAGE_SIZE + 1));
01767 
01768         cqe = &fp->rx_comp_ring[comp_ring_cons];
01769         cqe_fp_flags = cqe->fast_path_cqe.type_error_flags;
01770 
01771         DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS, "CQE type %x  err %x  status %x"
01772            "  queue %x  vlan %x  len %u\n", CQE_TYPE(cqe_fp_flags),
01773            cqe_fp_flags, cqe->fast_path_cqe.status_flags,
01774            le32_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.rss_hash_result),
01775            le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.vlan_tag),
01776            le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.pkt_len));
01777 
01778         /* is this a slowpath msg? */
01779         if (unlikely(CQE_TYPE(cqe_fp_flags))) {
01780             bnx2x_sp_event(fp, cqe);
01781             goto next_cqe;
01782 
01783         /* this is an rx packet */
01784         } else {
01785             rx_buf = &fp->rx_buf_ring[bd_cons];
01786             skb = rx_buf->skb;
01787             prefetch(skb);
01788             prefetch((u8 *)skb + 256);
01789             len = le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.pkt_len);
01790             pad = cqe->fast_path_cqe.placement_offset;
01791 
01792 #if !defined(__NO_TPA__) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01793             /* If CQE is marked both TPA_START and TPA_END
01794                it is a non-TPA CQE */
01795             if ((!fp->disable_tpa) &&
01796                 (TPA_TYPE(cqe_fp_flags) !=
01797                     (TPA_TYPE_START | TPA_TYPE_END))) {
01798                 u16 queue = cqe->fast_path_cqe.queue_index;
01799 
01800                 if (TPA_TYPE(cqe_fp_flags) == TPA_TYPE_START) {
01801                     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS,
01802                        "calling tpa_start on queue %d\n",
01803                        queue);
01804 
01805                     bnx2x_tpa_start(fp, queue, skb,
01806                             bd_cons, bd_prod);
01807                     goto next_rx;
01808                 }
01809 
01810                 if (TPA_TYPE(cqe_fp_flags) == TPA_TYPE_END) {
01811                     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_STATUS,
01812                        "calling tpa_stop on queue %d\n",
01813                        queue);
01814 
01815                     if (!BNX2X_RX_SUM_FIX(cqe))
01816                         BNX2X_ERR("STOP on none TCP "
01817                               "data\n");
01818 
01819                     /* This is a size of the linear data
01820                        on this skb */
01821                     len = le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.
01822                                 len_on_bd);
01823                     bnx2x_tpa_stop(bp, fp, queue, pad,
01824                             len, cqe, comp_ring_cons);
01825 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
01826                     if (bp->panic)
01827                         return 0;
01828 #endif
01829 
01830                     bnx2x_update_sge_prod(fp,
01831                             &cqe->fast_path_cqe);
01832                     goto next_cqe;
01833                 }
01834             }
01835 #endif
01836 
01837             pci_dma_sync_single_for_device(bp->pdev,
01838                     pci_unmap_addr(rx_buf, mapping),
01839                                pad + RX_COPY_THRESH,
01840                                PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01841             prefetch(skb);
01842             prefetch(((char *)(skb)) + 128);
01843 
01844             /* is this an error packet? */
01845             if (unlikely(cqe_fp_flags & ETH_RX_ERROR_FALGS)) {
01846                 DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_ERR,
01847                    "ERROR  flags %x  rx packet %u\n",
01848                    cqe_fp_flags, sw_comp_cons);
01849                 fp->eth_q_stats.rx_err_discard_pkt++;
01850                 goto reuse_rx;
01851             }
01852 
01853             /* Since we don't have a jumbo ring
01854              * copy small packets if mtu > 1500
01855              */
01856             if ((bp->dev->mtu > ETH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE) &&
01857                 (len <= RX_COPY_THRESH)) {
01858                 struct sk_buff *new_skb;
01859 
01860                 new_skb = netdev_alloc_skb(bp->dev,
01861                                len + pad);
01862                 if (new_skb == NULL) {
01863                     DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_ERR,
01864                        "ERROR  packet dropped "
01865                        "because of alloc failure\n");
01866                     fp->eth_q_stats.rx_skb_alloc_failed++;
01867                     goto reuse_rx;
01868                 }
01869 
01870                 /* aligned copy */
01871                 skb_copy_from_linear_data_offset(skb, pad,
01872                             new_skb->data + pad, len);
01873                 skb_reserve(new_skb, pad);
01874                 skb_put(new_skb, len);
01875 
01876                 bnx2x_reuse_rx_skb(fp, skb, bd_cons, bd_prod);
01877 
01878                 skb = new_skb;
01879 
01880             } else
01881             if (likely(bnx2x_alloc_rx_skb(bp, fp, bd_prod) == 0)) {
01882                 pci_unmap_single(bp->pdev,
01883                     pci_unmap_addr(rx_buf, mapping),
01884                          bp->rx_buf_size,
01885                          PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
01886                 skb_reserve(skb, pad);
01887                 skb_put(skb, len);
01888 
01889             } else {
01890                 DP(NETIF_MSG_RX_ERR,
01891                    "ERROR  packet dropped because "
01892                    "of alloc failure\n");
01893                 fp->eth_q_stats.rx_skb_alloc_failed++;
01894 reuse_rx:
01895                 bnx2x_reuse_rx_skb(fp, skb, bd_cons, bd_prod);
01896                 goto next_rx;
01897             }
01898 
01899             skb->protocol = eth_type_trans(skb, bp->dev);
01900 
01901             skb->ip_summed = CHECKSUM_NONE;
01902             if (bp->rx_csum) {
01903                 if (likely(BNX2X_RX_CSUM_OK(cqe)))
01904                     skb->ip_summed = CHECKSUM_UNNECESSARY;
01905                 else
01906                     fp->eth_q_stats.hw_csum_err++;
01907             }
01908         }
01909 
01910         skb_record_rx_queue(skb, fp->index);
01911 
01912 #if defined(__VMKLNX__) && defined(__VMKNETDDI_QUEUEOPS__) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01913         vmknetddi_queueops_set_skb_queueid(skb,
01914                 VMKNETDDI_QUEUEOPS_MK_RX_QUEUEID(fp->index));
01915 #endif
01916 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
01917         if ((bp->vlgrp != NULL) && (bp->flags & HW_VLAN_RX_FLAG) &&
01918             (le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.pars_flags.flags) &
01919              PARSING_FLAGS_VLAN))
01920             vlan_gro_receive(&fp->napi, bp->vlgrp,
01921                 le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.vlan_tag), skb); 
01922         else
01923 #endif
01924 
01925 #ifdef HAVE_PF_RING
01926         {
01927 
01928           int debug = 0;
01929           struct pfring_hooks *hook = (struct pfring_hooks*)bp->dev->pfring_ptr;
01930           
01931           if(hook && (hook->magic == PF_RING)) {
01932             /* Wow: PF_RING is alive & kickin' ! */
01933             int rc, queue = fp->index;
01934               
01935             if(debug)
01936               printk(KERN_INFO "[2] [PF_RING] alive [%s][len=%d][queue=%d/%d]\n",
01937                  bp->dev->name, skb->len,
01938                  queue, BNX2X_NUM_QUEUES(bp));
01939               
01940             if(*hook->transparent_mode != standard_linux_path) {
01941               rc = hook->ring_handler(skb, 1, 1, queue, BNX2X_NUM_QUEUES(bp));
01942               if(rc == 1 /* Packet handled by PF_RING */) {
01943             if(*hook->transparent_mode == driver2pf_ring_non_transparent) {
01944               /* PF_RING has already freed the memory */
01945               goto next_pkt2;
01946             }
01947               }
01948             } else {
01949               if(debug) printk(KERN_INFO "[2] [PF_RING] present but transparent_mode=0\n");
01950             }
01951           } else {
01952               if(debug) printk(KERN_INFO "[2] [PF_RING] not present on %s [hook=%p]\n",
01953                        bp->dev->name, hook);
01954           }
01955         }
01956 #endif
01957 
01958             napi_gro_receive(&fp->napi, skb);
01959          
01960 
01961 #ifdef HAVE_PF_RING
01962     next_pkt2:
01963 #endif
01964 
01965 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061b) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
01966         bp->dev->last_rx = jiffies;
01967 #endif
01968 
01969 next_rx:
01970         rx_buf->skb = NULL;
01971 
01972         bd_cons = NEXT_RX_IDX(bd_cons);
01973         bd_prod = NEXT_RX_IDX(bd_prod);
01974         bd_prod_fw = NEXT_RX_IDX(bd_prod_fw);
01975         rx_pkt++;
01976 next_cqe:
01977         sw_comp_prod = NEXT_RCQ_IDX(sw_comp_prod);
01978         sw_comp_cons = NEXT_RCQ_IDX(sw_comp_cons);
01979 
01980         if (rx_pkt == budget)
01981             break;
01982     } /* while */
01983 
01984     fp->rx_bd_cons = bd_cons;
01985     fp->rx_bd_prod = bd_prod_fw;
01986     fp->rx_comp_cons = sw_comp_cons;
01987     fp->rx_comp_prod = sw_comp_prod;
01988 
01989     /* Update producers */
01990     bnx2x_update_rx_prod(bp, fp, bd_prod_fw, sw_comp_prod,
01991                  fp->rx_sge_prod);
01992 
01993     fp->rx_pkt += rx_pkt;
01994     fp->rx_calls++;
01995 
01996     return rx_pkt;
01997 }
01998 
01999 #ifdef CONFIG_PCI_MSI /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
02000 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020613) && (VMWARE_ESX_DDK_VERSION < 4000)
02001 static irqreturn_t bnx2x_msix_fp_int(int irq, void *fp_cookie,
02002                      struct pt_regs *regs)
02003 #else /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
02004 static irqreturn_t bnx2x_msix_fp_int(int irq, void *fp_cookie)
02005 #endif
02006 {
02007     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = fp_cookie;
02008     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
02009 
02010     /* Return here if interrupt is disabled */
02011     if (unlikely(atomic_read(&bp->intr_sem) != 0)) {
02012         DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "called but intr_sem not 0, returning\n");
02013         return IRQ_HANDLED;
02014     }
02015 
02016     DP(BNX2X_MSG_FP, "got an MSI-X interrupt on IDX:SB [%d:%d]\n",
02017        fp->index, fp->sb_id);
02018     bnx2x_ack_sb(bp, fp->sb_id, USTORM_ID, 0, IGU_INT_DISABLE, 0);
02019 
02020 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
02021     if (unlikely(bp->panic))
02022         return IRQ_HANDLED;
02023 #endif
02024 
02025     /* Handle Rx and Tx according to MSI-X vector */
02026     prefetch(fp->rx_cons_sb);
02027     prefetch(fp->tx_cons_sb);
02028     prefetch(&fp->status_blk->u_status_block.status_block_index);
02029     prefetch(&fp->status_blk->c_status_block.status_block_index);
02030 #ifdef BNX2X_NEW_NAPI /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
02031     napi_schedule(&bnx2x_fp(bp, fp->index, napi));
02032 #else
02033     napi_schedule(&bnx2x_fp(bp, fp->index, dummy_netdev));
02034 #endif
02035 
02036     return IRQ_HANDLED;
02037 }
02038 #endif
02039 
02040 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020613) && (VMWARE_ESX_DDK_VERSION < 40000)
02041 static irqreturn_t bnx2x_interrupt(int irq, void *dev_instance,
02042                    struct pt_regs *regs)
02043 #else /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
02044 static irqreturn_t bnx2x_interrupt(int irq, void *dev_instance)
02045 #endif
02046 {
02047     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev_instance);
02048     u16 status = bnx2x_ack_int(bp);
02049     u16 mask;
02050     int i;
02051 
02052     /* Return here if interrupt is shared and it's not for us */
02053     if (unlikely(status == 0)) {
02054         DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "not our interrupt!\n");
02055         return IRQ_NONE;
02056     }
02057     DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "got an interrupt  status 0x%x\n", status);
02058 
02059     /* Return here if interrupt is disabled */
02060     if (unlikely(atomic_read(&bp->intr_sem) != 0)) {
02061         DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "called but intr_sem not 0, returning\n");
02062         return IRQ_HANDLED;
02063     }
02064 
02065 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
02066     if (unlikely(bp->panic))
02067         return IRQ_HANDLED;
02068 #endif
02069 
02070     for (i = 0; i < BNX2X_NUM_QUEUES(bp); i++) {
02071         struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = &bp->fp[i];
02072 
02073         mask = 0x2 << fp->sb_id;
02074         if (status & mask) {
02075             /* Handle Rx and Tx according to SB id */
02076             prefetch(fp->rx_cons_sb);
02077             prefetch(&fp->status_blk->u_status_block.
02078                         status_block_index);
02079             prefetch(fp->tx_cons_sb);
02080             prefetch(&fp->status_blk->c_status_block.
02081                         status_block_index);
02082 #ifdef BNX2X_NEW_NAPI /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
02083             napi_schedule(&bnx2x_fp(bp, fp->index, napi));
02084 #else
02085             napi_schedule(&bnx2x_fp(bp, fp->index, dummy_netdev));
02086 #endif
02087             status &= ~mask;
02088         }
02089     }
02090 
02091 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
02092     mask = 0x2 << CNIC_SB_ID(bp);
02093     if (status & mask) {
02094         struct cnic_ops *c_ops = NULL;
02095 
02096         rcu_read_lock();
02097         c_ops = rcu_dereference(bp->cnic_ops);
02098         if (c_ops)
02099             c_ops->cnic_handler(bp->cnic_data, NULL);
02100         rcu_read_unlock();
02101 
02102         status &= ~mask;
02103     }
02104 #endif
02105 
02106     if (unlikely(status & 0x1)) {
02107 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
02108         queue_delayed_work(bnx2x_wq, &bp->sp_task, 0);
02109 #else
02110         queue_work(bnx2x_wq, &bp->sp_task);
02111 #endif
02112 
02113         status &= ~0x1;
02114         if (!status)
02115             return IRQ_HANDLED;
02116     }
02117 
02118     if (unlikely(status))
02119         DP(NETIF_MSG_INTR, "got an unknown interrupt! (status 0x%x)\n",
02120            status);
02121 
02122     return IRQ_HANDLED;
02123 }
02124 
02125 /* end of fast path */
02126 
02127 static void bnx2x_stats_handle(struct bnx2x *bp, enum bnx2x_stats_event event);
02128 
02129 /* Link */
02130 
02131 /*
02132  * General service functions
02133  */
02134 
02135 static int bnx2x_acquire_hw_lock(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 resource)
02136 {
02137     u32 lock_status;
02138     u32 resource_bit = (1 << resource);
02139     int func = BP_FUNC(bp);
02140     u32 hw_lock_control_reg;
02141     int cnt;
02142 
02143     /* Validating that the resource is within range */
02144     if (resource > HW_LOCK_MAX_RESOURCE_VALUE) {
02145         DP(NETIF_MSG_HW,
02146            "resource(0x%x) > HW_LOCK_MAX_RESOURCE_VALUE(0x%x)\n",
02147            resource, HW_LOCK_MAX_RESOURCE_VALUE);
02148         return -EINVAL;
02149     }
02150 
02151     if (func <= 5) {
02152         hw_lock_control_reg = (MISC_REG_DRIVER_CONTROL_1 + func*8);
02153     } else {
02154         hw_lock_control_reg =
02155                 (MISC_REG_DRIVER_CONTROL_7 + (func - 6)*8);
02156     }
02157 
02158     /* Validating that the resource is not already taken */
02159     lock_status = REG_RD(bp, hw_lock_control_reg);
02160     if (lock_status & resource_bit) {
02161         DP(NETIF_MSG_HW, "lock_status 0x%x  resource_bit 0x%x\n",
02162            lock_status, resource_bit);
02163         return -EEXIST;
02164     }
02165 
02166     /* Try for 5 second every 5ms */
02167     for (cnt = 0; cnt < 1000; cnt++) {
02168         /* Try to acquire the lock */
02169         REG_WR(bp, hw_lock_control_reg + 4, resource_bit);
02170         lock_status = REG_RD(bp, hw_lock_control_reg);
02171         if (lock_status & resource_bit)
02172             return 0;
02173 
02174         msleep(5);
02175     }
02176     DP(NETIF_MSG_HW, "Timeout\n");
02177     return -EAGAIN;
02178 }
02179 
02180 static int bnx2x_release_hw_lock(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 resource)
02181 {
02182     u32 lock_status;
02183     u32 resource_bit = (1 << resource);
02184     int func = BP_FUNC(bp);
02185     u32 hw_lock_control_reg;
02186 
02187     /* Validating that the resource is within range */
02188     if (resource > HW_LOCK_MAX_RESOURCE_VALUE) {
02189         DP(NETIF_MSG_HW,
02190            "resource(0x%x) > HW_LOCK_MAX_RESOURCE_VALUE(0x%x)\n",
02191            resource, HW_LOCK_MAX_RESOURCE_VALUE);
02192         return -EINVAL;
02193     }
02194 
02195     if (func <= 5) {
02196         hw_lock_control_reg = (MISC_REG_DRIVER_CONTROL_1 + func*8);
02197     } else {
02198         hw_lock_control_reg =
02199                 (MISC_REG_DRIVER_CONTROL_7 + (func - 6)*8);
02200     }
02201 
02202     /* Validating that the resource is currently taken */
02203     lock_status = REG_RD(bp, hw_lock_control_reg);
02204     if (!(lock_status & resource_bit)) {
02205         DP(NETIF_MSG_HW, "lock_status 0x%x  resource_bit 0x%x\n",
02206            lock_status, resource_bit);
02207         return -EFAULT;
02208     }
02209 
02210     REG_WR(bp, hw_lock_control_reg, resource_bit);
02211     return 0;
02212 }
02213 
02214 /* HW Lock for shared dual port PHYs */
02215 static void bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(struct bnx2x *bp)
02216 {
02217     mutex_lock(&bp->port.phy_mutex);
02218 
02219     if (bp->port.need_hw_lock)
02220         bnx2x_acquire_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_MDIO);
02221 }
02222 
02223 static void bnx2x_release_phy_lock(struct bnx2x *bp)
02224 {
02225     if (bp->port.need_hw_lock)
02226         bnx2x_release_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_MDIO);
02227 
02228     mutex_unlock(&bp->port.phy_mutex);
02229 }
02230 
02231 int bnx2x_get_gpio(struct bnx2x *bp, int gpio_num, u8 port)
02232 {
02233     /* The GPIO should be swapped if swap register is set and active */
02234     int gpio_port = (REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_PORT_SWAP) &&
02235              REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_STRAP_OVERRIDE)) ^ port;
02236     int gpio_shift = gpio_num +
02237             (gpio_port ? MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_PORT_SHIFT : 0);
02238     u32 gpio_mask = (1 << gpio_shift);
02239     u32 gpio_reg;
02240     int value;
02241 
02242     if (gpio_num > MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_3) {
02243         BNX2X_ERR("Invalid GPIO %d\n", gpio_num);
02244         return -EINVAL;
02245     }
02246 
02247     /* read GPIO value */
02248     gpio_reg = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_GPIO);
02249 
02250     /* get the requested pin value */
02251     if ((gpio_reg & gpio_mask) == gpio_mask)
02252         value = 1;
02253     else
02254         value = 0;
02255 
02256     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "pin %d  value 0x%x\n", gpio_num, value);
02257 
02258     return value;
02259 }
02260 
02261 int bnx2x_set_gpio(struct bnx2x *bp, int gpio_num, u32 mode, u8 port)
02262 {
02263     /* The GPIO should be swapped if swap register is set and active */
02264     int gpio_port = (REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_PORT_SWAP) &&
02265              REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_STRAP_OVERRIDE)) ^ port;
02266     int gpio_shift = gpio_num +
02267             (gpio_port ? MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_PORT_SHIFT : 0);
02268     u32 gpio_mask = (1 << gpio_shift);
02269     u32 gpio_reg;
02270 
02271     if (gpio_num > MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_3) {
02272         BNX2X_ERR("Invalid GPIO %d\n", gpio_num);
02273         return -EINVAL;
02274     }
02275 
02276     bnx2x_acquire_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_GPIO);
02277     /* read GPIO and mask except the float bits */
02278     gpio_reg = (REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_GPIO) & MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_FLOAT);
02279 
02280     switch (mode) {
02281     case MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_OUTPUT_LOW:
02282         DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "Set GPIO %d (shift %d) -> output low\n",
02283            gpio_num, gpio_shift);
02284         /* clear FLOAT and set CLR */
02285         gpio_reg &= ~(gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_FLOAT_POS);
02286         gpio_reg |=  (gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_CLR_POS);
02287         break;
02288 
02289     case MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_OUTPUT_HIGH:
02290         DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "Set GPIO %d (shift %d) -> output high\n",
02291            gpio_num, gpio_shift);
02292         /* clear FLOAT and set SET */
02293         gpio_reg &= ~(gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_FLOAT_POS);
02294         gpio_reg |=  (gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_SET_POS);
02295         break;
02296 
02297     case MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_INPUT_HI_Z:
02298         DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "Set GPIO %d (shift %d) -> input\n",
02299            gpio_num, gpio_shift);
02300         /* set FLOAT */
02301         gpio_reg |= (gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_FLOAT_POS);
02302         break;
02303 
02304     default:
02305         break;
02306     }
02307 
02308     REG_WR(bp, MISC_REG_GPIO, gpio_reg);
02309     bnx2x_release_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_GPIO);
02310 
02311     return 0;
02312 }
02313 
02314 int bnx2x_set_gpio_int(struct bnx2x *bp, int gpio_num, u32 mode, u8 port)
02315 {
02316     /* The GPIO should be swapped if swap register is set and active */
02317     int gpio_port = (REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_PORT_SWAP) &&
02318              REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_STRAP_OVERRIDE)) ^ port;
02319     int gpio_shift = gpio_num +
02320             (gpio_port ? MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_PORT_SHIFT : 0);
02321     u32 gpio_mask = (1 << gpio_shift);
02322     u32 gpio_reg;
02323 
02324     if (gpio_num > MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_3) {
02325         BNX2X_ERR("Invalid GPIO %d\n", gpio_num);
02326         return -EINVAL;
02327     }
02328 
02329     bnx2x_acquire_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_GPIO);
02330     /* read GPIO int */
02331     gpio_reg = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_GPIO_INT);
02332 
02333     switch (mode) {
02334     case MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_INT_OUTPUT_CLR:
02335         DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "Clear GPIO INT %d (shift %d) -> "
02336                    "output low\n", gpio_num, gpio_shift);
02337         /* clear SET and set CLR */
02338         gpio_reg &= ~(gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_INT_SET_POS);
02339         gpio_reg |=  (gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_INT_CLR_POS);
02340         break;
02341 
02342     case MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_INT_OUTPUT_SET:
02343         DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "Set GPIO INT %d (shift %d) -> "
02344                    "output high\n", gpio_num, gpio_shift);
02345         /* clear CLR and set SET */
02346         gpio_reg &= ~(gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_INT_CLR_POS);
02347         gpio_reg |=  (gpio_mask << MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_INT_SET_POS);
02348         break;
02349 
02350     default:
02351         break;
02352     }
02353 
02354     REG_WR(bp, MISC_REG_GPIO_INT, gpio_reg);
