08690     }
08691 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
08692     /* Clear iSCSI L2 MAC */
08693     mutex_lock(&bp->cnic_mutex);
08694     if (bp->cnic_flags & BNX2X_CNIC_FLAG_MAC_SET) {
08695         bnx2x_set_iscsi_eth_mac_addr(bp, 0);
08696         bp->cnic_flags &= ~BNX2X_CNIC_FLAG_MAC_SET;
08697     }
08698     mutex_unlock(&bp->cnic_mutex);
08699 #endif
08700 
08701     if (unload_mode == UNLOAD_NORMAL)
08702         reset_code = DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_REQ_WOL_DIS;
08703 
08704     else if (bp->flags & NO_WOL_FLAG)
08705         reset_code = DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_REQ_WOL_MCP;
08706 
08707     else if (bp->wol) {
08708         u32 emac_base = port ? GRCBASE_EMAC1 : GRCBASE_EMAC0;
08709         u8 *mac_addr = bp->dev->dev_addr;
08710         u32 val;
08711         /* The mac address is written to entries 1-4 to
08712            preserve entry 0 which is used by the PMF */
08713         u8 entry = (BP_E1HVN(bp) + 1)*8;
08714 
08715         val = (mac_addr[0] << 8) | mac_addr[1];
08716         EMAC_WR(bp, EMAC_REG_EMAC_MAC_MATCH + entry, val);
08717 
08718         val = (mac_addr[2] << 24) | (mac_addr[3] << 16) |
08719               (mac_addr[4] << 8) | mac_addr[5];
08720         EMAC_WR(bp, EMAC_REG_EMAC_MAC_MATCH + entry + 4, val);
08721 
08722         reset_code = DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_REQ_WOL_EN;
08723 
08724     } else
08725         reset_code = DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_REQ_WOL_DIS;
08726 
08727     /* Close multi and leading connections
08728        Completions for ramrods are collected in a synchronous way */
08729     for_each_nondefault_queue(bp, i)
08730         if (bnx2x_stop_multi(bp, i))
08731             goto unload_error;
08732 
08733     rc = bnx2x_stop_leading(bp);
08734     if (rc) {
08735         BNX2X_ERR("Stop leading failed!\n");
08736 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
08737         return -EBUSY;
08738 #else
08739         goto unload_error;
08740 #endif
08741     }
08742 
08743 unload_error:
08744     if (!BP_NOMCP(bp))
08745         reset_code = bnx2x_fw_command(bp, reset_code);
08746     else {
08747         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN, "NO MCP - load counts      %d, %d, %d\n",
08748            load_count[0], load_count[1], load_count[2]);
08749         load_count[0]--;
08750         load_count[1 + port]--;
08751         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN, "NO MCP - new load counts  %d, %d, %d\n",
08752            load_count[0], load_count[1], load_count[2]);
08753         if (load_count[0] == 0)
08754             reset_code = FW_MSG_CODE_DRV_UNLOAD_COMMON;
08755         else if (load_count[1 + port] == 0)
08756             reset_code = FW_MSG_CODE_DRV_UNLOAD_PORT;
08757         else
08758             reset_code = FW_MSG_CODE_DRV_UNLOAD_FUNCTION;
08759     }
08760 
08761     if ((reset_code == FW_MSG_CODE_DRV_UNLOAD_COMMON) ||
08762         (reset_code == FW_MSG_CODE_DRV_UNLOAD_PORT))
08763         bnx2x__link_reset(bp);
08764 
08765     /* Reset the chip */
08766     bnx2x_reset_chip(bp, reset_code);
08767 
08768     /* Report UNLOAD_DONE to MCP */
08769     if (!BP_NOMCP(bp))
08770         bnx2x_fw_command(bp, DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_DONE);
08771 
08772     bp->port.pmf = 0;
08773 
08774     /* Free SKBs, SGEs, TPA pool and driver internals */
08775     bnx2x_free_skbs(bp);
08776     for_each_queue(bp, i)
08777         bnx2x_free_rx_sge_range(bp, bp->fp + i, NUM_RX_SGE);
08778 #if (defined(BNX2X_NEW_NAPI) && (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061b)) || defined(USE_NAPI_GRO) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
08779     for_each_queue(bp, i)
08780         netif_napi_del(&bnx2x_fp(bp, i, napi));
08781 #endif
08782     bnx2x_free_mem(bp);
08783 
08784     bp->state = BNX2X_STATE_CLOSED;
08785 
08786     netif_carrier_off(bp->dev);
08787 
08788     return 0;
08789 }
08790 
08791 #if defined(INIT_DELAYED_WORK_DEFERRABLE) || defined(INIT_WORK_NAR) || (VMWARE_ESX_DDK_VERSION >= 40000) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
08792 static void bnx2x_reset_task(struct work_struct *work)
08793 {
08794     struct bnx2x *bp = container_of(work, struct bnx2x, reset_task);
08795 #else
08796 static void bnx2x_reset_task(void *data)
08797 {
08798     struct bnx2x *bp = (struct bnx2x *)data;
08799 #endif
08800 
08801 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
08802     BNX2X_ERR("reset task called but STOP_ON_ERROR defined"
08803           " so reset not done to allow debug dump,\n"
08804      KERN_ERR " you will need to reboot when done\n");
08805     return;
08806 #endif
08807 
08808     rtnl_lock();
08809 
08810     if (!netif_running(bp->dev))
08811         goto reset_task_exit;
08812 
08813     bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_NORMAL);
08814     bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_NORMAL);
08815 
08816 reset_task_exit:
08817     rtnl_unlock();
08818 }
08819 
08820 /* end of nic load/unload */
08821 
08822 /* ethtool_ops */
08823 
08824 /*
08825  * Init service functions
08826  */
08827 
08828 static inline u32 bnx2x_get_pretend_reg(struct bnx2x *bp, int func)
08829 {
08830     switch (func) {
08831     case 0: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F0;
08832     case 1: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F1;
08833     case 2: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F2;
08834     case 3: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F3;
08835     case 4: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F4;
08836     case 5: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F5;
08837     case 6: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F6;
08838     case 7: return PXP2_REG_PGL_PRETEND_FUNC_F7;
08839     default:
08840         BNX2X_ERR("Unsupported function index: %d\n", func);
08841         return (u32)(-1);
08842     }
08843 }
08844 
08845 static void bnx2x_undi_int_disable_e1h(struct bnx2x *bp, int orig_func)
08846 {
08847     u32 reg = bnx2x_get_pretend_reg(bp, orig_func), new_val;
08848 
08849     /* Flush all outstanding writes */
08850     mmiowb();
08851 
08852     /* Pretend to be function 0 */
08853     REG_WR(bp, reg, 0);
08854     /* Flush the GRC transaction (in the chip) */
08855     new_val = REG_RD(bp, reg);
08856     if (new_val != 0) {
08857         BNX2X_ERR("Hmmm... Pretend register wasn't updated: (0,%d)!\n",
08858               new_val);
08859         BUG();
08860     }
08861 
08862     /* From now we are in the "like-E1" mode */
08863     bnx2x_int_disable(bp);
08864 
08865     /* Flush all outstanding writes */
08866     mmiowb();
08867 
08868     /* Restore the original funtion settings */
08869     REG_WR(bp, reg, orig_func);
08870     new_val = REG_RD(bp, reg);
08871     if (new_val != orig_func) {
08872         BNX2X_ERR("Hmmm... Pretend register wasn't updated: (%d,%d)!\n",
08873               orig_func, new_val);
08874         BUG();
08875     }
08876 }
08877 
08878 static inline void bnx2x_undi_int_disable(struct bnx2x *bp, int func)
08879 {
08880     if (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp))
08881         bnx2x_undi_int_disable_e1h(bp, func);
08882     else
08883         bnx2x_int_disable(bp);
08884 }
08885 
08886 static void __devinit bnx2x_undi_unload(struct bnx2x *bp)
08887 {
08888     u32 val;
08889 
08890     /* Check if there is any driver already loaded */
08891     val = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_UNPREPARED);
08892     if (val == 0x1) {
08893         /* Check if it is the UNDI driver
08894          * UNDI driver initializes CID offset for normal bell to 0x7
08895          */
08896         bnx2x_acquire_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_UNDI);
08897         val = REG_RD(bp, DORQ_REG_NORM_CID_OFST);
08898         if (val == 0x7) {
08899             u32 reset_code = DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_REQ_WOL_DIS;
08900             /* save our func */
08901             int func = BP_FUNC(bp);
08902             u32 swap_en;
08903             u32 swap_val;
08904 
08905             /* clear the UNDI indication */
08906             REG_WR(bp, DORQ_REG_NORM_CID_OFST, 0);
08907 
08908             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("UNDI is active! reset device\n");
08909 
08910             /* try unload UNDI on port 0 */
08911             bp->func = 0;
08912             bp->fw_seq =
08913                    (SHMEM_RD(bp, func_mb[bp->func].drv_mb_header) &
08914                 DRV_MSG_SEQ_NUMBER_MASK);
08915             reset_code = bnx2x_fw_command(bp, reset_code);
08916 
08917             /* if UNDI is loaded on the other port */
08918             if (reset_code != FW_MSG_CODE_DRV_UNLOAD_COMMON) {
08919 
08920                 /* send "DONE" for previous unload */
08921                 bnx2x_fw_command(bp, DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_DONE);
08922 
08923                 /* unload UNDI on port 1 */
08924                 bp->func = 1;
08925                 bp->fw_seq =
08926                    (SHMEM_RD(bp, func_mb[bp->func].drv_mb_header) &
08927                     DRV_MSG_SEQ_NUMBER_MASK);
08928                 reset_code = DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_REQ_WOL_DIS;
08929 
08930                 bnx2x_fw_command(bp, reset_code);
08931             }
08932 
08933             /* now it's safe to release the lock */
08934             bnx2x_release_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_UNDI);
08935 
08936             bnx2x_undi_int_disable(bp, func);
08937 
08938             /* close input traffic and wait for it */
08939             /* Do not rcv packets to BRB */
08940             REG_WR(bp,
08941                   (BP_PORT(bp) ? NIG_REG_LLH1_BRB1_DRV_MASK :
08942                          NIG_REG_LLH0_BRB1_DRV_MASK), 0x0);
08943             /* Do not direct rcv packets that are not for MCP to
08944              * the BRB */
08945             REG_WR(bp,
08946                    (BP_PORT(bp) ? NIG_REG_LLH1_BRB1_NOT_MCP :
08947                           NIG_REG_LLH0_BRB1_NOT_MCP), 0x0);
08948             /* clear AEU */
08949             REG_WR(bp,
08950                  (BP_PORT(bp) ? MISC_REG_AEU_MASK_ATTN_FUNC_1 :
08951                         MISC_REG_AEU_MASK_ATTN_FUNC_0), 0);
08952             msleep(10);
08953 
08954             /* save NIG port swap info */
08955             swap_val = REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_PORT_SWAP);
08956             swap_en = REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_STRAP_OVERRIDE);
08957             /* reset device */
08958             REG_WR(bp,
08959                    GRCBASE_MISC + MISC_REGISTERS_RESET_REG_1_CLEAR,
08960                    0xd3ffffff);
08961             REG_WR(bp,
08962                    GRCBASE_MISC + MISC_REGISTERS_RESET_REG_2_CLEAR,
08963                    0x1403);
08964             /* take the NIG out of reset and restore swap values */
08965             REG_WR(bp,
08966                    GRCBASE_MISC + MISC_REGISTERS_RESET_REG_1_SET,
08967                    MISC_REGISTERS_RESET_REG_1_RST_NIG);
08968             REG_WR(bp, NIG_REG_PORT_SWAP, swap_val);
08969             REG_WR(bp, NIG_REG_STRAP_OVERRIDE, swap_en);
08970 
08971             /* send unload done to the MCP */
08972             bnx2x_fw_command(bp, DRV_MSG_CODE_UNLOAD_DONE);
08973 
08974             /* restore our func and fw_seq */
08975             bp->func = func;
08976             bp->fw_seq =
08977                    (SHMEM_RD(bp, func_mb[bp->func].drv_mb_header) &
08978                 DRV_MSG_SEQ_NUMBER_MASK);
08979 
08980         } else
08981             bnx2x_release_hw_lock(bp, HW_LOCK_RESOURCE_UNDI);
08982     }
08983 }
08984 
08985 static void __devinit bnx2x_get_common_hwinfo(struct bnx2x *bp)
08986 {
08987     u32 val, val2, val3, val4, id;
08988     u16 pmc;
08989 
08990     /* Get the chip revision id and number. */
08991     /* chip num:16-31, rev:12-15, metal:4-11, bond_id:0-3 */
08992     val = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_CHIP_NUM);
08993     id = ((val & 0xffff) << 16);
08994     val = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_CHIP_REV);
08995     id |= ((val & 0xf) << 12);
08996     val = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_CHIP_METAL);
08997     id |= ((val & 0xff) << 4);
08998     val = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_BOND_ID);
08999     id |= (val & 0xf);
09000     bp->common.chip_id = id;
09001     bp->link_params.chip_id = bp->common.chip_id;
09002     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("chip ID is 0x%x\n", id);
09003 
09004     val = (REG_RD(bp, 0x2874) & 0x55);
09005     if ((bp->common.chip_id & 0x1) ||
09006         (CHIP_IS_E1(bp) && val) || (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp) && (val == 0x55))) {
09007         bp->flags |= ONE_PORT_FLAG;
09008         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("single port device\n");
09009     }
09010 
09011     val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_CFG4);
09012     bp->common.flash_size = (NVRAM_1MB_SIZE <<
09013                  (val & MCPR_NVM_CFG4_FLASH_SIZE));
09014     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("flash_size 0x%x (%d)\n",
09015                bp->common.flash_size, bp->common.flash_size);
09016 
09017     bp->common.shmem_base = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_SHARED_MEM_ADDR);
09018     bp->common.shmem2_base = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_GENERIC_CR_0);
09019     bp->link_params.shmem_base = bp->common.shmem_base;
09020     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("shmem offset 0x%x  shmem2 offset 0x%x\n",
09021                bp->common.shmem_base, bp->common.shmem2_base);
09022 
09023     if (!bp->common.shmem_base ||
09024         (bp->common.shmem_base < 0xA0000) ||
09025         (bp->common.shmem_base >= 0xC0000)) {
09026         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("MCP not active\n");
09027         bp->flags |= NO_MCP_FLAG;
09028         return;
09029     }
09030 
09031     val = SHMEM_RD(bp, validity_map[BP_PORT(bp)]);
09032     if ((val & (SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_DEV_INFO | SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_MB))
09033         != (SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_DEV_INFO | SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_MB))
09034         BNX2X_ERROR("BAD MCP validity signature\n");
09035 
09036     bp->common.hw_config = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.shared_hw_config.config);
09037     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("hw_config 0x%08x\n", bp->common.hw_config);
09038 
09039     bp->link_params.hw_led_mode = ((bp->common.hw_config &
09040                     SHARED_HW_CFG_LED_MODE_MASK) >>
09041                        SHARED_HW_CFG_LED_MODE_SHIFT);
09042 
09043     bp->link_params.feature_config_flags = 0;
09044     val = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.shared_feature_config.config);
09045     if (val & SHARED_FEAT_CFG_OVERRIDE_PREEMPHASIS_CFG_ENABLED)
09046         bp->link_params.feature_config_flags |=
09047                 FEATURE_CONFIG_OVERRIDE_PREEMPHASIS_ENABLED;
09048     else
09049         bp->link_params.feature_config_flags &=
09050                 ~FEATURE_CONFIG_OVERRIDE_PREEMPHASIS_ENABLED;
09051 
09052     val = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.bc_rev) >> 8;
09053     bp->common.bc_ver = val;
09054     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("bc_ver %X\n", val);
09055     if (val < BNX2X_BC_VER) {
09056         /* for now only warn
09057          * later we might need to enforce this */
09058         BNX2X_ERROR("This driver needs bc_ver %X but found %X, "
09059                 "please upgrade BC\n", BNX2X_BC_VER, val);
09060     }
09061     bp->link_params.feature_config_flags |=
09062                 (val >= REQ_BC_VER_4_VRFY_OPT_MDL) ?
09063                 FEATURE_CONFIG_BC_SUPPORTS_OPT_MDL_VRFY : 0;
09064 
09065     if (BP_E1HVN(bp) == 0) {
09066         pci_read_config_word(bp->pdev, bp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_PMC, &pmc);
09067         bp->flags |= (pmc & PCI_PM_CAP_PME_D3cold) ? 0 : NO_WOL_FLAG;
09068     } else {
09069         /* no WOL capability for E1HVN != 0 */
09070         bp->flags |= NO_WOL_FLAG;
09071     }
09072     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("%sWoL capable\n",
09073                (bp->flags & NO_WOL_FLAG) ? "not " : "");
09074 
09075     val = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.shared_hw_config.part_num);
09076     val2 = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.shared_hw_config.part_num[4]);
09077     val3 = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.shared_hw_config.part_num[8]);
09078     val4 = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.shared_hw_config.part_num[12]);
09079 
09080     printk(KERN_INFO PFX "part number %X-%X-%X-%X\n",
09081            val, val2, val3, val4);
09082 }
09083 
09084 static void __devinit bnx2x_link_settings_supported(struct bnx2x *bp,
09085                             u32 switch_cfg)
09086 {
09087     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
09088     u32 ext_phy_type;
09089 
09090     switch (switch_cfg) {
09091     case SWITCH_CFG_1G:
09092         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("switch_cfg 0x%x (1G)\n", switch_cfg);
09093 
09094         ext_phy_type =
09095             SERDES_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09096         switch (ext_phy_type) {
09097         case PORT_HW_CFG_SERDES_EXT_PHY_TYPE_DIRECT:
09098             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (Direct)\n",
09099                        ext_phy_type);
09100 
09101             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half |
09102                            SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full |
09103                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half |
09104                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full |
09105                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09106                            SUPPORTED_2500baseX_Full |
09107                            SUPPORTED_TP |
09108                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09109                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09110                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09111                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09112             break;
09113 
09114         case PORT_HW_CFG_SERDES_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM5482:
09115             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (5482)\n",
09116                        ext_phy_type);
09117 
09118             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half |
09119                            SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full |
09120                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half |
09121                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full |
09122                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09123                            SUPPORTED_TP |
09124                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09125                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09126                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09127                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09128             break;
09129 
09130         default:
09131             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09132                     "BAD SerDes ext_phy_config 0x%x\n",
09133                     bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09134             return;
09135         }
09136 
09137         bp->port.phy_addr = REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_SERDES0_CTRL_PHY_ADDR +
09138                        port*0x10);
09139         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("phy_addr 0x%x\n", bp->port.phy_addr);
09140         break;
09141 
09142     case SWITCH_CFG_10G:
09143         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("switch_cfg 0x%x (10G)\n", switch_cfg);
09144 
09145         ext_phy_type =
09146             XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09147         switch (ext_phy_type) {
09148         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_DIRECT:
09149             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (Direct)\n",
09150                        ext_phy_type);
09151 
09152             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half |
09153                            SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full |
09154                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half |
09155                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full |
09156                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09157                            SUPPORTED_2500baseX_Full |
09158                            SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09159                            SUPPORTED_TP |
09160                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09161                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09162                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09163                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09164             break;
09165 
09166         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8072:
09167             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (8072)\n",
09168                        ext_phy_type);
09169 
09170             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09171                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09172                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09173                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09174                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09175                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09176             break;
09177 
09178         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8073:
09179             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (8073)\n",
09180                        ext_phy_type);
09181 
09182             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09183                            SUPPORTED_2500baseX_Full |
09184                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09185                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09186                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09187                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09188                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09189             break;
09190 
09191         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8705:
09192             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (8705)\n",
09193                        ext_phy_type);
09194 
09195             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09196                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09197                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09198                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09199             break;
09200 
09201         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8706:
09202             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (8706)\n",
09203                        ext_phy_type);
09204 
09205             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09206                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09207                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09208                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09209                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09210             break;
09211 
09212         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8726:
09213             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (8726)\n",
09214                        ext_phy_type);
09215 
09216             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09217                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09218                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09219                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09220                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09221                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09222             break;
09223 
09224         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8727:
09225             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (8727)\n",
09226                        ext_phy_type);
09227 
09228             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09229                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09230                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09231                            SUPPORTED_FIBRE |
09232                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09233                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09234             break;
09235 
09236         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_SFX7101:
09237             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (SFX7101)\n",
09238                        ext_phy_type);
09239 
09240             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09241                            SUPPORTED_TP |
09242                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09243                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09244                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09245             break;
09246 
09247         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8481:
09248         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM84823:
09249             BNX2X_DEV_INFO("ext_phy_type 0x%x (BCM8481)\n",
09250                        ext_phy_type);
09251 
09252             bp->port.supported |= (SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half |
09253                            SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full |
09254                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half |
09255                            SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full |
09256                            SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full |
09257                            SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full |
09258                            SUPPORTED_TP |
09259                            SUPPORTED_Autoneg |
09260                            SUPPORTED_Pause |
09261                            SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
09262             break;
09263 
09264         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_FAILURE:
09265             BNX2X_ERROR("XGXS PHY Failure detected 0x%x\n",
09266                     bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09267             break;
09268 
09269         default:
09270             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09271                     "BAD XGXS ext_phy_config 0x%x\n",
09272                     bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09273             return;
09274         }
09275 
09276         bp->port.phy_addr = REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_XGXS0_CTRL_PHY_ADDR +
09277                        port*0x18);
09278         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("phy_addr 0x%x\n", bp->port.phy_addr);
09279 
09280         break;
09281 
09282     default:
09283         BNX2X_ERROR("BAD switch_cfg link_config 0x%x\n",
09284                 bp->port.link_config);
09285         return;
09286     }
09287     bp->link_params.phy_addr = bp->port.phy_addr;
09288 
09289     /* mask what we support according to speed_cap_mask */
09290     if (!(bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask &
09291                 PORT_HW_CFG_SPEED_CAPABILITY_D0_10M_HALF))
09292         bp->port.supported &= ~SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half;
09293 
09294     if (!(bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask &
09295                 PORT_HW_CFG_SPEED_CAPABILITY_D0_10M_FULL))
09296         bp->port.supported &= ~SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full;
09297 
09298     if (!(bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask &
09299                 PORT_HW_CFG_SPEED_CAPABILITY_D0_100M_HALF))
09300         bp->port.supported &= ~SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half;
09301 
09302     if (!(bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask &
09303                 PORT_HW_CFG_SPEED_CAPABILITY_D0_100M_FULL))
09304         bp->port.supported &= ~SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full;
09305 
09306     if (!(bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask &
09307                     PORT_HW_CFG_SPEED_CAPABILITY_D0_1G))
09308         bp->port.supported &= ~(SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Half |
09309                     SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full);
09310 
09311     if (!(bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask &
09312                     PORT_HW_CFG_SPEED_CAPABILITY_D0_2_5G))
09313         bp->port.supported &= ~SUPPORTED_2500baseX_Full;
09314 
09315     if (!(bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask &
09316                     PORT_HW_CFG_SPEED_CAPABILITY_D0_10G))
09317         bp->port.supported &= ~SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full;
09318 
09319     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("supported 0x%x\n", bp->port.supported);
09320 }
09321 
09322 static void __devinit bnx2x_link_settings_requested(struct bnx2x *bp)
09323 {
09324     bp->link_params.req_duplex = DUPLEX_FULL;
09325 
09326     switch (bp->port.link_config & PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_MASK) {
09327     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_AUTO:
09328         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_Autoneg) {
09329             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_AUTO_NEG;
09330             bp->port.advertising = bp->port.supported;
09331         } else {
09332             u32 ext_phy_type =
09333                 XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09334 
09335             if ((ext_phy_type ==
09336                  PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8705) ||
09337                 (ext_phy_type ==
09338                  PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8706)) {
09339                 /* force 10G, no AN */
09340                 bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_10000;
09341                 bp->port.advertising =
09342                         (ADVERTISED_10000baseT_Full |
09343                          ADVERTISED_FIBRE);
09344                 break;
09345             }
09346             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09347                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09348                     "  autoneg not supported\n",
09349                     bp->port.link_config);
09350             return;
09351         }
09352         break;
09353 
09354     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_10M_FULL:
09355         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full) {
09356             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_10;
09357             bp->port.advertising = (ADVERTISED_10baseT_Full |
09358                         ADVERTISED_TP);
09359         } else {
09360             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09361                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09362                     "  speed_cap_mask 0x%x\n",
09363                     bp->port.link_config,
09364                     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask);
09365             return;
09366         }
09367         break;
09368 
09369     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_10M_HALF:
09370         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half) {
09371             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_10;
09372             bp->link_params.req_duplex = DUPLEX_HALF;
09373             bp->port.advertising = (ADVERTISED_10baseT_Half |
09374                         ADVERTISED_TP);
09375         } else {
09376             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09377                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09378                     "  speed_cap_mask 0x%x\n",
09379                     bp->port.link_config,
09380                     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask);
09381             return;
09382         }
09383         break;
09384 
09385     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_100M_FULL:
09386         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full) {
09387             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_100;
09388             bp->port.advertising = (ADVERTISED_100baseT_Full |
09389                         ADVERTISED_TP);
09390         } else {
09391             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09392                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09393                     "  speed_cap_mask 0x%x\n",
09394                     bp->port.link_config,
09395                     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask);
09396             return;
09397         }
09398         break;
09399 
09400     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_100M_HALF:
09401         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half) {
09402             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_100;
09403             bp->link_params.req_duplex = DUPLEX_HALF;
09404             bp->port.advertising = (ADVERTISED_100baseT_Half |
09405                         ADVERTISED_TP);
09406         } else {
09407             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09408                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09409                     "  speed_cap_mask 0x%x\n",
09410                     bp->port.link_config,
09411                     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask);
09412             return;
09413         }
09414         break;
09415 
09416     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_1G:
09417         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full) {
09418             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_1000;
09419             bp->port.advertising = (ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full |
09420                         ADVERTISED_TP);
09421         } else {
09422             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09423                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09424                     "  speed_cap_mask 0x%x\n",
09425                     bp->port.link_config,
09426                     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask);
09427             return;
09428         }
09429         break;
09430 
09431     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_2_5G:
09432         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_2500baseX_Full) {
09433             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_2500;
09434             bp->port.advertising = (ADVERTISED_2500baseX_Full |
09435                         ADVERTISED_TP);
09436         } else {
09437             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09438                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09439                     "  speed_cap_mask 0x%x\n",
09440                     bp->port.link_config,
09441                     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask);
09442             return;
09443         }
09444         break;
09445 
09446     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_10G_CX4:
09447     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_10G_KX4:
09448     case PORT_FEATURE_LINK_SPEED_10G_KR:
09449         if (bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full) {
09450             bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_10000;
09451             bp->port.advertising = (ADVERTISED_10000baseT_Full |
09452                         ADVERTISED_FIBRE);
09453         } else {
09454             BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09455                     "Invalid link_config 0x%x"
09456                     "  speed_cap_mask 0x%x\n",
09457                     bp->port.link_config,
09458                     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask);
09459             return;
09460         }
09461         break;
09462 
09463     default:
09464         BNX2X_ERROR("NVRAM config error. "
09465                 "BAD link speed link_config 0x%x\n",
09466                 bp->port.link_config);
09467         bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_AUTO_NEG;
09468         bp->port.advertising = bp->port.supported;
09469         break;
09470     }
09471 
09472     bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl = (bp->port.link_config &
09473                      PORT_FEATURE_FLOW_CONTROL_MASK);
09474     if ((bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl == BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_AUTO) &&
09475         !(bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_Autoneg))
09476         bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl = BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_NONE;
09477 
09478     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("req_line_speed %d  req_duplex %d  req_flow_ctrl 0x%x"
09479                "  advertising 0x%x\n",
09480                bp->link_params.req_line_speed,
09481                bp->link_params.req_duplex,
09482                bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl, bp->port.advertising);
09483 }
09484 
09485 static inline void bnx2x_set_mac_buf(u8 *mac_buf, u32 mac_lo, u16 mac_hi)
09486 {
09487     mac_hi = cpu_to_be16(mac_hi);
09488     mac_lo = cpu_to_be32(mac_lo);
09489     memcpy(mac_buf, &mac_hi, sizeof(mac_hi));
09490     memcpy(mac_buf + sizeof(mac_hi), &mac_lo, sizeof(mac_lo));
09491 }
09492 
09493 static void __devinit bnx2x_get_port_hwinfo(struct bnx2x *bp)
09494 {
09495     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
09496     u32 val, val2;
09497     u32 config;
09498     u16 i;
09499     u32 ext_phy_type;
09500 
09501     bp->link_params.bp = bp;
09502     bp->link_params.port = port;
09503 
09504     bp->link_params.lane_config =
09505         SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.port_hw_config[port].lane_config);
09506     bp->link_params.ext_phy_config =
09507         SHMEM_RD(bp,
09508              dev_info.port_hw_config[port].external_phy_config);
09509     /* BCM8727_NOC => BCM8727 no over current */
09510     if (XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config) ==
09511         PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8727_NOC) {
09512         bp->link_params.ext_phy_config &=
09513                     ~PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_MASK;
09514         bp->link_params.ext_phy_config |=
09515                     PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8727;
09516         bp->link_params.feature_config_flags |=
09517                     FEATURE_CONFIG_BCM8727_NOC;
09518     }
09519 
09520     bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask =
09521         SHMEM_RD(bp,
09522              dev_info.port_hw_config[port].speed_capability_mask);
09523 
09524     bp->port.link_config =
09525         SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.port_feature_config[port].link_config);
09526 
09527     /* Get the 4 lanes xgxs config rx and tx */
09528     for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
09529         val = SHMEM_RD(bp,
09530                dev_info.port_hw_config[port].xgxs_config_rx[i<<1]);
09531         bp->link_params.xgxs_config_rx[i << 1] = ((val>>16) & 0xffff);
09532         bp->link_params.xgxs_config_rx[(i << 1) + 1] = (val & 0xffff);
09533 
09534         val = SHMEM_RD(bp,
09535                dev_info.port_hw_config[port].xgxs_config_tx[i<<1]);
09536         bp->link_params.xgxs_config_tx[i << 1] = ((val>>16) & 0xffff);
09537         bp->link_params.xgxs_config_tx[(i << 1) + 1] = (val & 0xffff);
09538     }
09539 
09540     /* If the device is capable of WoL, set the default state according
09541      * to the HW
09542      */
09543     config = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.port_feature_config[port].config);
09544     bp->wol = (!(bp->flags & NO_WOL_FLAG) &&
09545            (config & PORT_FEATURE_WOL_ENABLED));
09546 
09547     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("lane_config 0x%08x  ext_phy_config 0x%08x"
09548                "  speed_cap_mask 0x%08x  link_config 0x%08x\n",
09549                bp->link_params.lane_config,
09550                bp->link_params.ext_phy_config,
09551                bp->link_params.speed_cap_mask, bp->port.link_config);
09552 
09553     bp->link_params.switch_cfg = (bp->port.link_config &
09554                       PORT_FEATURE_CONNECTED_SWITCH_MASK);
09555     bnx2x_link_settings_supported(bp, bp->link_params.switch_cfg);
09556 
09557     bnx2x_link_settings_requested(bp);
09558 
09559     /*
09560      * If connected directly, work with the internal PHY, otherwise, work
09561      * with the external PHY
09562      */
09563     ext_phy_type = XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09564     if (ext_phy_type == PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_DIRECT)
09565         bp->mdio.prtad = bp->link_params.phy_addr;
09566 
09567     else if ((ext_phy_type != PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_FAILURE) &&
09568          (ext_phy_type != PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_NOT_CONN))
09569         bp->mdio.prtad =
09570             XGXS_EXT_PHY_ADDR(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
09571 
09572     val2 = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.port_hw_config[port].mac_upper);
09573     val = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.port_hw_config[port].mac_lower);
09574     bnx2x_set_mac_buf(bp->dev->dev_addr, val, val2);
09575     memcpy(bp->link_params.mac_addr, bp->dev->dev_addr, ETH_ALEN);
09576 #ifdef ETHTOOL_GPERMADDR /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09577     memcpy(bp->dev->perm_addr, bp->dev->dev_addr, ETH_ALEN);
09578 #endif
09579 
09580 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
09581     val2 = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.port_hw_config[port].iscsi_mac_upper);
09582     val = SHMEM_RD(bp, dev_info.port_hw_config[port].iscsi_mac_lower);
09583     bnx2x_set_mac_buf(bp->iscsi_mac, val, val2);
09584 #endif
09585 }
09586 
09587 static int __devinit bnx2x_get_hwinfo(struct bnx2x *bp)
09588 {
09589     int func = BP_FUNC(bp);
09590     u32 val, val2;
09591     int rc = 0;
09592 
09593     bnx2x_get_common_hwinfo(bp);
09594 
09595     bp->e1hov = 0;
09596     bp->e1hmf = 0;
09597     if (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp) && !BP_NOMCP(bp)) {
09598         bp->mf_config =
09599             SHMEM_RD(bp, mf_cfg.func_mf_config[func].config);
09600 
09601         val = (SHMEM_RD(bp, mf_cfg.func_mf_config[FUNC_0].e1hov_tag) &
09602                FUNC_MF_CFG_E1HOV_TAG_MASK);
09603         if (val != FUNC_MF_CFG_E1HOV_TAG_DEFAULT)
09604             bp->e1hmf = 1;
09605         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("%s function mode\n",
09606                    IS_E1HMF(bp) ? "multi" : "single");
09607 
09608         if (IS_E1HMF(bp)) {
09609             val = (SHMEM_RD(bp,
09610                     mf_cfg.func_mf_config[func].e1hov_tag) &
09611                    FUNC_MF_CFG_E1HOV_TAG_MASK);
09612             if (val != FUNC_MF_CFG_E1HOV_TAG_DEFAULT) {
09613                 bp->e1hov = val;
09614                 BNX2X_DEV_INFO("E1HOV for func %d is %d "
09615                            "(0x%04x)\n",
09616                            func, bp->e1hov, bp->e1hov);
09617             } else {
09618                 BNX2X_ERROR("No valid E1HOV for func %d,"
09619                         "  aborting\n", func);
09620                 rc = -EPERM;
09621             }
09622         } else {
09623             if (BP_E1HVN(bp)) {
09624                 BNX2X_ERROR("VN %d in single function mode,"
09625                         "  aborting\n", BP_E1HVN(bp));
09626                 rc = -EPERM;
09627             }
09628         }
09629     }
09630 
09631     if (!BP_NOMCP(bp)) {
09632         bnx2x_get_port_hwinfo(bp);
09633 
09634         bp->fw_seq = (SHMEM_RD(bp, func_mb[func].drv_mb_header) &
09635                   DRV_MSG_SEQ_NUMBER_MASK);
09636         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("fw_seq 0x%08x\n", bp->fw_seq);
09637     }
09638 
09639     if (IS_E1HMF(bp)) {
09640         val2 = SHMEM_RD(bp, mf_cfg.func_mf_config[func].mac_upper);
09641         val = SHMEM_RD(bp,  mf_cfg.func_mf_config[func].mac_lower);
09642         if ((val2 != FUNC_MF_CFG_UPPERMAC_DEFAULT) &&
09643             (val != FUNC_MF_CFG_LOWERMAC_DEFAULT)) {
09644             bp->dev->dev_addr[0] = (u8)(val2 >> 8 & 0xff);
09645             bp->dev->dev_addr[1] = (u8)(val2 & 0xff);
09646             bp->dev->dev_addr[2] = (u8)(val >> 24 & 0xff);
09647             bp->dev->dev_addr[3] = (u8)(val >> 16 & 0xff);
09648             bp->dev->dev_addr[4] = (u8)(val >> 8  & 0xff);
09649             bp->dev->dev_addr[5] = (u8)(val & 0xff);
09650             memcpy(bp->link_params.mac_addr, bp->dev->dev_addr,
09651                    ETH_ALEN);
09652 #ifdef ETHTOOL_GPERMADDR /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09653             memcpy(bp->dev->perm_addr, bp->dev->dev_addr,
09654                    ETH_ALEN);
09655 #endif
09656         }
09657 
09658         return rc;
09659     }
09660 
09661     if (BP_NOMCP(bp)) {
09662         /* only supposed to happen on emulation/FPGA */
09663 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020618) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09664         BNX2X_ERROR("warning: random MAC workaround active\n");
09665         random_ether_addr(bp->dev->dev_addr);
09666 #else
09667         BNX2X_ERROR("warning: constant MAC workaround active\n");
09668         bp->dev->dev_addr[0] = 0;
09669         bp->dev->dev_addr[1] = 0x50;
09670         bp->dev->dev_addr[2] = 0xc2;
09671         bp->dev->dev_addr[3] = 0x2c;
09672         bp->dev->dev_addr[4] = (func + 1) * 0x10;
09673         bp->dev->dev_addr[5] = 0x00;
09674         memcpy(bp->link_params.mac_addr, bp->dev->dev_addr, ETH_ALEN);
09675 #endif
09676 #ifdef ETHTOOL_GPERMADDR /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09677         memcpy(bp->dev->perm_addr, bp->dev->dev_addr, ETH_ALEN);
09678 #endif
09679     }
09680 
09681     return rc;
09682 }
09683 
09684 #ifdef BNX2X_SAFC /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09685 static u16 bnx2x_select_queue(struct net_device *dev, struct sk_buff *skb);
09686 
09687 static void __devinit bnx2x_init_safc(struct bnx2x *bp)
09688 {
09689     int i, cos, max_cos, max_queues;
09690 
09691     bp->flags &= ~SAFC_TX_FLAG;
09692 
09693     for (i = 0; i < BNX2X_MAX_PRIORITY; i++)
09694         bp->pri_map[i] = 0;
09695 
09696     max_cos = BNX2X_MAX_COS;
09697     bp->cos_weight_sum = 0;
09698     for (cos = 0; cos < BNX2X_MAX_COS; cos++) {
09699         bp->qs_per_cos[cos] = 0;
09700         bp->cos_min_rate[cos] = 0;
09701     }
09702 
09703     switch (bp->multi_mode) {
09704     case ETH_RSS_MODE_DISABLED:
09705         bp->qs_per_cos[0] = 1;
09706         break;
09707 
09708     case ETH_RSS_MODE_REGULAR:
09709         bp->qs_per_cos[0] = min_t(u32, num_online_cpus(),
09710                       BNX2X_MAX_QUEUES(bp));
09711         break;
09712 
09713     case ETH_RSS_MODE_VLAN_PRI:
09714     case ETH_RSS_MODE_E1HOV_PRI:
09715         if (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp)) {
09716             bp->flags |= SAFC_TX_FLAG;
09717             max_cos = BNX2X_MAX_TX_COS;
09718         }
09719 
09720         /* fallthrough */
09721 
09722     case ETH_RSS_MODE_IP_DSCP:
09723         /* COS 0 must have at least 1 queue */
09724         if (BNX2X_COS_QUEUES(0) == 0) {
09725             printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09726                    "Illegal number of queues per COS 0  "
09727                    "defaulting to 1\n");
09728             qs_per_cos |= 0x1;
09729         }
09730 
09731         for (i = 0; i < BNX2X_MAX_PRIORITY; i++) {
09732             cos = ((pri_map & (0xf << i*4)) >> i*4);
09733             if (cos < max_cos) {
09734                 bp->pri_map[i] = cos;
09735                 if (BNX2X_COS_QUEUES(cos) == 0) {
09736                     printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09737                            "Illegal number of queues per "
09738                            "COS %d  defaulting to 1\n",
09739                            cos);
09740                     qs_per_cos |= (0x1 << cos*8);
09741                 }
09742             } else {
09743                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09744                        "Illegal COS (%d) for priority %d  "
09745                        "defaulting to 0\n", cos, i);
09746                 pri_map &= ~(0xf << i*4);
09747                 bp->pri_map[i] = 0;
09748             }
09749         }
09750 
09751         max_queues = BNX2X_MAX_QUEUES(bp);
09752         for (cos = 0; cos < BNX2X_MAX_COS; cos++) {
09753             i = BNX2X_COS_QUEUES(cos);
09754             if (i <= max_queues) {
09755                 bp->qs_per_cos[cos] = i;
09756                 max_queues -= i;
09757             } else {
09758                 bp->qs_per_cos[cos] = max_queues;
09759                 max_queues = 0;
09760             }
09761             if (bp->qs_per_cos[cos] == 0)
09762                 for (i = 0; i < BNX2X_MAX_PRIORITY; i++)
09763                     if (bp->pri_map[i] == cos) {
09764                         printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09765                                "Illegal COS (%d) for "
09766                                "priority %d  "
09767                                "defaulting to 0\n",
09768                                cos, i);
09769                         pri_map &= ~(0xf << i*4);
09770                         bp->pri_map[i] = 0;
09771                     }
09772         }
09773 
09774 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061e) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09775         bp->dev->select_queue = bnx2x_select_queue;
09776 #endif
09777 
09778         if (cos_min_rate == 0)
09779             break;
09780 
09781         for (cos = 0; cos < BNX2X_MAX_COS; cos++) {
09782             i = BNX2X_COS_RATE(cos);
09783             if (i > 100) {
09784                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09785                        "Illegal rate (%d) for COS %d  "
09786                        "defaulting to 100\n", i, cos);
09787                 i = 100;
09788                 cos_min_rate |= (i << cos*8);
09789             }
09790             i *= 100;
09791             if (bp->qs_per_cos[cos]) {
09792                 if (i == 0) {
09793                     printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09794                            "Illegal rate for COS %d  "
09795                            "defaulting to 1\n", cos);
09796                     i = DEF_MIN_RATE;
09797                     cos_min_rate |= (i << cos*8);
09798                 }
09799             } else {
09800                 if (i) {
09801                     printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09802                            "Illegal rate (%d) for COS %d "
09803                            "with no queues  "
09804                            "defaulting to 0\n", i, cos);
09805                     i = 0;
09806                     cos_min_rate &= ~(0xff << cos*8);
09807                 }
09808             }
09809             bp->cos_min_rate[cos] = i;
09810             bp->cos_weight_sum += i;
09811         }
09812         break;
09813 
09814     default:
09815         bp->multi_mode = ETH_RSS_MODE_DISABLED;
09816         bp->qs_per_cos[0] = 1;
09817         break;
09818     }
09819 }
09820 #endif
09821 
09822 static inline u16 bnx2x_vpd_lrdt_size(u8 *lrdt)
09823 {
09824     return (u16)lrdt[1] + ((u16)lrdt[2] << 8);
09825 }
09826 
09827 static inline u8 bnx2x_vpd_srdt_size(u8 *srdt)
09828 {
09829     return (*srdt) & BNX2X_VPD_SRDT_LEN_MASK;
09830 }
09831 
09832 static int __devinit bnx2x_vpd_find_tag(u8 *data, unsigned int start,
09833                       unsigned int len, u8 tagid)
09834 {
09835     int i;
09836 
09837     for (i = start; i < len; ) {
09838         u8 val = data[i];
09839 
09840         if (val & BNX2X_VPD_LRDT) {
09841             /* Don't return success of the tag isn't complete */
09842             if (i + BNX2X_VPD_LRDT_TAG_SIZE > len)
09843                 break;
09844 
09845             if (val == tagid)
09846                 return i;
09847 
09848             i += BNX2X_VPD_LRDT_TAG_SIZE +
09849                  bnx2x_vpd_lrdt_size(&data[i]);
09850         } else {
09851             u8 tag = val & ~BNX2X_VPD_SRDT_LEN_MASK;
09852 
09853             if (tag == tagid)
09854                 return i;
09855 
09856             if (tag == BNX2X_VPD_SRDT_SIN_END)
09857                 break;
09858 
09859             i += BNX2X_VPD_SRDT_TAG_SIZE +
09860                  bnx2x_vpd_srdt_size(&data[i]);
09861         }
09862     }
09863 
09864     return -1;
09865 }
09866 
09867 static inline u8 bnx2x_vpd_info_field_size(u8 *info_field)
09868 {
09869     return info_field[2];
09870 }
09871 
09872 static int __devinit bnx2x_vpd_rodata_find_if_keyword(u8 *rodata,
09873                             unsigned int start,
09874                             unsigned int rosize,
09875                             char *kw)
09876 {
09877     int i;
09878 
09879     for (i = start; i + BNX2X_VPD_INFO_FLD_HDR_SIZE <= start + rosize;) {
09880         if (rodata[i + 0] == kw[0] &&
09881             rodata[i + 1] == kw[1])
09882             return i;
09883 
09884         i += BNX2X_VPD_INFO_FLD_HDR_SIZE +
09885              bnx2x_vpd_info_field_size(&rodata[i]);
09886     }
09887 
09888     return -1;
09889 }
09890 
09891 static void __devinit bnx2x_read_fwinfo(struct bnx2x *bp) {
09892     int cnt, i, block_end, rodi;
09893     char vpd_data[BNX2X_VPD_LEN+1];
09894     char str_id_reg[VENDOR_ID_LEN+1];
09895     char str_id_cap[VENDOR_ID_LEN+1];
09896     u8 len;
09897 
09898     cnt = pci_read_vpd(bp->pdev, 0, BNX2X_VPD_LEN, vpd_data);
09899     memset(bp->fw_ver, 0, sizeof(bp->fw_ver));
09900 
09901     if (cnt < BNX2X_VPD_LEN)
09902         goto out_not_found;
09903 
09904     i = bnx2x_vpd_find_tag(vpd_data, 0, BNX2X_VPD_LEN,
09905                  BNX2X_VPD_LRDT_RO_DATA);
09906     if (i < 0)
09907         goto out_not_found;
09908     
09909 
09910     block_end = i + BNX2X_VPD_LRDT_TAG_SIZE +
09911             bnx2x_vpd_lrdt_size(&vpd_data[i]);
09912 
09913     i += BNX2X_VPD_LRDT_TAG_SIZE;
09914 
09915     if (block_end > BNX2X_VPD_LEN)
09916         goto out_not_found;
09917     
09918     rodi = bnx2x_vpd_rodata_find_if_keyword(vpd_data, i, block_end,
09919                    BNX2X_VPD_RO_KEYWORD_MANUFACTURERNO);
09920     if (rodi < 0 ) 
09921         goto out_not_found;
09922 
09923     len = bnx2x_vpd_info_field_size(&vpd_data[rodi]);
09924     
09925     if (len != VENDOR_ID_LEN) 
09926         goto out_not_found;
09927 
09928     rodi += BNX2X_VPD_INFO_FLD_HDR_SIZE;
09929 
09930     /* vendor specific info */
09931     snprintf(str_id_reg, VENDOR_ID_LEN + 1, "%04x", PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL);
09932     snprintf(str_id_cap, VENDOR_ID_LEN + 1, "%04X", PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL);
09933     if (!strncmp(str_id_reg, &vpd_data[rodi], VENDOR_ID_LEN) ||
09934         !strncmp(str_id_cap, &vpd_data[rodi], VENDOR_ID_LEN)) {
09935 
09936         rodi = bnx2x_vpd_rodata_find_if_keyword(vpd_data, i, block_end,
09937                            BNX2X_VPD_RO_KEYWORD_VENDOR0);
09938         if (rodi >= 0) {
09939             
09940             len = bnx2x_vpd_info_field_size(&vpd_data[rodi]);
09941 
09942             rodi += BNX2X_VPD_INFO_FLD_HDR_SIZE;
09943 
09944             if (len < 32 && (len + rodi) <= BNX2X_VPD_LEN) {
09945                 memcpy(bp->fw_ver, &vpd_data[rodi], len);
09946                 bp->fw_ver[len] = ' ';
09947             }
09948         }
09949         return;
09950     }
09951 out_not_found:
09952     return;
09953 }
09954 
09955 static int __devinit bnx2x_init_bp(struct bnx2x *bp)
09956 {
09957     int func = BP_FUNC(bp);
09958     int timer_interval;
09959     int rc;
09960 
09961     /* Disable interrupt handling until HW is initialized */
09962     atomic_set(&bp->intr_sem, 1);
09963     smp_wmb(); /* Ensure that bp->intr_sem update is SMP-safe */
09964 
09965     mutex_init(&bp->port.phy_mutex);
09966     mutex_init(&bp->fw_mb_mutex);
09967 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
09968     mutex_init(&bp->cnic_mutex);
09969 #endif
09970 
09971 #if defined(INIT_DELAYED_WORK_DEFERRABLE) || defined(INIT_WORK_NAR) || (VMWARE_ESX_DDK_VERSION >= 40000) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09972 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09973     INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&bp->sp_task, bnx2x_sp_task);
09974 #else
09975     INIT_WORK(&bp->sp_task, bnx2x_sp_task);
09976 #endif
09977     INIT_WORK(&bp->reset_task, bnx2x_reset_task);
09978 #else
09979     INIT_WORK(&bp->sp_task, bnx2x_sp_task, bp);
09980     INIT_WORK(&bp->reset_task, bnx2x_reset_task, bp);
09981 #endif
09982 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020618) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
09983     bp->sp_running = 0;
09984 #endif
09985 
09986     rc = bnx2x_get_hwinfo(bp);
09987 
09988     bnx2x_read_fwinfo(bp);
09989     /* need to reset chip if undi was active */
09990     if (!BP_NOMCP(bp))
09991         bnx2x_undi_unload(bp);
09992 
09993     if (CHIP_REV_IS_FPGA(bp))
09994         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "FPGA detected\n");
09995 
09996     if (BP_NOMCP(bp) && (func == 0))
09997         printk(KERN_ERR PFX
09998                "MCP disabled, must load devices in order!\n");
09999 
10000     /* Set multi queue mode and priority mapping */
10001     if ((multi_mode != ETH_RSS_MODE_DISABLED) &&
10002         ((int_mode == INT_MODE_INTx) || (int_mode == INT_MODE_MSI))) {
10003         printk(KERN_ERR PFX
10004               "Multi disabled since int_mode requested is not MSI-X\n");
10005         multi_mode = ETH_RSS_MODE_DISABLED;
10006     }
10007     bp->multi_mode = multi_mode;
10008 
10009 #ifdef BNX2X_SAFC /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
10010     bnx2x_init_safc(bp);
10011 #endif
10012 
10013 #ifdef NETIF_F_GRO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
10014     bp->dev->features |= NETIF_F_GRO;
10015 #endif
10016 
10017     /* Set TPA flags */
10018     if (disable_tpa) {
10019         bp->flags &= ~TPA_ENABLE_FLAG;
10020 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
10021         bp->dev->features &= ~NETIF_F_LRO;
10022 #endif
10023     } else {
10024         bp->flags |= TPA_ENABLE_FLAG;
10025 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
10026         bp->dev->features |= NETIF_F_LRO;
10027 #endif
10028     }
10029 
10030     if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp))
10031         bp->dropless_fc = 0;
10032     else
10033         bp->dropless_fc = dropless_fc;
10034 
10035     bp->mrrs = mrrs;
10036 
10037 #ifndef BNX2X_UPSTREAM /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
10038     /* MCP workaround */
10039     if (BP_NOMCP(bp)) {
10040         /* [0x24c0]table size:
10041            PCI_REG_GRC_PTR(func)->pci_msix_control = 0x10; */
10042         REG_WR(bp, 0x24c0, 0x10);
10043         /* [0x24c4]table pointer:
10044            PCI_REG_GRC_PTR(func)->pci_msix_tbl_off_bir =
10045                         0x440000 + 0x2000*func; */
10046         REG_WR(bp, 0x24c4, 0x440000 + 0x2000*func);
10047         /* [0x24c8]PBA pointer:
10048            PCI_REG_GRC_PTR(func)->pci_msix_pba_off_bir =
10049                         0x441800 + 0x2000*func; */
10050         REG_WR(bp, 0x24c8, 0x441800 + 0x2000*func);
10051     }
10052 #endif
10053     bp->tx_ring_size = MAX_TX_AVAIL;
10054     bp->rx_ring_size = MAX_RX_AVAIL;
10055 
10056     bp->rx_csum = 1;
10057 
10058     /* make sure that the numbers are in the right granularity */
10059     bp->tx_ticks = (50 / (4 * BNX2X_BTR)) * (4 * BNX2X_BTR);
10060     bp->rx_ticks = (25 / (4 * BNX2X_BTR)) * (4 * BNX2X_BTR);
10061 
10062     timer_interval = (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp) ? 5*HZ : HZ);
10063     bp->current_interval = (poll ? poll : timer_interval);
10064 
10065     init_timer(&bp->timer);
10066     bp->timer.expires = jiffies + bp->current_interval;
10067     bp->timer.data = (unsigned long) bp;
10068     bp->timer.function = bnx2x_timer;
10069 
10070     return rc;
10071 }
10072 
10073 /*
10074  * ethtool service functions
10075  */
10076 
10077 /* All ethtool functions called with rtnl_lock */
10078 
10079 static int bnx2x_get_settings(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_cmd *cmd)
10080 {
10081     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10082 
10083     cmd->supported = bp->port.supported;
10084     cmd->advertising = bp->port.advertising;
10085 
10086     if ((bp->state == BNX2X_STATE_OPEN) &&
10087         !(bp->flags & MF_FUNC_DIS) &&
10088         (bp->link_vars.link_up)) {
10089         cmd->speed = bp->link_vars.line_speed;
10090         cmd->duplex = bp->link_vars.duplex;
10091         if (IS_E1HMF(bp)) {
10092             u16 vn_max_rate;
10093 
10094             vn_max_rate =
10095                 ((bp->mf_config & FUNC_MF_CFG_MAX_BW_MASK) >>
10096                 FUNC_MF_CFG_MAX_BW_SHIFT) * 100;
10097             if (vn_max_rate < cmd->speed)
10098                 cmd->speed = vn_max_rate;
10099         }
10100     } else {
10101         cmd->speed = -1;
10102         cmd->duplex = -1;
10103     }
10104 
10105     if (bp->link_params.switch_cfg == SWITCH_CFG_10G) {
10106         u32 ext_phy_type =
10107             XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
10108 
10109         switch (ext_phy_type) {
10110         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_DIRECT:
10111         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8072:
10112         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8073:
10113         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8705:
10114         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8706:
10115         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8726:
10116         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8727:
10117             cmd->port = PORT_FIBRE;
10118             break;
10119 
10120         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_SFX7101:
10121         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM8481:
10122         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_BCM84823:
10123             cmd->port = PORT_TP;
10124             break;
10125 
10126         case PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_FAILURE:
10127             BNX2X_ERR("XGXS PHY Failure detected 0x%x\n",
10128                   bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
10129             break;
10130 
10131         default:
10132             DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "BAD XGXS ext_phy_config 0x%x\n",
10133                bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
10134             break;
10135         }
10136     } else
10137         cmd->port = PORT_TP;
10138 
10139     cmd->phy_address = bp->mdio.prtad;
10140     cmd->transceiver = XCVR_INTERNAL;
10141 
10142     if (bp->link_params.req_line_speed == SPEED_AUTO_NEG)
10143         cmd->autoneg = AUTONEG_ENABLE;
10144     else
10145         cmd->autoneg = AUTONEG_DISABLE;
10146 
10147     cmd->maxtxpkt = 0;
10148     cmd->maxrxpkt = 0;
10149 
10150     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "ethtool_cmd: cmd %d\n"
10151        DP_LEVEL "  supported 0x%x  advertising 0x%x  speed %d\n"
10152        DP_LEVEL "  duplex %d  port %d  phy_address %d  transceiver %d\n"
10153        DP_LEVEL "  autoneg %d  maxtxpkt %d  maxrxpkt %d\n",
10154        cmd->cmd, cmd->supported, cmd->advertising, cmd->speed,
10155        cmd->duplex, cmd->port, cmd->phy_address, cmd->transceiver,
10156        cmd->autoneg, cmd->maxtxpkt, cmd->maxrxpkt);
10157 
10158     return 0;
10159 }
10160 
10161 static int bnx2x_set_settings(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_cmd *cmd)
10162 {
10163     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10164     u32 advertising;
10165 
10166     if (IS_E1HMF(bp))
10167         return 0;
10168 
10169     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "ethtool_cmd: cmd %d\n"
10170        DP_LEVEL "  supported 0x%x  advertising 0x%x  speed %d\n"
10171        DP_LEVEL "  duplex %d  port %d  phy_address %d  transceiver %d\n"
10172        DP_LEVEL "  autoneg %d  maxtxpkt %d  maxrxpkt %d\n",
10173        cmd->cmd, cmd->supported, cmd->advertising, cmd->speed,
10174        cmd->duplex, cmd->port, cmd->phy_address, cmd->transceiver,
10175        cmd->autoneg, cmd->maxtxpkt, cmd->maxrxpkt);
10176 
10177     if (cmd->autoneg == AUTONEG_ENABLE) {
10178         if (!(bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_Autoneg)) {
10179             DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "Autoneg not supported\n");
10180             return -EINVAL;
10181         }
10182 
10183         /* advertise the requested speed and duplex if supported */
10184         cmd->advertising &= bp->port.supported;
10185 
10186         bp->link_params.req_line_speed = SPEED_AUTO_NEG;
10187         bp->link_params.req_duplex = DUPLEX_FULL;
10188         bp->port.advertising |= (ADVERTISED_Autoneg |
10189                      cmd->advertising);
10190 
10191     } else { /* forced speed */
10192         /* advertise the requested speed and duplex if supported */
10193         switch (cmd->speed) {
10194         case SPEED_10:
10195             if (cmd->duplex == DUPLEX_FULL) {
10196                 if (!(bp->port.supported &
10197                       SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full)) {
10198                     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK,
10199                        "10M full not supported\n");
10200                     return -EINVAL;
10201                 }
10202 
10203                 advertising = (ADVERTISED_10baseT_Full |
10204                            ADVERTISED_TP);
10205             } else {
10206                 if (!(bp->port.supported &
10207                       SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half)) {
10208                     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK,
10209                        "10M half not supported\n");
10210                     return -EINVAL;
10211                 }
10212 
10213                 advertising = (ADVERTISED_10baseT_Half |
10214                            ADVERTISED_TP);
10215             }
10216             break;
10217 
10218         case SPEED_100:
10219             if (cmd->duplex == DUPLEX_FULL) {
10220                 if (!(bp->port.supported &
10221                         SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full)) {
10222                     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK,
10223                        "100M full not supported\n");
10224                     return -EINVAL;
10225                 }
10226 
10227                 advertising = (ADVERTISED_100baseT_Full |
10228                            ADVERTISED_TP);
10229             } else {
10230                 if (!(bp->port.supported &
10231                         SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half)) {
10232                     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK,
10233                        "100M half not supported\n");
10234                     return -EINVAL;
10235                 }
10236 
10237                 advertising = (ADVERTISED_100baseT_Half |
10238                            ADVERTISED_TP);
10239             }
10240             break;
10241 
10242         case SPEED_1000:
10243             if (cmd->duplex != DUPLEX_FULL) {
10244                 DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "1G half not supported\n");
10245                 return -EINVAL;
10246             }
10247 
10248             if (!(bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full)) {
10249                 DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "1G full not supported\n");
10250                 return -EINVAL;
10251             }
10252 
10253             advertising = (ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full |
10254                        ADVERTISED_TP);
10255             break;
10256 
10257         case SPEED_2500:
10258             if (cmd->duplex != DUPLEX_FULL) {
10259                 DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK,
10260                    "2.5G half not supported\n");
10261                 return -EINVAL;
10262             }
10263 
10264             if (!(bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_2500baseX_Full)) {
10265                 DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK,
10266                    "2.5G full not supported\n");
10267                 return -EINVAL;
10268             }
10269 
10270             advertising = (ADVERTISED_2500baseX_Full |
10271                        ADVERTISED_TP);
10272             break;
10273 
10274         case SPEED_10000:
10275             if (cmd->duplex != DUPLEX_FULL) {
10276                 DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "10G half not supported\n");
10277                 return -EINVAL;
10278             }
10279 
10280             if (!(bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_10000baseT_Full)) {
10281                 DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "10G full not supported\n");
10282                 return -EINVAL;
10283             }
10284 
10285             advertising = (ADVERTISED_10000baseT_Full |
10286                        ADVERTISED_FIBRE);
10287             break;
10288 
10289         default:
10290             DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "Unsupported speed\n");
10291             return -EINVAL;
10292         }
10293 
10294         bp->link_params.req_line_speed = cmd->speed;
10295         bp->link_params.req_duplex = cmd->duplex;
10296         bp->port.advertising = advertising;
10297     }
10298 
10299     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "req_line_speed %d\n"
10300        DP_LEVEL "  req_duplex %d  advertising 0x%x\n",
10301        bp->link_params.req_line_speed, bp->link_params.req_duplex,
10302        bp->port.advertising);
10303 
10304     if (netif_running(dev)) {
10305         bnx2x_stats_handle(bp, STATS_EVENT_STOP);
10306         bnx2x_link_set(bp);
10307     }
10308 
10309     return 0;
10310 }
10311 
10312 #define IS_E1_ONLINE(info)  (((info) & RI_E1_ONLINE) == RI_E1_ONLINE)
10313 #define IS_E1H_ONLINE(info) (((info) & RI_E1H_ONLINE) == RI_E1H_ONLINE)
10314 
10315 static int bnx2x_get_regs_len(struct net_device *dev)
10316 {
10317     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10318     int regdump_len = 0;
10319     int i;
10320 
10321     if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp)) {
10322         for (i = 0; i < REGS_COUNT; i++)
10323             if (IS_E1_ONLINE(reg_addrs[i].info))
10324                 regdump_len += reg_addrs[i].size;
10325 
10326         for (i = 0; i < WREGS_COUNT_E1; i++)
10327             if (IS_E1_ONLINE(wreg_addrs_e1[i].info))
10328                 regdump_len += wreg_addrs_e1[i].size *
10329                     (1 + wreg_addrs_e1[i].read_regs_count);
10330 
10331     } else { /* E1H */
10332         for (i = 0; i < REGS_COUNT; i++)
10333             if (IS_E1H_ONLINE(reg_addrs[i].info))
10334                 regdump_len += reg_addrs[i].size;
10335 
10336         for (i = 0; i < WREGS_COUNT_E1H; i++)
10337             if (IS_E1H_ONLINE(wreg_addrs_e1h[i].info))
10338                 regdump_len += wreg_addrs_e1h[i].size *
10339                     (1 + wreg_addrs_e1h[i].read_regs_count);
10340     }
10341     regdump_len *= 4;
10342     regdump_len += sizeof(struct dump_hdr);
10343 
10344     return regdump_len;
10345 }
10346 
10347 static void bnx2x_get_regs(struct net_device *dev,
10348                struct ethtool_regs *regs, void *_p)
10349 {
10350     u32 *p = _p, i, j;
10351     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10352     struct dump_hdr dump_hdr = {0};
10353 
10354     regs->version = 0;
10355     memset(p, 0, regs->len);
10356 
10357     if (!netif_running(bp->dev))
10358         return;
10359 
10360     dump_hdr.hdr_size = (sizeof(struct dump_hdr) / 4) - 1;
10361     dump_hdr.dump_sign = dump_sign_all;
10362     dump_hdr.xstorm_waitp = REG_RD(bp, XSTORM_WAITP_ADDR);
10363     dump_hdr.tstorm_waitp = REG_RD(bp, TSTORM_WAITP_ADDR);
10364     dump_hdr.ustorm_waitp = REG_RD(bp, USTORM_WAITP_ADDR);
10365     dump_hdr.cstorm_waitp = REG_RD(bp, CSTORM_WAITP_ADDR);
10366     dump_hdr.info = CHIP_IS_E1(bp) ? RI_E1_ONLINE : RI_E1H_ONLINE;
10367 
10368     memcpy(p, &dump_hdr, sizeof(struct dump_hdr));
10369     p += dump_hdr.hdr_size + 1;
10370 
10371     if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp)) {
10372         for (i = 0; i < REGS_COUNT; i++)
10373             if (IS_E1_ONLINE(reg_addrs[i].info))
10374                 for (j = 0; j < reg_addrs[i].size; j++)
10375                     *p++ = REG_RD(bp,
10376                               reg_addrs[i].addr + j*4);
10377 
10378     } else { /* E1H */
10379         for (i = 0; i < REGS_COUNT; i++)
10380             if (IS_E1H_ONLINE(reg_addrs[i].info))
10381                 for (j = 0; j < reg_addrs[i].size; j++)
10382                     *p++ = REG_RD(bp,
10383                               reg_addrs[i].addr + j*4);
10384     }
10385 }
10386 
10387 #define PHY_FW_VER_LEN          10
10388 
10389 static void bnx2x_get_drvinfo(struct net_device *dev,
10390                   struct ethtool_drvinfo *info)
10391 {
10392     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10393     u8 phy_fw_ver[PHY_FW_VER_LEN];
10394 
10395     strcpy(info->driver, DRV_MODULE_NAME);
10396     strcpy(info->version, DRV_MODULE_VERSION);
10397 
10398     phy_fw_ver[0] = '\0';
10399     if (bp->port.pmf) {
10400         bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(bp);
10401         bnx2x_get_ext_phy_fw_version(&bp->link_params,
10402                          (bp->state != BNX2X_STATE_CLOSED),
10403                          phy_fw_ver, PHY_FW_VER_LEN);
10404         bnx2x_release_phy_lock(bp);
10405     }
10406 
10407     strncpy(info->fw_version, bp->fw_ver, 32);
10408     snprintf(info->fw_version + strlen(bp->fw_ver), 32 - strlen(bp->fw_ver),
10409          "bc %d.%d.%d%s%s",
10410          (bp->common.bc_ver & 0xff0000) >> 16,
10411          (bp->common.bc_ver & 0xff00) >> 8,
10412          (bp->common.bc_ver & 0xff),
10413          ((phy_fw_ver[0] != '\0') ? " phy " : ""), phy_fw_ver);
10414     strcpy(info->bus_info, pci_name(bp->pdev));
10415     info->n_stats = BNX2X_NUM_STATS;
10416     info->testinfo_len = BNX2X_NUM_TESTS;
10417     info->eedump_len = bp->common.flash_size;
10418     info->regdump_len = bnx2x_get_regs_len(dev);
10419 }
10420 
10421 static void bnx2x_get_wol(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_wolinfo *wol)
10422 {
10423     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10424 
10425     if (bp->flags & NO_WOL_FLAG) {
10426         wol->supported = 0;
10427         wol->wolopts = 0;
10428     } else {
10429         wol->supported = WAKE_MAGIC;
10430         if (bp->wol)
10431             wol->wolopts = WAKE_MAGIC;
10432         else
10433             wol->wolopts = 0;
10434     }
10435     memset(&wol->sopass, 0, sizeof(wol->sopass));
10436 }
10437 
10438 static int bnx2x_set_wol(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_wolinfo *wol)
10439 {
10440     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10441 
10442     if (wol->wolopts & ~WAKE_MAGIC)
10443         return -EINVAL;
10444 
10445     if (wol->wolopts & WAKE_MAGIC) {
10446         if (bp->flags & NO_WOL_FLAG)
10447             return -EINVAL;
10448 
10449         bp->wol = 1;
10450     } else
10451         bp->wol = 0;
10452 
10453     return 0;
10454 }
10455 
10456 static u32 bnx2x_get_msglevel(struct net_device *dev)
10457 {
10458     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10459 
10460     return bp->msglevel;
10461 }
10462 
10463 static void bnx2x_set_msglevel(struct net_device *dev, u32 level)
10464 {
10465     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10466 
10467     if (capable(CAP_NET_ADMIN))
10468         bp->msglevel = level;
10469 }
10470 
10471 static int bnx2x_nway_reset(struct net_device *dev)
10472 {
10473     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10474 
10475     if (!bp->port.pmf)
10476         return 0;
10477 
10478     if (netif_running(dev)) {
10479         bnx2x_stats_handle(bp, STATS_EVENT_STOP);
10480         bnx2x_link_set(bp);
10481     }
10482 
10483     return 0;
10484 }
10485 
10486 static u32 bnx2x_get_link(struct net_device *dev)
10487 {
10488     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10489 
10490     if (bp->flags & MF_FUNC_DIS)
10491         return 0;
10492 
10493     return bp->link_vars.link_up;
10494 }
10495 
10496 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020418) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
10497 static int bnx2x_get_eeprom_len(struct net_device *dev)
10498 {
10499     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10500 
10501     return bp->common.flash_size;
10502 }
10503 #endif
10504 
10505 static int bnx2x_acquire_nvram_lock(struct bnx2x *bp)
10506 {
10507     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
10508     int count, i;
10509     u32 val = 0;
10510 
10511     /* adjust timeout for emulation/FPGA */
10512     count = NVRAM_TIMEOUT_COUNT;
10513     if (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
10514         count *= 100;
10515 
10516     /* request access to nvram interface */
10517     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB,
10518            (MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB_ARB_REQ_SET1 << port));
10519 
10520     for (i = 0; i < count*10; i++) {
10521         val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB);
10522         if (val & (MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB_ARB_ARB1 << port))
10523             break;
10524 
10525         udelay(5);
10526     }
10527 
10528     if (!(val & (MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB_ARB_ARB1 << port))) {
10529         DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM, "cannot get access to nvram interface\n");
10530         return -EBUSY;
10531     }
10532 
10533     return 0;
10534 }
10535 
10536 static int bnx2x_release_nvram_lock(struct bnx2x *bp)
10537 {
10538     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
10539     int count, i;
10540     u32 val = 0;
10541 
10542     /* adjust timeout for emulation/FPGA */
10543     count = NVRAM_TIMEOUT_COUNT;
10544     if (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
10545         count *= 100;
10546 
10547     /* relinquish nvram interface */
10548     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB,
10549            (MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB_ARB_REQ_CLR1 << port));
10550 
10551     for (i = 0; i < count*10; i++) {
10552         val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB);
10553         if (!(val & (MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB_ARB_ARB1 << port)))
10554             break;
10555 
10556         udelay(5);
10557     }
10558 
10559     if (val & (MCPR_NVM_SW_ARB_ARB_ARB1 << port)) {
10560         DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM, "cannot free access to nvram interface\n");
10561         return -EBUSY;
10562     }
10563 
10564     return 0;
10565 }
10566 
10567 static void bnx2x_enable_nvram_access(struct bnx2x *bp)
10568 {
10569     u32 val;
10570 
10571     val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE);
10572 
10573     /* enable both bits, even on read */
10574     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE,
10575            (val | MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE_EN |
10576               MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE_WR_EN));
10577 }
10578 
10579 static void bnx2x_disable_nvram_access(struct bnx2x *bp)
10580 {
10581     u32 val;
10582 
10583     val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE);
10584 
10585     /* disable both bits, even after read */
10586     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE,
10587            (val & ~(MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE_EN |
10588             MCPR_NVM_ACCESS_ENABLE_WR_EN)));
10589 }
10590 
10591 static int bnx2x_nvram_read_dword(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 offset, __be32 *ret_val,
10592                   u32 cmd_flags)
10593 {
10594     int count, i, rc;
10595     u32 val;
10596 
10597     /* build the command word */
10598     cmd_flags |= MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_DOIT;
10599 
10600     /* need to clear DONE bit separately */
10601     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_COMMAND, MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_DONE);
10602 
10603     /* address of the NVRAM to read from */
10604     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_ADDR,
10605            (offset & MCPR_NVM_ADDR_NVM_ADDR_VALUE));
10606 
10607     /* issue a read command */
10608     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_COMMAND, cmd_flags);
10609 
10610     /* adjust timeout for emulation/FPGA */
10611     count = NVRAM_TIMEOUT_COUNT;
10612     if (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
10613         count *= 100;
10614 
10615     /* wait for completion */
10616     *ret_val = 0;
10617     rc = -EBUSY;
10618     for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
10619         udelay(5);
10620         val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_COMMAND);
10621 
10622         if (val & MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_DONE) {
10623             val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_READ);
10624             /* we read nvram data in cpu order
10625              * but ethtool sees it as an array of bytes
10626              * converting to big-endian will do the work */
10627             *ret_val = cpu_to_be32(val);
10628             rc = 0;
10629             break;
10630         }
10631     }
10632 
10633     return rc;
10634 }
10635 
10636 static int bnx2x_nvram_read(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 offset, u8 *ret_buf,
10637                 int buf_size)
10638 {
10639     int rc;
10640     u32 cmd_flags;
10641     __be32 val;
10642 
10643     if ((offset & 0x03) || (buf_size & 0x03) || (buf_size == 0)) {
10644         DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM,
10645            "Invalid parameter: offset 0x%x  buf_size 0x%x\n",
10646            offset, buf_size);
10647         return -EINVAL;
10648     }
10649 
10650     if (offset + buf_size > bp->common.flash_size) {
10651         DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM, "Invalid parameter: offset (0x%x) +"
10652                   " buf_size (0x%x) > flash_size (0x%x)\n",
10653            offset, buf_size, bp->common.flash_size);
10654         return -EINVAL;
10655     }
10656 
10657     /* request access to nvram interface */
10658     rc = bnx2x_acquire_nvram_lock(bp);
10659     if (rc)
10660         return rc;
10661 
10662     /* enable access to nvram interface */
10663     bnx2x_enable_nvram_access(bp);
10664 
10665     /* read the first word(s) */
10666     cmd_flags = MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_FIRST;
10667     while ((buf_size > sizeof(u32)) && (rc == 0)) {
10668         rc = bnx2x_nvram_read_dword(bp, offset, &val, cmd_flags);
10669         memcpy(ret_buf, &val, 4);
10670 
10671         /* advance to the next dword */
10672         offset += sizeof(u32);
10673         ret_buf += sizeof(u32);
10674         buf_size -= sizeof(u32);
10675         cmd_flags = 0;
10676     }
10677 
10678     if (rc == 0) {
10679         cmd_flags |= MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_LAST;
10680         rc = bnx2x_nvram_read_dword(bp, offset, &val, cmd_flags);
10681         memcpy(ret_buf, &val, 4);
10682     }
10683 
10684     /* disable access to nvram interface */
10685     bnx2x_disable_nvram_access(bp);
10686     bnx2x_release_nvram_lock(bp);
10687 
10688     return rc;
10689 }
10690 
10691 static int bnx2x_get_eeprom(struct net_device *dev,
10692                 struct ethtool_eeprom *eeprom, u8 *eebuf)
10693 {
10694     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10695     int rc;
10696 
10697     if (!netif_running(dev))
10698         return -EAGAIN;
10699 
10700     DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM, "ethtool_eeprom: cmd %d\n"
10701        DP_LEVEL "  magic 0x%x  offset 0x%x (%d)  len 0x%x (%d)\n",
10702        eeprom->cmd, eeprom->magic, eeprom->offset, eeprom->offset,
10703        eeprom->len, eeprom->len);
10704 
10705     /* parameters already validated in ethtool_get_eeprom */
10706 
10707     rc = bnx2x_nvram_read(bp, eeprom->offset, eebuf, eeprom->len);
10708 
10709     return rc;
10710 }
10711 
10712 static int bnx2x_nvram_write_dword(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 offset, u32 val,
10713                    u32 cmd_flags)
10714 {
10715     int count, i, rc;
10716 
10717     /* build the command word */
10718     cmd_flags |= MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_DOIT | MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_WR;
10719 
10720     /* need to clear DONE bit separately */
10721     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_COMMAND, MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_DONE);
10722 
10723     /* write the data */
10724     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_WRITE, val);
10725 
10726     /* address of the NVRAM to write to */
10727     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_ADDR,
10728            (offset & MCPR_NVM_ADDR_NVM_ADDR_VALUE));
10729 
10730     /* issue the write command */
10731     REG_WR(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_COMMAND, cmd_flags);
10732 
10733     /* adjust timeout for emulation/FPGA */
10734     count = NVRAM_TIMEOUT_COUNT;
10735     if (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
10736         count *= 100;
10737 
10738     /* wait for completion */
10739     rc = -EBUSY;
10740     for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
10741         udelay(5);
10742         val = REG_RD(bp, MCP_REG_MCPR_NVM_COMMAND);
10743         if (val & MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_DONE) {
10744             rc = 0;
10745             break;
10746         }
10747     }
10748 
10749     return rc;
10750 }
10751 
10752 #define BYTE_OFFSET(offset)     (8 * (offset & 0x03))
10753 
10754 static int bnx2x_nvram_write1(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 offset, u8 *data_buf,
10755                   int buf_size)
10756 {
10757     int rc;
10758     u32 cmd_flags;
10759     u32 align_offset;
10760     __be32 val;
10761 
10762     if (offset + buf_size > bp->common.flash_size) {
10763         DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM, "Invalid parameter: offset (0x%x) +"
10764                   " buf_size (0x%x) > flash_size (0x%x)\n",
10765            offset, buf_size, bp->common.flash_size);
10766         return -EINVAL;
10767     }
10768 
10769     /* request access to nvram interface */
10770     rc = bnx2x_acquire_nvram_lock(bp);
10771     if (rc)
10772         return rc;
10773 
10774     /* enable access to nvram interface */
10775     bnx2x_enable_nvram_access(bp);
10776 
10777     cmd_flags = (MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_FIRST | MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_LAST);
10778     align_offset = (offset & ~0x03);
10779     rc = bnx2x_nvram_read_dword(bp, align_offset, &val, cmd_flags);
10780 
10781     if (rc == 0) {
10782         val &= ~(0xff << BYTE_OFFSET(offset));
10783         val |= (*data_buf << BYTE_OFFSET(offset));
10784
