10785         /* nvram data is returned as an array of bytes
10786          * convert it back to cpu order */
10787         val = be32_to_cpu(val);
10788 
10789         rc = bnx2x_nvram_write_dword(bp, align_offset, val,
10790                          cmd_flags);
10791     }
10792 
10793     /* disable access to nvram interface */
10794     bnx2x_disable_nvram_access(bp);
10795     bnx2x_release_nvram_lock(bp);
10796 
10797     return rc;
10798 }
10799 
10800 static int bnx2x_nvram_write(struct bnx2x *bp, u32 offset, u8 *data_buf,
10801                  int buf_size)
10802 {
10803     int rc;
10804     u32 cmd_flags;
10805     u32 val;
10806     u32 written_so_far;
10807 
10808     if (buf_size == 1)  /* ethtool */
10809         return bnx2x_nvram_write1(bp, offset, data_buf, buf_size);
10810 
10811     if ((offset & 0x03) || (buf_size & 0x03) || (buf_size == 0)) {
10812         DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM,
10813            "Invalid parameter: offset 0x%x  buf_size 0x%x\n",
10814            offset, buf_size);
10815         return -EINVAL;
10816     }
10817 
10818     if (offset + buf_size > bp->common.flash_size) {
10819         DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM, "Invalid parameter: offset (0x%x) +"
10820                   " buf_size (0x%x) > flash_size (0x%x)\n",
10821            offset, buf_size, bp->common.flash_size);
10822         return -EINVAL;
10823     }
10824 
10825     /* request access to nvram interface */
10826     rc = bnx2x_acquire_nvram_lock(bp);
10827     if (rc)
10828         return rc;
10829 
10830     /* enable access to nvram interface */
10831     bnx2x_enable_nvram_access(bp);
10832 
10833     written_so_far = 0;
10834     cmd_flags = MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_FIRST;
10835     while ((written_so_far < buf_size) && (rc == 0)) {
10836         if (written_so_far == (buf_size - sizeof(u32)))
10837             cmd_flags |= MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_LAST;
10838         else if (((offset + 4) % NVRAM_PAGE_SIZE) == 0)
10839             cmd_flags |= MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_LAST;
10840         else if ((offset % NVRAM_PAGE_SIZE) == 0)
10841             cmd_flags |= MCPR_NVM_COMMAND_FIRST;
10842 
10843         memcpy(&val, data_buf, 4);
10844 
10845         rc = bnx2x_nvram_write_dword(bp, offset, val, cmd_flags);
10846 
10847         /* advance to the next dword */
10848         offset += sizeof(u32);
10849         data_buf += sizeof(u32);
10850         written_so_far += sizeof(u32);
10851         cmd_flags = 0;
10852     }
10853 
10854     /* disable access to nvram interface */
10855     bnx2x_disable_nvram_access(bp);
10856     bnx2x_release_nvram_lock(bp);
10857 
10858     return rc;
10859 }
10860 
10861 static int bnx2x_set_eeprom(struct net_device *dev,
10862                 struct ethtool_eeprom *eeprom, u8 *eebuf)
10863 {
10864     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10865     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
10866     int rc = 0;
10867 
10868     if (!netif_running(dev))
10869         return -EAGAIN;
10870 
10871     DP(BNX2X_MSG_NVM, "ethtool_eeprom: cmd %d\n"
10872        DP_LEVEL "  magic 0x%x  offset 0x%x (%d)  len 0x%x (%d)\n",
10873        eeprom->cmd, eeprom->magic, eeprom->offset, eeprom->offset,
10874        eeprom->len, eeprom->len);
10875 
10876     /* parameters already validated in ethtool_set_eeprom */
10877 
10878     /* PHY eeprom can be accessed only by the PMF */
10879     if ((eeprom->magic >= 0x50485900) && (eeprom->magic <= 0x504859FF) &&
10880         !bp->port.pmf)
10881         return -EINVAL;
10882 
10883     if (eeprom->magic == 0x50485950) {
10884         /* 'PHYP' (0x50485950): prepare phy for FW upgrade */
10885         bnx2x_stats_handle(bp, STATS_EVENT_STOP);
10886 
10887         bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(bp);
10888         rc |= bnx2x_link_reset(&bp->link_params,
10889                        &bp->link_vars, 0);
10890         if (XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config) ==
10891                     PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_SFX7101)
10892             bnx2x_set_gpio(bp, MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_0,
10893                        MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_HIGH, port);
10894         bnx2x_release_phy_lock(bp);
10895         bnx2x_link_report(bp);
10896 
10897     } else if (eeprom->magic == 0x50485952) {
10898         /* 'PHYR' (0x50485952): re-init link after FW upgrade */
10899         if (bp->state == BNX2X_STATE_OPEN) {
10900             bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(bp);
10901             rc |= bnx2x_link_reset(&bp->link_params,
10902                            &bp->link_vars, 1);
10903 
10904             rc |= bnx2x_phy_init(&bp->link_params,
10905                          &bp->link_vars);
10906             bnx2x_release_phy_lock(bp);
10907             bnx2x_calc_fc_adv(bp);
10908         }
10909     } else if (eeprom->magic == 0x53985943) {
10910         /* 'PHYC' (0x53985943): PHY FW upgrade completed */
10911         if (XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config) ==
10912                        PORT_HW_CFG_XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE_SFX7101) {
10913             u8 ext_phy_addr =
10914                  XGXS_EXT_PHY_ADDR(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
10915 
10916             /* DSP Remove Download Mode */
10917             bnx2x_set_gpio(bp, MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_0,
10918                        MISC_REGISTERS_GPIO_LOW, port);
10919 
10920             bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(bp);
10921 
10922             bnx2x_sfx7101_sp_sw_reset(bp, port, ext_phy_addr);
10923 
10924             /* wait 0.5 sec to allow it to run */
10925             msleep(500);
10926             bnx2x_ext_phy_hw_reset(bp, port);
10927             msleep(500);
10928             bnx2x_release_phy_lock(bp);
10929         }
10930     } else
10931         rc = bnx2x_nvram_write(bp, eeprom->offset, eebuf, eeprom->len);
10932 
10933     return rc;
10934 }
10935 
10936 static int bnx2x_get_coalesce(struct net_device *dev,
10937                   struct ethtool_coalesce *coal)
10938 {
10939     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10940 
10941     memset(coal, 0, sizeof(struct ethtool_coalesce));
10942 
10943     coal->rx_coalesce_usecs = bp->rx_ticks;
10944     coal->tx_coalesce_usecs = bp->tx_ticks;
10945 
10946     return 0;
10947 }
10948 
10949 static int bnx2x_set_coalesce(struct net_device *dev,
10950                   struct ethtool_coalesce *coal)
10951 {
10952     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10953 
10954     bp->rx_ticks = (u16)coal->rx_coalesce_usecs;
10955     if (bp->rx_ticks > BNX2X_MAX_COALESCE_TOUT)
10956         bp->rx_ticks = BNX2X_MAX_COALESCE_TOUT;
10957 
10958     bp->tx_ticks = (u16)coal->tx_coalesce_usecs;
10959     if (bp->tx_ticks > BNX2X_MAX_COALESCE_TOUT)
10960         bp->tx_ticks = BNX2X_MAX_COALESCE_TOUT;
10961 
10962     if (netif_running(dev))
10963         bnx2x_update_coalesce(bp);
10964 
10965     return 0;
10966 }
10967 
10968 static void bnx2x_get_ringparam(struct net_device *dev,
10969                 struct ethtool_ringparam *ering)
10970 {
10971     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10972 
10973     ering->rx_max_pending = MAX_RX_AVAIL;
10974     ering->rx_mini_max_pending = 0;
10975     ering->rx_jumbo_max_pending = 0;
10976 
10977     ering->rx_pending = bp->rx_ring_size;
10978     ering->rx_mini_pending = 0;
10979     ering->rx_jumbo_pending = 0;
10980 
10981     ering->tx_max_pending = MAX_TX_AVAIL;
10982     ering->tx_pending = bp->tx_ring_size;
10983 }
10984 
10985 static int bnx2x_set_ringparam(struct net_device *dev,
10986                    struct ethtool_ringparam *ering)
10987 {
10988     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
10989     int rc = 0;
10990 
10991     if ((ering->rx_pending > MAX_RX_AVAIL) ||
10992         (ering->tx_pending > MAX_TX_AVAIL) ||
10993         (ering->tx_pending <= MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 4))
10994         return -EINVAL;
10995 
10996     bp->rx_ring_size = ering->rx_pending;
10997     bp->tx_ring_size = ering->tx_pending;
10998 
10999     if (netif_running(dev)) {
11000         bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_NORMAL);
11001         rc = bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_NORMAL);
11002     }
11003 
11004     return rc;
11005 }
11006 
11007 static void bnx2x_get_pauseparam(struct net_device *dev,
11008                  struct ethtool_pauseparam *epause)
11009 {
11010     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11011 
11012     epause->autoneg = (bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl ==
11013                BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_AUTO) &&
11014               (bp->link_params.req_line_speed == SPEED_AUTO_NEG);
11015 
11016     epause->rx_pause = ((bp->link_vars.flow_ctrl & BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_RX) ==
11017                 BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_RX);
11018     epause->tx_pause = ((bp->link_vars.flow_ctrl & BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_TX) ==
11019                 BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_TX);
11020 
11021     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "ethtool_pauseparam: cmd %d\n"
11022        DP_LEVEL "  autoneg %d  rx_pause %d  tx_pause %d\n",
11023        epause->cmd, epause->autoneg, epause->rx_pause, epause->tx_pause);
11024 }
11025 
11026 static int bnx2x_set_pauseparam(struct net_device *dev,
11027                 struct ethtool_pauseparam *epause)
11028 {
11029     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11030 
11031     if (IS_E1HMF(bp))
11032         return 0;
11033 
11034     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "ethtool_pauseparam: cmd %d\n"
11035        DP_LEVEL "  autoneg %d  rx_pause %d  tx_pause %d\n",
11036        epause->cmd, epause->autoneg, epause->rx_pause, epause->tx_pause);
11037 
11038     bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl = BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_AUTO;
11039 
11040     if (epause->rx_pause)
11041         bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl |= BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_RX;
11042 
11043     if (epause->tx_pause)
11044         bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl |= BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_TX;
11045 
11046     if (bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl == BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_AUTO)
11047         bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl = BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_NONE;
11048 
11049     if (epause->autoneg) {
11050         if (!(bp->port.supported & SUPPORTED_Autoneg)) {
11051             DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "autoneg not supported\n");
11052             return -EINVAL;
11053         }
11054 
11055         if (bp->link_params.req_line_speed == SPEED_AUTO_NEG)
11056             bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl = BNX2X_FLOW_CTRL_AUTO;
11057     }
11058 
11059     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK,
11060        "req_flow_ctrl 0x%x\n", bp->link_params.req_flow_ctrl);
11061 
11062     if (netif_running(dev)) {
11063         bnx2x_stats_handle(bp, STATS_EVENT_STOP);
11064         bnx2x_link_set(bp);
11065     }
11066 
11067     return 0;
11068 }
11069 
11070 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11071 static int bnx2x_set_flags(struct net_device *dev, u32 data)
11072 {
11073     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11074     int changed = 0;
11075     int rc = 0;
11076 
11077     /* TPA requires Rx CSUM offloading */
11078     if ((data & ETH_FLAG_LRO) && bp->rx_csum) {
11079 #ifndef __NO_TPA__
11080         if (!(dev->features & NETIF_F_LRO)) {
11081             dev->features |= NETIF_F_LRO;
11082             bp->flags |= TPA_ENABLE_FLAG;
11083             changed = 1;
11084         }
11085 #else
11086         rc = -EINVAL;
11087 #endif
11088     } else if (dev->features & NETIF_F_LRO) {
11089         dev->features &= ~NETIF_F_LRO;
11090         bp->flags &= ~TPA_ENABLE_FLAG;
11091         changed = 1;
11092     }
11093 
11094     if (changed && netif_running(dev)) {
11095         bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_NORMAL);
11096         rc = bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_NORMAL);
11097     }
11098 
11099     return rc;
11100 }
11101 #endif
11102 
11103 static u32 bnx2x_get_rx_csum(struct net_device *dev)
11104 {
11105     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11106 
11107     return bp->rx_csum;
11108 }
11109 
11110 static int bnx2x_set_rx_csum(struct net_device *dev, u32 data)
11111 {
11112     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11113     int rc = 0;
11114 
11115     bp->rx_csum = data;
11116 
11117     /* Disable TPA, when Rx CSUM is disabled. Otherwise all
11118        TPA'ed packets will be discarded due to wrong TCP CSUM */
11119     if (!data) {
11120 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11121         u32 flags = ethtool_op_get_flags(dev);
11122 
11123         rc = bnx2x_set_flags(dev, (flags & ~ETH_FLAG_LRO));
11124 #else
11125         bp->flags &= ~TPA_ENABLE_FLAG;
11126         if (netif_running(dev)) {
11127             bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_NORMAL);
11128             rc = bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_NORMAL);
11129         }
11130 #endif
11131     }
11132 
11133     return rc;
11134 }
11135 
11136 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11137 static int bnx2x_set_tso(struct net_device *dev, u32 data)
11138 {
11139     if (data) {
11140         dev->features |= (NETIF_F_TSO | NETIF_F_TSO_ECN);
11141 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO6 /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11142         dev->features |= NETIF_F_TSO6;
11143 #endif
11144     } else {
11145         dev->features &= ~(NETIF_F_TSO | NETIF_F_TSO_ECN);
11146 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO6 /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11147         dev->features &= ~NETIF_F_TSO6;
11148 #endif
11149     }
11150 
11151     return 0;
11152 }
11153 #endif
11154 
11155 static const struct {
11156     char string[ETH_GSTRING_LEN];
11157 } bnx2x_tests_str_arr[BNX2X_NUM_TESTS] = {
11158     { "register_test (offline)" },
11159     { "memory_test (offline)" },
11160     { "loopback_test (offline)" },
11161     { "nvram_test (online)" },
11162     { "interrupt_test (online)" },
11163     { "link_test (online)" },
11164     { "idle check (online)" }
11165 };
11166 
11167 static int bnx2x_test_registers(struct bnx2x *bp)
11168 {
11169     int idx, i, rc = -ENODEV;
11170     u32 wr_val = 0;
11171     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
11172     static const struct {
11173         u32 offset0;
11174         u32 offset1;
11175         u32 mask;
11176     } reg_tbl[] = {
11177 /* 0 */     { BRB1_REG_PAUSE_LOW_THRESHOLD_0,      4, 0x000003ff },
11178         { DORQ_REG_DB_ADDR0,                   4, 0xffffffff },
11179         { HC_REG_AGG_INT_0,                    4, 0x000003ff },
11180         { PBF_REG_MAC_IF0_ENABLE,              4, 0x00000001 },
11181         { PBF_REG_P0_INIT_CRD,                 4, 0x000007ff },
11182         { PRS_REG_CID_PORT_0,                  4, 0x00ffffff },
11183         { PXP2_REG_PSWRQ_CDU0_L2P,             4, 0x000fffff },
11184         { PXP2_REG_RQ_CDU0_EFIRST_MEM_ADDR,    8, 0x0003ffff },
11185         { PXP2_REG_PSWRQ_TM0_L2P,              4, 0x000fffff },
11186         { PXP2_REG_RQ_USDM0_EFIRST_MEM_ADDR,   8, 0x0003ffff },
11187 /* 10 */    { PXP2_REG_PSWRQ_TSDM0_L2P,            4, 0x000fffff },
11188         { QM_REG_CONNNUM_0,                    4, 0x000fffff },
11189         { TM_REG_LIN0_MAX_ACTIVE_CID,          4, 0x0003ffff },
11190         { SRC_REG_KEYRSS0_0,                  40, 0xffffffff },
11191         { SRC_REG_KEYRSS0_7,                  40, 0xffffffff },
11192         { XCM_REG_WU_DA_SET_TMR_CNT_FLG_CMD00, 4, 0x00000001 },
11193         { XCM_REG_WU_DA_CNT_CMD00,             4, 0x00000003 },
11194         { XCM_REG_GLB_DEL_ACK_MAX_CNT_0,       4, 0x000000ff },
11195         { NIG_REG_LLH0_T_BIT,                  4, 0x00000001 },
11196         { NIG_REG_EMAC0_IN_EN,                 4, 0x00000001 },
11197 /* 20 */    { NIG_REG_BMAC0_IN_EN,                 4, 0x00000001 },
11198         { NIG_REG_XCM0_OUT_EN,                 4, 0x00000001 },
11199         { NIG_REG_BRB0_OUT_EN,                 4, 0x00000001 },
11200         { NIG_REG_LLH0_XCM_MASK,               4, 0x00000007 },
11201         { NIG_REG_LLH0_ACPI_PAT_6_LEN,        68, 0x000000ff },
11202         { NIG_REG_LLH0_ACPI_PAT_0_CRC,        68, 0xffffffff },
11203         { NIG_REG_LLH0_DEST_MAC_0_0,         160, 0xffffffff },
11204         { NIG_REG_LLH0_DEST_IP_0_1,          160, 0xffffffff },
11205         { NIG_REG_LLH0_IPV4_IPV6_0,          160, 0x00000001 },
11206         { NIG_REG_LLH0_DEST_UDP_0,           160, 0x0000ffff },
11207 /* 30 */    { NIG_REG_LLH0_DEST_TCP_0,           160, 0x0000ffff },
11208         { NIG_REG_LLH0_VLAN_ID_0,            160, 0x00000fff },
11209         { NIG_REG_XGXS_SERDES0_MODE_SEL,       4, 0x00000001 },
11210         { NIG_REG_LED_CONTROL_OVERRIDE_TRAFFIC_P0, 4, 0x00000001 },
11211         { NIG_REG_STATUS_INTERRUPT_PORT0,      4, 0x07ffffff },
11212         { NIG_REG_XGXS0_CTRL_EXTREMOTEMDIOST, 24, 0x00000001 },
11213         { NIG_REG_SERDES0_CTRL_PHY_ADDR,      16, 0x0000001f },
11214 
11215         { 0xffffffff, 0, 0x00000000 }
11216     };
11217 
11218     if (!netif_running(bp->dev))
11219         return rc;
11220 
11221     /* Repeat the test twice:
11222        First by writing 0x00000000, second by writing 0xffffffff */
11223     for (idx = 0; idx < 2; idx++) {
11224 
11225         switch (idx) {
11226         case 0:
11227             wr_val = 0;
11228             break;
11229         case 1:
11230             wr_val = 0xffffffff;
11231             break;
11232         }
11233 
11234         for (i = 0; reg_tbl[i].offset0 != 0xffffffff; i++) {
11235             u32 offset, mask, save_val, val;
11236 
11237             offset = reg_tbl[i].offset0 + port*reg_tbl[i].offset1;
11238             mask = reg_tbl[i].mask;
11239 
11240             save_val = REG_RD(bp, offset);
11241 
11242             REG_WR(bp, offset, (wr_val & mask));
11243             val = REG_RD(bp, offset);
11244 
11245             /* Restore the original register's value */
11246             REG_WR(bp, offset, save_val);
11247 
11248             /* verify value is as expected */
11249             if ((val & mask) != (wr_val & mask)) {
11250                 DP(NETIF_MSG_PROBE,
11251                    "offset 0x%x: val 0x%x != 0x%x mask 0x%x\n",
11252                    offset, val, wr_val, mask);
11253                 goto test_reg_exit;
11254             }
11255         }
11256     }
11257 
11258     rc = 0;
11259 
11260 test_reg_exit:
11261     return rc;
11262 }
11263 
11264 static int bnx2x_test_memory(struct bnx2x *bp)
11265 {
11266     int i, j, rc = -ENODEV;
11267     u32 val;
11268     static const struct {
11269         u32 offset;
11270         int size;
11271     } mem_tbl[] = {
11272         { CCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE,   CCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE_SIZE },
11273         { CFC_REG_ACTIVITY_COUNTER, CFC_REG_ACTIVITY_COUNTER_SIZE },
11274         { CFC_REG_LINK_LIST,        CFC_REG_LINK_LIST_SIZE },
11275         { DMAE_REG_CMD_MEM,         DMAE_REG_CMD_MEM_SIZE },
11276         { TCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE,   TCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE_SIZE },
11277         { UCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE,   UCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE_SIZE },
11278         { XCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE,   XCM_REG_XX_DESCR_TABLE_SIZE },
11279 
11280         { 0xffffffff, 0 }
11281     };
11282     static const struct {
11283         char *name;
11284         u32 offset;
11285         u32 e1_mask;
11286         u32 e1h_mask;
11287     } prty_tbl[] = {
11288         { "CCM_PRTY_STS",  CCM_REG_CCM_PRTY_STS,   0x3ffc0, 0 },
11289         { "CFC_PRTY_STS",  CFC_REG_CFC_PRTY_STS,   0x2,     0x2 },
11290         { "DMAE_PRTY_STS", DMAE_REG_DMAE_PRTY_STS, 0,       0 },
11291         { "TCM_PRTY_STS",  TCM_REG_TCM_PRTY_STS,   0x3ffc0, 0 },
11292         { "UCM_PRTY_STS",  UCM_REG_UCM_PRTY_STS,   0x3ffc0, 0 },
11293         { "XCM_PRTY_STS",  XCM_REG_XCM_PRTY_STS,   0x3ffc1, 0 },
11294 
11295         { NULL, 0xffffffff, 0, 0 }
11296     };
11297 
11298     if (!netif_running(bp->dev))
11299         return rc;
11300 
11301     /* Go through all the memories */
11302     for (i = 0; mem_tbl[i].offset != 0xffffffff; i++)
11303         for (j = 0; j < mem_tbl[i].size; j++)
11304             REG_RD(bp, mem_tbl[i].offset + j*4);
11305 
11306     /* Check the parity status */
11307     for (i = 0; prty_tbl[i].offset != 0xffffffff; i++) {
11308         val = REG_RD(bp, prty_tbl[i].offset);
11309         if ((CHIP_IS_E1(bp) && (val & ~(prty_tbl[i].e1_mask))) ||
11310             (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp) && (val & ~(prty_tbl[i].e1h_mask)))) {
11311             DP(NETIF_MSG_HW,
11312                "%s is 0x%x\n", prty_tbl[i].name, val);
11313             goto test_mem_exit;
11314         }
11315     }
11316 
11317     rc = 0;
11318 
11319 test_mem_exit:
11320     return rc;
11321 }
11322 
11323 static void bnx2x_wait_for_link(struct bnx2x *bp, u8 link_up)
11324 {
11325     int cnt = 1000;
11326 
11327     if (link_up)
11328         while (bnx2x_link_test(bp) && cnt--)
11329             msleep(10);
11330 }
11331 
11332 static int bnx2x_run_loopback(struct bnx2x *bp, int loopback_mode, u8 link_up)
11333 {
11334     unsigned int pkt_size, num_pkts, i;
11335     struct sk_buff *skb;
11336     unsigned char *packet;
11337     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp_rx = &bp->fp[0];
11338     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp_tx = &bp->fp[0];
11339     u16 tx_start_idx, tx_idx;
11340     u16 rx_start_idx, rx_idx;
11341     u16 pkt_prod, bd_prod;
11342     struct sw_tx_bd *tx_buf;
11343     struct eth_tx_start_bd *tx_start_bd;
11344     struct eth_tx_parse_bd *pbd = NULL;
11345     dma_addr_t mapping;
11346     union eth_rx_cqe *cqe;
11347     u8 cqe_fp_flags;
11348     struct sw_rx_bd *rx_buf;
11349     u16 len;
11350     int rc = -ENODEV;
11351 
11352     /* check the loopback mode */
11353     switch (loopback_mode) {
11354     case BNX2X_PHY_LOOPBACK:
11355         if (bp->link_params.loopback_mode != LOOPBACK_XGXS_10)
11356             return -EINVAL;
11357         break;
11358     case BNX2X_MAC_LOOPBACK:
11359         bp->link_params.loopback_mode = LOOPBACK_BMAC;
11360         bnx2x_phy_init(&bp->link_params, &bp->link_vars);
11361         break;
11362     default:
11363         return -EINVAL;
11364     }
11365 
11366     /* prepare the loopback packet */
11367     pkt_size = (((bp->dev->mtu < ETH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE) ?
11368              bp->dev->mtu : ETH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE) + ETH_HLEN);
11369     skb = netdev_alloc_skb(bp->dev, bp->rx_buf_size);
11370     if (!skb) {
11371         rc = -ENOMEM;
11372         goto test_loopback_exit;
11373     }
11374     packet = skb_put(skb, pkt_size);
11375     memcpy(packet, bp->dev->dev_addr, ETH_ALEN);
11376     memset(packet + ETH_ALEN, 0, ETH_ALEN);
11377     memset(packet + 2*ETH_ALEN, 0x77, (ETH_HLEN - 2*ETH_ALEN));
11378     for (i = ETH_HLEN; i < pkt_size; i++)
11379         packet[i] = (unsigned char) (i & 0xff);
11380 
11381     /* send the loopback packet */
11382     num_pkts = 0;
11383     tx_start_idx = le16_to_cpu(*fp_tx->tx_cons_sb);
11384     rx_start_idx = le16_to_cpu(*fp_rx->rx_cons_sb);
11385 
11386     pkt_prod = fp_tx->tx_pkt_prod++;
11387     tx_buf = &fp_tx->tx_buf_ring[TX_BD(pkt_prod)];
11388     tx_buf->first_bd = fp_tx->tx_bd_prod;
11389     tx_buf->skb = skb;
11390     tx_buf->flags = 0;
11391 
11392     bd_prod = TX_BD(fp_tx->tx_bd_prod);
11393     tx_start_bd = &fp_tx->tx_desc_ring[bd_prod].start_bd;
11394     mapping = pci_map_single(bp->pdev, skb->data,
11395                  skb_headlen(skb), PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
11396     tx_start_bd->addr_hi = cpu_to_le32(U64_HI(mapping));
11397     tx_start_bd->addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(U64_LO(mapping));
11398     tx_start_bd->nbd = cpu_to_le16(2); /* start + pbd */
11399     tx_start_bd->nbytes = cpu_to_le16(skb_headlen(skb));
11400     tx_start_bd->vlan = cpu_to_le16(pkt_prod);
11401     tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield = ETH_TX_BD_FLAGS_START_BD;
11402     tx_start_bd->general_data = ((UNICAST_ADDRESS <<
11403                 ETH_TX_START_BD_ETH_ADDR_TYPE_SHIFT) | 1);
11404 
11405     /* turn on parsing and get a BD */
11406     bd_prod = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_prod));
11407     pbd = &fp_tx->tx_desc_ring[bd_prod].parse_bd;
11408 
11409     memset(pbd, 0, sizeof(struct eth_tx_parse_bd));
11410 
11411     wmb();
11412 
11413     fp_tx->tx_db.data.prod += 2;
11414     barrier();
11415     DOORBELL(bp, fp_tx->index, fp_tx->tx_db.raw);
11416 
11417     mmiowb();
11418 
11419     num_pkts++;
11420     fp_tx->tx_bd_prod += 2; /* start + pbd */
11421 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061f) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11422     /* In kernels starting from 2.6.31 netdev layer does this */
11423     bp->dev->trans_start = jiffies;
11424 #endif
11425 
11426     udelay(100);
11427 
11428     tx_idx = le16_to_cpu(*fp_tx->tx_cons_sb);
11429     if (tx_idx != tx_start_idx + num_pkts)
11430         goto test_loopback_exit;
11431 
11432     rx_idx = le16_to_cpu(*fp_rx->rx_cons_sb);
11433     if (rx_idx != rx_start_idx + num_pkts)
11434         goto test_loopback_exit;
11435 
11436     cqe = &fp_rx->rx_comp_ring[RCQ_BD(fp_rx->rx_comp_cons)];
11437     cqe_fp_flags = cqe->fast_path_cqe.type_error_flags;
11438     if (CQE_TYPE(cqe_fp_flags) || (cqe_fp_flags & ETH_RX_ERROR_FALGS))
11439         goto test_loopback_rx_exit;
11440 
11441     len = le16_to_cpu(cqe->fast_path_cqe.pkt_len);
11442     if (len != pkt_size)
11443         goto test_loopback_rx_exit;
11444 
11445     rx_buf = &fp_rx->rx_buf_ring[RX_BD(fp_rx->rx_bd_cons)];
11446     skb = rx_buf->skb;
11447     skb_reserve(skb, cqe->fast_path_cqe.placement_offset);
11448     for (i = ETH_HLEN; i < pkt_size; i++)
11449         if (*(skb->data + i) != (unsigned char) (i & 0xff))
11450             goto test_loopback_rx_exit;
11451 
11452     rc = 0;
11453 
11454 test_loopback_rx_exit:
11455 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061b) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11456     bp->dev->last_rx = jiffies;
11457 #endif
11458 
11459     fp_rx->rx_bd_cons = NEXT_RX_IDX(fp_rx->rx_bd_cons);
11460     fp_rx->rx_bd_prod = NEXT_RX_IDX(fp_rx->rx_bd_prod);
11461     fp_rx->rx_comp_cons = NEXT_RCQ_IDX(fp_rx->rx_comp_cons);
11462     fp_rx->rx_comp_prod = NEXT_RCQ_IDX(fp_rx->rx_comp_prod);
11463 
11464     /* Update producers */
11465     bnx2x_update_rx_prod(bp, fp_rx, fp_rx->rx_bd_prod, fp_rx->rx_comp_prod,
11466                  fp_rx->rx_sge_prod);
11467 
11468 test_loopback_exit:
11469     bp->link_params.loopback_mode = LOOPBACK_NONE;
11470 
11471     return rc;
11472 }
11473 
11474 static int bnx2x_test_loopback(struct bnx2x *bp, u8 link_up)
11475 {
11476     int rc = 0, res;
11477 
11478     if (BP_NOMCP(bp))
11479         return rc;
11480 
11481     if (!netif_running(bp->dev))
11482         return BNX2X_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
11483 
11484     bnx2x_netif_stop(bp, 1);
11485     bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(bp);
11486 
11487     res = bnx2x_run_loopback(bp, BNX2X_PHY_LOOPBACK, link_up);
11488     if (res) {
11489         DP(NETIF_MSG_PROBE, "  PHY loopback failed  (res %d)\n", res);
11490         rc |= BNX2X_PHY_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
11491     }
11492 
11493     res = bnx2x_run_loopback(bp, BNX2X_MAC_LOOPBACK, link_up);
11494     if (res) {
11495         DP(NETIF_MSG_PROBE, "  MAC loopback failed  (res %d)\n", res);
11496         rc |= BNX2X_MAC_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
11497     }
11498 
11499     bnx2x_release_phy_lock(bp);
11500     bnx2x_netif_start(bp);
11501 
11502     return rc;
11503 }
11504 
11505 #define CRC32_RESIDUAL          0xdebb20e3
11506 
11507 static int bnx2x_test_nvram(struct bnx2x *bp)
11508 {
11509     static const struct {
11510         int offset;
11511         int size;
11512     } nvram_tbl[] = {
11513         {     0,  0x14 }, /* bootstrap */
11514         {  0x14,  0xec }, /* dir */
11515         { 0x100, 0x350 }, /* manuf_info */
11516         { 0x450,  0xf0 }, /* feature_info */
11517         { 0x640,  0x64 }, /* upgrade_key_info */
11518         { 0x6a4,  0x64 },
11519         { 0x708,  0x70 }, /* manuf_key_info */
11520         { 0x778,  0x70 },
11521         {     0,     0 }
11522     };
11523     __be32 buf[0x350 / 4];
11524     u8 *data = (u8 *)buf;
11525     int i, rc;
11526     u32 magic, crc;
11527 
11528     if (BP_NOMCP(bp))
11529         return 0;
11530 
11531     rc = bnx2x_nvram_read(bp, 0, data, 4);
11532     if (rc) {
11533         DP(NETIF_MSG_PROBE, "magic value read (rc %d)\n", rc);
11534         goto test_nvram_exit;
11535     }
11536 
11537     magic = be32_to_cpu(buf[0]);
11538     if (magic != 0x669955aa) {
11539         DP(NETIF_MSG_PROBE, "magic value (0x%08x)\n", magic);
11540         rc = -ENODEV;
11541         goto test_nvram_exit;
11542     }
11543 
11544     for (i = 0; nvram_tbl[i].size; i++) {
11545 
11546         rc = bnx2x_nvram_read(bp, nvram_tbl[i].offset, data,
11547                       nvram_tbl[i].size);
11548         if (rc) {
11549             DP(NETIF_MSG_PROBE,
11550                "nvram_tbl[%d] read data (rc %d)\n", i, rc);
11551             goto test_nvram_exit;
11552         }
11553 
11554         crc = ether_crc_le(nvram_tbl[i].size, data);
11555         if (crc != CRC32_RESIDUAL) {
11556             DP(NETIF_MSG_PROBE,
11557                "nvram_tbl[%d] crc value (0x%08x)\n", i, crc);
11558             rc = -ENODEV;
11559             goto test_nvram_exit;
11560         }
11561     }
11562 
11563 test_nvram_exit:
11564     return rc;
11565 }
11566 
11567 static int bnx2x_test_intr(struct bnx2x *bp)
11568 {
11569     struct mac_configuration_cmd *config = bnx2x_sp(bp, mac_config);
11570     int i, rc;
11571 
11572     if (!netif_running(bp->dev))
11573         return -ENODEV;
11574 
11575     config->hdr.length = 0;
11576     if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp))
11577         /* use last unicast entries */
11578         config->hdr.offset = (BP_PORT(bp) ? 63 : 31);
11579     else
11580         config->hdr.offset = BP_FUNC(bp);
11581     config->hdr.client_id = bp->fp->cl_id;
11582     config->hdr.reserved1 = 0;
11583 
11584     bp->set_mac_pending++;
11585     smp_wmb();
11586     rc = bnx2x_sp_post(bp, RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_SET_MAC, 0,
11587                U64_HI(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, mac_config)),
11588                U64_LO(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, mac_config)), 0);
11589     if (rc == 0) {
11590         for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
11591             if (!bp->set_mac_pending)
11592                 break;
11593             smp_rmb();
11594             msleep_interruptible(10);
11595         }
11596         if (i == 10)
11597             rc = -ENODEV;
11598     }
11599 
11600     return rc;
11601 }
11602 
11603 static void bnx2x_self_test(struct net_device *dev,
11604                 struct ethtool_test *etest, u64 *buf)
11605 {
11606     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11607 
11608     memset(buf, 0, sizeof(u64) * BNX2X_NUM_TESTS);
11609 
11610     if (!netif_running(dev))
11611         return;
11612 
11613     /* offline tests are not supported in MF mode */
11614     if (IS_E1HMF(bp))
11615         etest->flags &= ~ETH_TEST_FL_OFFLINE;
11616 
11617     if (etest->flags & ETH_TEST_FL_OFFLINE) {
11618         int port = BP_PORT(bp);
11619         u32 val;
11620         u8 link_up;
11621 
11622         /* save current value of input enable for TX port IF */
11623         val = REG_RD(bp, NIG_REG_EGRESS_UMP0_IN_EN + port*4);
11624         /* disable input for TX port IF */
11625         REG_WR(bp, NIG_REG_EGRESS_UMP0_IN_EN + port*4, 0);
11626 
11627         link_up = (bnx2x_link_test(bp) == 0);
11628         bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_NORMAL);
11629         bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_DIAG);
11630         /* wait until link state is restored */
11631         bnx2x_wait_for_link(bp, link_up);
11632 
11633         if (bnx2x_test_registers(bp) != 0) {
11634             buf[0] = 1;
11635             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
11636         }
11637         if (bnx2x_test_memory(bp) != 0) {
11638             buf[1] = 1;
11639             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
11640         }
11641         buf[2] = bnx2x_test_loopback(bp, link_up);
11642         if (buf[2] != 0)
11643             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
11644 
11645         bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_NORMAL);
11646 
11647         /* restore input for TX port IF */
11648         REG_WR(bp, NIG_REG_EGRESS_UMP0_IN_EN + port*4, val);
11649 
11650         bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_NORMAL);
11651         /* wait until link state is restored */
11652         bnx2x_wait_for_link(bp, link_up);
11653     }
11654     if (bnx2x_test_nvram(bp) != 0) {
11655         buf[3] = 1;
11656         etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
11657     }
11658     if (bnx2x_test_intr(bp) != 0) {
11659         buf[4] = 1;
11660         etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
11661     }
11662     if (bp->port.pmf)
11663         if (bnx2x_link_test(bp) != 0) {
11664             buf[5] = 1;
11665             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
11666         }
11667 #ifndef BNX2X_UPSTREAM /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11668     /* run the idle check twice */
11669     bnx2x_idle_chk(bp);
11670     buf[6] = bnx2x_idle_chk(bp);
11671     if (buf[6] != 0)
11672         etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
11673 #endif
11674 
11675 #ifdef BNX2X_EXTRA_DEBUG
11676     bnx2x_panic_dump(bp);
11677 #endif
11678 }
11679 
11680 static const struct {
11681     long offset;
11682     int size;
11683     u8 string[ETH_GSTRING_LEN];
11684 } bnx2x_q_stats_arr[BNX2X_NUM_Q_STATS] = {
11685 /* 1 */ { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_bytes_received_hi), 8, "[%d]: rx_bytes" },
11686     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(error_bytes_received_hi),
11687                         8, "[%d]: rx_error_bytes" },
11688     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_unicast_packets_received_hi),
11689                         8, "[%d]: rx_ucast_packets" },
11690     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_multicast_packets_received_hi),
11691                         8, "[%d]: rx_mcast_packets" },
11692     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_broadcast_packets_received_hi),
11693                         8, "[%d]: rx_bcast_packets" },
11694     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(no_buff_discard_hi), 8, "[%d]: rx_discards" },
11695     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(rx_err_discard_pkt),
11696                      4, "[%d]: rx_phy_ip_err_discards"},
11697     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(rx_skb_alloc_failed),
11698                      4, "[%d]: rx_skb_alloc_discard" },
11699     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(hw_csum_err), 4, "[%d]: rx_csum_offload_errors" },
11700 
11701 /* 10 */{ Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_bytes_transmitted_hi), 8, "[%d]: tx_bytes" },
11702     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_unicast_packets_transmitted_hi),
11703                         8, "[%d]: tx_ucast_packets" },
11704     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_multicast_packets_transmitted_hi),
11705                         8, "[%d]: tx_mcast_packets" },
11706     { Q_STATS_OFFSET32(total_broadcast_packets_transmitted_hi),
11707                         8, "[%d]: tx_bcast_packets" }
11708 };
11709 
11710 static const struct {
11711     long offset;
11712     int size;
11713     u32 flags;
11714 #define STATS_FLAGS_PORT        1
11715 #define STATS_FLAGS_FUNC        2
11716 #define STATS_FLAGS_BOTH        (STATS_FLAGS_FUNC | STATS_FLAGS_PORT)
11717     u8 string[ETH_GSTRING_LEN];
11718 } bnx2x_stats_arr[BNX2X_NUM_STATS] = {
11719 /* 1 */ { STATS_OFFSET32(total_bytes_received_hi),
11720                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_bytes" },
11721     { STATS_OFFSET32(error_bytes_received_hi),
11722                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_error_bytes" },
11723     { STATS_OFFSET32(total_unicast_packets_received_hi),
11724                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_ucast_packets" },
11725     { STATS_OFFSET32(total_multicast_packets_received_hi),
11726                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_mcast_packets" },
11727     { STATS_OFFSET32(total_broadcast_packets_received_hi),
11728                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_bcast_packets" },
11729     { STATS_OFFSET32(rx_stat_dot3statsfcserrors_hi),
11730                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_crc_errors" },
11731     { STATS_OFFSET32(rx_stat_dot3statsalignmenterrors_hi),
11732                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_align_errors" },
11733     { STATS_OFFSET32(rx_stat_etherstatsundersizepkts_hi),
11734                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_undersize_packets" },
11735     { STATS_OFFSET32(etherstatsoverrsizepkts_hi),
11736                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_oversize_packets" },
11737 /* 10 */{ STATS_OFFSET32(rx_stat_etherstatsfragments_hi),
11738                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_fragments" },
11739     { STATS_OFFSET32(rx_stat_etherstatsjabbers_hi),
11740                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_jabbers" },
11741     { STATS_OFFSET32(no_buff_discard_hi),
11742                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_discards" },
11743     { STATS_OFFSET32(mac_filter_discard),
11744                 4, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_filtered_packets" },
11745     { STATS_OFFSET32(xxoverflow_discard),
11746                 4, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_fw_discards" },
11747     { STATS_OFFSET32(brb_drop_hi),
11748                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_brb_discard" },
11749     { STATS_OFFSET32(brb_truncate_hi),
11750                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_brb_truncate" },
11751     { STATS_OFFSET32(pause_frames_received_hi),
11752                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_pause_frames" },
11753     { STATS_OFFSET32(rx_stat_maccontrolframesreceived_hi),
11754                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_mac_ctrl_frames" },
11755     { STATS_OFFSET32(nig_timer_max),
11756             4, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "rx_constant_pause_events" },
11757 /* 20 */{ STATS_OFFSET32(rx_err_discard_pkt),
11758                 4, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_phy_ip_err_discards"},
11759     { STATS_OFFSET32(rx_skb_alloc_failed),
11760                 4, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_skb_alloc_discard" },
11761     { STATS_OFFSET32(hw_csum_err),
11762                 4, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "rx_csum_offload_errors" },
11763 
11764     { STATS_OFFSET32(total_bytes_transmitted_hi),
11765                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "tx_bytes" },
11766     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_ifhcoutbadoctets_hi),
11767                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_error_bytes" },
11768     { STATS_OFFSET32(total_unicast_packets_transmitted_hi),
11769                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "tx_ucast_packets" },
11770     { STATS_OFFSET32(total_multicast_packets_transmitted_hi),
11771                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "tx_mcast_packets" },
11772     { STATS_OFFSET32(total_broadcast_packets_transmitted_hi),
11773                 8, STATS_FLAGS_BOTH, "tx_bcast_packets" },
11774     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_dot3statsinternalmactransmiterrors_hi),
11775                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_mac_errors" },
11776     { STATS_OFFSET32(rx_stat_dot3statscarriersenseerrors_hi),
11777                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_carrier_errors" },
11778 /* 30 */{ STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_dot3statssinglecollisionframes_hi),
11779                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_single_collisions" },
11780     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_dot3statsmultiplecollisionframes_hi),
11781                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_multi_collisions" },
11782     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_dot3statsdeferredtransmissions_hi),
11783                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_deferred" },
11784     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_dot3statsexcessivecollisions_hi),
11785                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_excess_collisions" },
11786     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_dot3statslatecollisions_hi),
11787                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_late_collisions" },
11788     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_etherstatscollisions_hi),
11789                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_total_collisions" },
11790     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_etherstatspkts64octets_hi),
11791                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_64_byte_packets" },
11792     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_etherstatspkts65octetsto127octets_hi),
11793             8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_65_to_127_byte_packets" },
11794     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_etherstatspkts128octetsto255octets_hi),
11795             8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_128_to_255_byte_packets" },
11796     { STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_etherstatspkts256octetsto511octets_hi),
11797             8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_256_to_511_byte_packets" },
11798 /* 40 */{ STATS_OFFSET32(tx_stat_etherstatspkts512octetsto1023octets_hi),
11799             8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_512_to_1023_byte_packets" },
11800     { STATS_OFFSET32(etherstatspkts1024octetsto1522octets_hi),
11801             8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_1024_to_1522_byte_packets" },
11802     { STATS_OFFSET32(etherstatspktsover1522octets_hi),
11803             8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_1523_to_9022_byte_packets" },
11804     { STATS_OFFSET32(pause_frames_sent_hi),
11805                 8, STATS_FLAGS_PORT, "tx_pause_frames" }
11806 };
11807 
11808 #define IS_PORT_STAT(i) \
11809     ((bnx2x_stats_arr[i].flags & STATS_FLAGS_BOTH) == STATS_FLAGS_PORT)
11810 #define IS_FUNC_STAT(i)     (bnx2x_stats_arr[i].flags & STATS_FLAGS_FUNC)
11811 #define IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp) \
11812             (IS_E1HMF(bp) && !(bp->msglevel & BNX2X_MSG_STATS))
11813 
11814 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020618) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
11815 static int bnx2x_get_sset_count(struct net_device *dev, int stringset)
11816 {
11817     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11818     int i, num_stats;
11819 
11820     switch (stringset) {
11821     case ETH_SS_STATS:
11822         if (is_multi(bp)) {
11823             num_stats = BNX2X_NUM_Q_STATS * bp->num_queues;
11824             if (!IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp))
11825                 num_stats += BNX2X_NUM_STATS;
11826         } else {
11827             if (IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp)) {
11828                 num_stats = 0;
11829                 for (i = 0; i < BNX2X_NUM_STATS; i++)
11830                     if (IS_FUNC_STAT(i))
11831                         num_stats++;
11832             } else
11833                 num_stats = BNX2X_NUM_STATS;
11834         }
11835         return num_stats;
11836 
11837     case ETH_SS_TEST:
11838         return BNX2X_NUM_TESTS;
11839 
11840     default:
11841         return -EINVAL;
11842     }
11843 }
11844 #else
11845 static int bnx2x_self_test_count(struct net_device *dev)
11846 {
11847     return BNX2X_NUM_TESTS;
11848 }
11849 
11850 static int bnx2x_get_stats_count(struct net_device *dev)
11851 {
11852     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11853     int i, num_stats;
11854 
11855     if (is_multi(bp)) {
11856         num_stats = BNX2X_NUM_Q_STATS * bp->num_queues;
11857         if (!IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp))
11858             num_stats += BNX2X_NUM_STATS;
11859     } else {
11860         if (IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp)) {
11861             num_stats = 0;
11862             for (i = 0; i < BNX2X_NUM_STATS; i++)
11863                 if (IS_FUNC_STAT(i))
11864                     num_stats++;
11865         } else
11866             num_stats = BNX2X_NUM_STATS;
11867     }
11868 
11869     return num_stats;
11870 }
11871 
11872 #endif
11873 
11874 static void bnx2x_get_strings(struct net_device *dev, u32 stringset, u8 *buf)
11875 {
11876     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11877     int i, j, k;
11878 
11879     switch (stringset) {
11880     case ETH_SS_STATS:
11881         if (is_multi(bp)) {
11882             k = 0;
11883             for_each_queue(bp, i) {
11884                 for (j = 0; j < BNX2X_NUM_Q_STATS; j++)
11885                     sprintf(buf + (k + j)*ETH_GSTRING_LEN,
11886                         bnx2x_q_stats_arr[j].string, i);
11887                 k += BNX2X_NUM_Q_STATS;
11888             }
11889             if (IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp))
11890                 break;
11891             for (j = 0; j < BNX2X_NUM_STATS; j++)
11892                 strcpy(buf + (k + j)*ETH_GSTRING_LEN,
11893                        bnx2x_stats_arr[j].string);
11894         } else {
11895             for (i = 0, j = 0; i < BNX2X_NUM_STATS; i++) {
11896                 if (IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp) && IS_PORT_STAT(i))
11897                     continue;
11898                 strcpy(buf + j*ETH_GSTRING_LEN,
11899                        bnx2x_stats_arr[i].string);
11900                 j++;
11901             }
11902         }
11903         break;
11904 
11905     case ETH_SS_TEST:
11906         memcpy(buf, bnx2x_tests_str_arr, sizeof(bnx2x_tests_str_arr));
11907         break;
11908     }
11909 }
11910 
11911 static void bnx2x_get_ethtool_stats(struct net_device *dev,
11912                     struct ethtool_stats *stats, u64 *buf)
11913 {
11914     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11915     u32 *hw_stats, *offset;
11916     int i, j, k;
11917 
11918     if (is_multi(bp)) {
11919         k = 0;
11920         for_each_queue(bp, i) {
11921             hw_stats = (u32 *)&bp->fp[i].eth_q_stats;
11922             for (j = 0; j < BNX2X_NUM_Q_STATS; j++) {
11923                 if (bnx2x_q_stats_arr[j].size == 0) {
11924                     /* skip this counter */
11925                     buf[k + j] = 0;
11926                     continue;
11927                 }
11928                 offset = (hw_stats +
11929                       bnx2x_q_stats_arr[j].offset);
11930                 if (bnx2x_q_stats_arr[j].size == 4) {
11931                     /* 4-byte counter */
11932                     buf[k + j] = (u64) *offset;
11933                     continue;
11934                 }
11935                 /* 8-byte counter */
11936                 buf[k + j] = HILO_U64(*offset, *(offset + 1));
11937             }
11938             k += BNX2X_NUM_Q_STATS;
11939         }
11940         if (IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp))
11941             return;
11942         hw_stats = (u32 *)&bp->eth_stats;
11943         for (j = 0; j < BNX2X_NUM_STATS; j++) {
11944             if (bnx2x_stats_arr[j].size == 0) {
11945                 /* skip this counter */
11946                 buf[k + j] = 0;
11947                 continue;
11948             }
11949             offset = (hw_stats + bnx2x_stats_arr[j].offset);
11950             if (bnx2x_stats_arr[j].size == 4) {
11951                 /* 4-byte counter */
11952                 buf[k + j] = (u64) *offset;
11953                 continue;
11954             }
11955             /* 8-byte counter */
11956             buf[k + j] = HILO_U64(*offset, *(offset + 1));
11957         }
11958     } else {
11959         hw_stats = (u32 *)&bp->eth_stats;
11960         for (i = 0, j = 0; i < BNX2X_NUM_STATS; i++) {
11961             if (IS_E1HMF_MODE_STAT(bp) && IS_PORT_STAT(i))
11962                 continue;
11963             if (bnx2x_stats_arr[i].size == 0) {
11964                 /* skip this counter */
11965                 buf[j] = 0;
11966                 j++;
11967                 continue;
11968             }
11969             offset = (hw_stats + bnx2x_stats_arr[i].offset);
11970             if (bnx2x_stats_arr[i].size == 4) {
11971                 /* 4-byte counter */
11972                 buf[j] = (u64) *offset;
11973                 j++;
11974                 continue;
11975             }
11976             /* 8-byte counter */
11977             buf[j] = HILO_U64(*offset, *(offset + 1));
11978             j++;
11979         }
11980     }
11981 }
11982 
11983 static int bnx2x_phys_id(struct net_device *dev, u32 data)
11984 {
11985     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
11986     int i;
11987 
11988     if (!netif_running(dev))
11989         return 0;
11990 
11991     if (!bp->port.pmf)
11992         return 0;
11993 
11994     if (data == 0)
11995         data = 2;
11996 
11997     for (i = 0; i < (data * 2); i++) {
11998         if ((i % 2) == 0)
11999             bnx2x_set_led(&bp->link_params, LED_MODE_OPER,
12000                       SPEED_1000);
12001         else
12002             bnx2x_set_led(&bp->link_params, LED_MODE_OFF, 0);
12003 
12004         msleep_interruptible(500);
12005         if (signal_pending(current))
12006             break;
12007     }
12008 
12009     if (bp->link_vars.link_up)
12010         bnx2x_set_led(&bp->link_params, LED_MODE_OPER,
12011                   bp->link_vars.line_speed);
12012 
12013     return 0;
12014 }
12015 
12016 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020613) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12017 static const struct ethtool_ops bnx2x_ethtool_ops = {
12018 #else
12019 static struct ethtool_ops bnx2x_ethtool_ops = {
12020 #endif
12021     .get_settings       = bnx2x_get_settings,
12022     .set_settings       = bnx2x_set_settings,
12023     .get_drvinfo        = bnx2x_get_drvinfo,
12024     .get_regs_len       = bnx2x_get_regs_len,
12025     .get_regs       = bnx2x_get_regs,
12026     .get_wol        = bnx2x_get_wol,
12027     .set_wol        = bnx2x_set_wol,
12028     .get_msglevel       = bnx2x_get_msglevel,
12029     .set_msglevel       = bnx2x_set_msglevel,
12030     .nway_reset     = bnx2x_nway_reset,
12031     .get_link       = bnx2x_get_link,
12032 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020418) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12033     .get_eeprom_len     = bnx2x_get_eeprom_len,
12034 #endif
12035     .get_eeprom     = bnx2x_get_eeprom,
12036     .set_eeprom     = bnx2x_set_eeprom,
12037     .get_coalesce       = bnx2x_get_coalesce,
12038     .set_coalesce       = bnx2x_set_coalesce,
12039     .get_ringparam      = bnx2x_get_ringparam,
12040     .set_ringparam      = bnx2x_set_ringparam,
12041     .get_pauseparam     = bnx2x_get_pauseparam,
12042     .set_pauseparam     = bnx2x_set_pauseparam,
12043     .get_rx_csum        = bnx2x_get_rx_csum,
12044     .set_rx_csum        = bnx2x_set_rx_csum,
12045     .get_tx_csum        = ethtool_op_get_tx_csum,
12046 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020618) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12047     .set_tx_csum        = ethtool_op_set_tx_hw_csum,
12048 #else
12049     .set_tx_csum        = bnx2x_set_tx_hw_csum,
12050 #endif
12051 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12052     .set_flags      = bnx2x_set_flags,
12053     .get_flags      = ethtool_op_get_flags,
12054 #endif
12055     .get_sg         = ethtool_op_get_sg,
12056     .set_sg         = ethtool_op_set_sg,
12057 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12058     .get_tso        = ethtool_op_get_tso,
12059     .set_tso        = bnx2x_set_tso,
12060 #endif
12061     .self_test      = bnx2x_self_test,
12062 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020618) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12063     .get_sset_count     = bnx2x_get_sset_count,
12064 #else
12065     .get_stats_count    = bnx2x_get_stats_count,
12066     .self_test_count    = bnx2x_self_test_count,
12067 #endif
12068     .get_strings        = bnx2x_get_strings,
12069     .phys_id        = bnx2x_phys_id,
12070     .get_ethtool_stats  = bnx2x_get_ethtool_stats,
12071 #ifdef ETHTOOL_GPERMADDR /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12072 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020617)
12073     .get_perm_addr      = ethtool_op_get_perm_addr
12074 #endif
12075 #endif
12076 };
12077 
12078 /* end of ethtool_ops */
12079 
12080 /****************************************************************************
12081 * General service functions
12082 ****************************************************************************/
12083 
12084 static int bnx2x_set_power_state(struct bnx2x *bp, pci_power_t state)
12085 {
12086     u16 pmcsr;
12087 
12088     pci_read_config_word(bp->pdev, bp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL, &pmcsr);
12089 
12090     switch (state) {
12091     case PCI_D0:
12092         pci_write_config_word(bp->pdev, bp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL,
12093                       ((pmcsr & ~PCI_PM_CTRL_STATE_MASK) |
12094                        PCI_PM_CTRL_PME_STATUS));
12095 
12096         if (pmcsr & PCI_PM_CTRL_STATE_MASK)
12097             /* delay required during transition out of D3hot */
12098             msleep(20);
12099         break;
12100 
12101     case PCI_D3hot:
12102         pmcsr &= ~PCI_PM_CTRL_STATE_MASK;
12103         pmcsr |= 3;
12104 
12105         if (bp->wol)
12106             pmcsr |= PCI_PM_CTRL_PME_ENABLE;
12107 
12108         pci_write_config_word(bp->pdev, bp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL,
12109                       pmcsr);
12110 
12111         /* No more memory access after this point until
12112         * device is brought back to D0.
12113         */
12114         break;
12115 
12116     default:
12117         return -EINVAL;
12118     }
12119     return 0;
12120 }
12121 
12122 static inline int bnx2x_has_rx_work(struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp)
12123 {
12124     u16 rx_cons_sb;
12125 
12126     /* Tell compiler that status block fields can change */
12127     barrier();
12128     rx_cons_sb = le16_to_cpu(*fp->rx_cons_sb);
12129     if ((rx_cons_sb & MAX_RCQ_DESC_CNT) == MAX_RCQ_DESC_CNT)
12130         rx_cons_sb++;
12131     return (fp->rx_comp_cons != rx_cons_sb);
12132 }
12133 
12134 #if !defined(BNX2X_NEW_NAPI) && defined(USE_NAPI_GRO) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12135 int  __bnx2x_poll(struct net_device *dev, int *budget) {
12136     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = dev->priv;
12137     int done;
12138     int todo = min(*budget, dev->quota);
12139     done =  bnx2x_poll(&fp->napi, todo);
12140     *budget -= done;
12141     dev->quota -= done;
12142     return (done >= todo) ? 1 : 0;
12143 }
12144 #endif
12145 /*
12146  * net_device service functions
12147  */
12148 
12149 #if defined(BNX2X_NEW_NAPI) || defined(USE_NAPI_GRO) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12150 static int bnx2x_poll(struct napi_struct *napi, int budget)
12151 #else
12152 static int bnx2x_poll(struct net_device *dev, int *budget)
12153 #endif
12154 {
12155     int work_done = 0;
12156 #if defined(BNX2X_NEW_NAPI) || defined(USE_NAPI_GRO)/* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12157     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = container_of(napi, struct bnx2x_fastpath,
12158                          napi);
12159     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
12160 #else /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12161     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp = dev->priv;
12162     struct bnx2x *bp = fp->bp;
12163     int orig_budget = min(*budget, dev->quota);
12164 #endif
12165 
12166     while (1) {
12167 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
12168         if (unlikely(bp->panic)) {
12169             napi_complete(napi);
12170             return 0;
12171         }
12172 #endif
12173 
12174 #ifndef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12175         /* There is only one Tx queue on kernels 2.6.26 and below */
12176         if (fp->index == 0)
12177 #endif
12178         if (bnx2x_has_tx_work(fp))
12179             bnx2x_tx_int(fp);
12180 
12181         if (bnx2x_has_rx_work(fp)) {
12182 #if defined(BNX2X_NEW_NAPI) || defined(USE_NAPI_GRO)/* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12183             work_done += bnx2x_rx_int(fp, budget - work_done);
12184 
12185             /* must not complete if we consumed full budget */
12186             if (work_done >= budget)
12187                 break;
12188 #else
12189             work_done = bnx2x_rx_int(fp, orig_budget);
12190 
12191             *budget -= work_done;
12192             dev->quota -= work_done;
12193             orig_budget = min(*budget, dev->quota);
12194             if (orig_budget <= 0)
12195                 break;
12196 #endif
12197         }
12198 
12199         /* Fall out from the NAPI loop if needed */
12200         if (!(bnx2x_has_rx_work(fp) || bnx2x_has_tx_work(fp))) {
12201             bnx2x_update_fpsb_idx(fp);
12202         /* bnx2x_has_rx_work() reads the status block, thus we need
12203          * to ensure that status block indices have been actually read
12204          * (bnx2x_update_fpsb_idx) prior to this check
12205          * (bnx2x_has_rx_work) so that we won't write the "newer"
12206          * value of the status block to IGU (if there was a DMA right
12207          * after bnx2x_has_rx_work and if there is no rmb, the memory
12208          * reading (bnx2x_update_fpsb_idx) may be postponed to right
12209          * before bnx2x_ack_sb). In this case there will never be
12210          * another interrupt until there is another update of the
12211          * status block, while there is still unhandled work.
12212          */
12213             rmb();
12214 
12215             if (!(bnx2x_has_rx_work(fp) || bnx2x_has_tx_work(fp))) {
12216                 napi_complete(napi);
12217                 /* Re-enable interrupts */
12218                 bnx2x_ack_sb(bp, fp->sb_id, CSTORM_ID,
12219                          le16_to_cpu(fp->fp_c_idx),
12220                          IGU_INT_NOP, 1);
12221                 bnx2x_ack_sb(bp, fp->sb_id, USTORM_ID,
12222                          le16_to_cpu(fp->fp_u_idx),
12223                          IGU_INT_ENABLE, 1);
12224 #ifndef BNX2X_NEW_NAPI
12225                 return 0;
12226 #else   /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12227                 break;
12228 #endif
12229             }
12230         }
12231     }
12232 
12233 #ifdef BNX2X_NEW_NAPI /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12234     return work_done;
12235 #else
12236     return 1;
12237 #endif
12238 }
12239 
12240 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020618) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12241 static struct net_device_stats *bnx2x_get_stats(struct net_device *dev)
12242 {
12243     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
12244 
12245     return &bp->net_stats;
12246 }
12247 #endif
12248 
12249 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12250 /* we split the first BD into headers and data BDs
12251  * to ease the pain of our fellow microcode engineers
12252  * we use one mapping for both BDs
12253  * So far this has only been observed to happen
12254  * in Other Operating Systems(TM)
12255  */
12256 static noinline u16 bnx2x_tx_split(struct bnx2x *bp,
12257                    struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp,
12258                    struct sw_tx_bd *tx_buf,
12259                    struct eth_tx_start_bd **tx_bd, u16 hlen,
12260                    u16 bd_prod, int nbd)
12261 {
12262     struct eth_tx_start_bd *h_tx_bd = *tx_bd;
12263     struct eth_tx_bd *d_tx_bd;
12264     dma_addr_t mapping;
12265     int old_len = le16_to_cpu(h_tx_bd->nbytes);
12266 
12267     /* first fix first BD */
12268     h_tx_bd->nbd = cpu_to_le16(nbd);
12269     h_tx_bd->nbytes = cpu_to_le16(hlen);
12270 
12271     DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED, "TSO split header size is %d "
12272        "(%x:%x) nbd %d\n", h_tx_bd->nbytes, h_tx_bd->addr_hi,
12273        h_tx_bd->addr_lo, h_tx_bd->nbd);
12274 
12275     /* now get a new data BD
12276      * (after the pbd) and fill it */
12277     bd_prod = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_prod));
12278     d_tx_bd = &fp->tx_desc_ring[bd_prod].reg_bd;
12279 
12280     mapping = HILO_U64(le32_to_cpu(h_tx_bd->addr_hi),
12281                le32_to_cpu(h_tx_bd->addr_lo)) + hlen;
12282 
12283     d_tx_bd->addr_hi = cpu_to_le32(U64_HI(mapping));
12284     d_tx_bd->addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(U64_LO(mapping));
12285     d_tx_bd->nbytes = cpu_to_le16(old_len - hlen);
12286 
12287     /* this marks the BD as one that has no individual mapping */
12288     tx_buf->flags |= BNX2X_TSO_SPLIT_BD;
12289 
12290     DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED,
12291        "TSO split data size is %d (%x:%x)\n",
12292        d_tx_bd->nbytes, d_tx_bd->addr_hi, d_tx_bd->addr_lo);
12293 
12294     /* update tx_bd */
12295     *tx_bd = (struct eth_tx_start_bd *)d_tx_bd;
12296 
12297     return bd_prod;
12298 }
12299 #endif
12300 
12301 static inline u16 bnx2x_csum_fix(unsigned char *t_header, u16 csum, s8 fix)
12302 {
12303     if (fix > 0)
12304         csum = (u16) ~csum_fold(csum_sub(csum,
12305                 csum_partial(t_header - fix, fix, 0)));
12306 
12307     else if (fix < 0)
12308         csum = (u16) ~csum_fold(csum_add(csum,
12309                 csum_partial(t_header, -fix, 0)));
12310 
12311     return swab16(csum);
12312 }
12313 
12314 static inline u32 bnx2x_xmit_type(struct bnx2x *bp, struct sk_buff *skb)
12315 {
12316     u32 rc;
12317 
12318     if (skb->ip_summed != CHECKSUM_PARTIAL)
12319         rc = XMIT_PLAIN;
12320 
12321     else {
12322         if (skb->protocol == htons(ETH_P_IPV6)) {
12323             rc = XMIT_CSUM_V6;
12324             if (ipv6_hdr(skb)->nexthdr == IPPROTO_TCP)
12325                 rc |= XMIT_CSUM_TCP;
12326 
12327         } else {
12328             rc = XMIT_CSUM_V4;
12329             if (ip_hdr(skb)->protocol == IPPROTO_TCP)
12330                 rc |= XMIT_CSUM_TCP;
12331         }
12332     }
12333 
12334 #ifdef NETIF_F_GSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12335     if (skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_type & SKB_GSO_TCPV4)
12336         rc |= (XMIT_GSO_V4 | XMIT_CSUM_V4 | XMIT_CSUM_TCP);
12337 
12338 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO6 /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12339     else if (skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_type & SKB_GSO_TCPV6)
12340         rc |= (XMIT_GSO_V6 | XMIT_CSUM_TCP | XMIT_CSUM_V6);
12341 #endif
12342 #elif defined(NETIF_F_TSO) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12343     if ((skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_size) &&
12344         (skb->len > (bp->dev->mtu + ETH_HLEN)))
12345         rc |= (XMIT_GSO_V4 | XMIT_CSUM_V4 | XMIT_CSUM_TCP);
12346 #endif
12347 
12348     return rc;
12349 }
12350 
12351 #if (MAX_SKB_FRAGS >= MAX_FETCH_BD - 3)
12352 /* check if packet requires linearization (packet is too fragmented)
12353    no need to check fragmentation if page size > 8K (there will be no
12354    violation to FW restrictions) */
12355 static int bnx2x_pkt_req_lin(struct bnx2x *bp, struct sk_buff *skb,
12356                  u32 xmit_type)
12357 {
12358     int to_copy = 0;
12359     int hlen = 0;
12360     int first_bd_sz = 0;
12361 
12362     /* 3 = 1 (for linear data BD) + 2 (for PBD and last BD) */
12363     if (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags >= (MAX_FETCH_BD - 3)) {
12364 
12365         if (xmit_type & XMIT_GSO) {
12366 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12367             unsigned short lso_mss = skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_size;
12368             /* Check if LSO packet needs to be copied:
12369                3 = 1 (for headers BD) + 2 (for PBD and last BD) */
12370             int wnd_size = MAX_FETCH_BD - 3;
12371             /* Number of windows to check */
12372             int num_wnds = skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags - wnd_size;
12373             int wnd_idx = 0;
12374             int frag_idx = 0;
12375             u32 wnd_sum = 0;
12376 
12377             /* Headers length */
12378             hlen = (int)(skb_transport_header(skb) - skb->data) +
12379                 tcp_hdrlen(skb);
12380 
12381             /* Amount of data (w/o headers) on linear part of SKB*/
12382             first_bd_sz = skb_headlen(skb) - hlen;
12383 
12384             wnd_sum  = first_bd_sz;
12385 
12386             /* Calculate the first sum - it's special */
12387             for (frag_idx = 0; frag_idx < wnd_size - 1; frag_idx++)
12388                 wnd_sum +=
12389                     skb_shinfo(skb)->frags[frag_idx].size;
12390 
12391             /* If there was data on linear skb data - check it */
12392             if (first_bd_sz > 0) {
12393                 if (unlikely(wnd_sum < lso_mss)) {
12394                     to_copy = 1;
12395                     goto exit_lbl;
12396                 }
12397 
12398                 wnd_sum -= first_bd_sz;
12399             }
12400 
12401             /* Others are easier: run through the frag list and
12402                check all windows */
12403             for (wnd_idx = 0; wnd_idx <= num_wnds; wnd_idx++) {
12404                 wnd_sum +=
12405               skb_shinfo(skb)->frags[wnd_idx + wnd_size - 1].size;
12406 
12407                 if (unlikely(wnd_sum < lso_mss)) {
12408                     to_copy = 1;
12409                     break;
12410                 }
12411                 wnd_sum -=
12412                     skb_shinfo(skb)->frags[wnd_idx].size;
12413             }
12414 #endif
12415         } else {
12416             /* in non-LSO too fragmented packet should always
12417                be linearized */
12418             to_copy = 1;
12419         }
12420     }
12421 
12422 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12423 exit_lbl:
12424 #endif
12425     if (unlikely(to_copy))
12426         DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED,
12427            "Linearization IS REQUIRED for %s packet. "
12428            "num_frags %d  hlen %d  first_bd_sz %d\n",
12429            (xmit_type & XMIT_GSO) ? "LSO" : "non-LSO",
12430            skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags, hlen, first_bd_sz);
12431 
12432     return to_copy;
12433 }
12434 #endif
12435 
12436 #ifdef BNX2X_SAFC /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12437 static u16 bnx2x_select_queue(struct net_device *dev, struct sk_buff *skb)
12438 {
12439     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
12440     int i, fp_index = 0;
12441 
12442     /* Determine which tx ring we will be placed on */
12443     switch (bp->multi_mode) {
12444     case ETH_RSS_MODE_VLAN_PRI:
12445     case ETH_RSS_MODE_E1HOV_PRI:
12446 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
12447         if ((bp->vlgrp != NULL) && vlan_tx_tag_present(skb)) {
12448             i = ((vlan_tx_tag_get(skb) >> 13) & 0x7);
12449             fp_index = bp->cos_map[bp->pri_map[i]];
12450         }
12451 #endif
12452         break;
12453 
12454     case ETH_RSS_MODE_IP_DSCP:
12455         if (skb->protocol == htons(ETH_P_IP)) {
12456             i = ((ip_hdr(skb)->tos >> 2) & 0x7);
12457             fp_index = bp->cos_map[bp->pri_map[i]];
12458         }
12459         break;
12460     default:
12461         fp_index = skb_tx_hash(dev, skb);
12462     }
12463 
12464     return fp_index;
12465 }
12466 #endif
12467 /* called with netif_tx_lock
12468  * bnx2x_tx_int() runs without netif_tx_lock unless it needs to call
12469  * netif_wake_queue()
12470  */
12471 static netdev_tx_t bnx2x_start_xmit(struct sk_buff *skb, struct net_device *dev)
12472 {
12473     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
12474     struct bnx2x_fastpath *fp;
12475 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12476     struct netdev_queue *txq;
12477 #endif
12478     struct sw_tx_bd *tx_buf;
12479     struct eth_tx_start_bd *tx_start_bd;
12480     struct eth_tx_bd *tx_data_bd, *total_pkt_bd = NULL;
12481     struct eth_tx_parse_bd *pbd = NULL;
12482     u16 pkt_prod, bd_prod;
12483     int nbd, fp_index;
12484     dma_addr_t mapping;
12485     u32 xmit_type = bnx2x_xmit_type(bp, skb);
12486     int i;
12487     u8 hlen = 0;
12488     __le16 pkt_size = 0;  
12489     struct ethhdr *eth;
12490     u8 mac_type = UNICAST_ADDRESS;
12491 
12492 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
12493     if (unlikely(bp->panic))
12494         return NETDEV_TX_BUSY;
12495 #endif
12496 
12497 #if defined(__VMKLNX__) && defined(__VMKNETDDI_QUEUEOPS__)
12498     VMK_ASSERT(skb->queue_mapping < BNX2X_NUM_QUEUES(bp));
12499     fp_index = skb->queue_mapping;
12500     txq = netdev_get_tx_queue(dev, fp_index);
12501 #else /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12502 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12503     fp_index = skb_get_queue_mapping(skb);
12504     txq = netdev_get_tx_queue(dev, fp_index);
12505 #else
12506     fp_index = 0;
12507 #endif
12508 #endif
12509 
12510     fp = &bp->fp[fp_index];
12511 
12512     if (unlikely(bnx2x_tx_avail(fp) < (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags + 3))) {
12513         fp->eth_q_stats.driver_xoff++;
12514 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12515         netif_tx_stop_queue(txq);
12516 #else
12517         netif_stop_queue(dev);
12518 #endif
12519         BNX2X_ERR("BUG! Tx ring full when queue awake!\n");
12520         return NETDEV_TX_BUSY;
12521     }
12522 
12523 #ifdef NETIF_F_GSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12524     DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED, "SKB: summed %x  protocol %x  protocol(%x,%x)"
12525        "  gso type %x  xmit_type %x\n",
12526        skb->ip_summed, skb->protocol, ipv6_hdr(skb)->nexthdr,
12527        ip_hdr(skb)->protocol, skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_type, xmit_type);
12528 #endif
12529 
12530     eth = (struct ethhdr*)skb->data;
12531 
12532     /* set flag according to packet type (UNICAST_ADDRESS is default)*/
12533     if (unlikely(is_multicast_ether_addr(eth->h_dest))) {
12534         if (is_broadcast_ether_addr(eth->h_dest))
12535             mac_type = BROADCAST_ADDRESS;
12536         else
12537             mac_type = MULTICAST_ADDRESS;
12538     }
12539 
12540 #if (MAX_SKB_FRAGS >= MAX_FETCH_BD - 3)
12541     /* First, check if we need to linearize the skb (due to FW
12542        restrictions). No need to check fragmentation if page size > 8K
12543        (there will be no violation to FW restrictions) */
12544     if (bnx2x_pkt_req_lin(bp, skb, xmit_type)) {
12545         /* Statistics of linearization */
12546         bp->lin_cnt++;
12547 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE > 0x020611) || defined(SLE_VERSION_CODE) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12548         if (skb_linearize(skb) != 0) {
12549 #else
12550         if (skb_linearize(skb, GFP_ATOMIC) != 0) {
12551 #endif
12552             DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED, "SKB linearization failed - "
12553                "silently dropping this SKB\n");
12554             dev_kfree_skb_any(skb);
12555             return NETDEV_TX_OK;
12556         }
12557     }
12558 #endif
12559 
12560     /*
12561     Please read carefully. First we use one BD which we mark as start,
12562     then we have a parsing info BD (used for TSO or xsum),
12563     and only then we have the rest of the TSO BDs.
12564     (don't forget to mark the last one as last,
12565     and to unmap only AFTER you write to the BD ...)
12566     And above all, all pdb sizes are in words - NOT DWORDS!
12567     */
12568 
12569     pkt_prod = fp->tx_pkt_prod++;
12570     bd_prod = TX_BD(fp->tx_bd_prod);
12571 
12572     /* get a tx_buf and first BD */
12573     tx_buf = &fp->tx_buf_ring[TX_BD(pkt_prod)];
12574     tx_start_bd = &fp->tx_desc_ring[bd_prod].start_bd;
12575 
12576     tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield = ETH_TX_BD_FLAGS_START_BD;
12577     tx_start_bd->general_data =  (mac_type <<
12578                     ETH_TX_START_BD_ETH_ADDR_TYPE_SHIFT);
12579     /* header nbd */
12580     tx_start_bd->general_data |= (1 << ETH_TX_START_BD_HDR_NBDS_SHIFT);
12581 
12582     /* remember the first BD of the packet */
12583     tx_buf->first_bd = fp->tx_bd_prod;
12584     tx_buf->skb = skb;
12585     tx_buf->flags = 0;
12586 
12587     DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED,
12588        "sending pkt %u @%p  next_idx %u  bd %u @%p\n",
12589        pkt_prod, tx_buf, fp->tx_pkt_prod, bd_prod, tx_start_bd);
12590 
12591 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
12592     if ((bp->vlgrp != NULL) && vlan_tx_tag_present(skb) &&
12593         (bp->flags & HW_VLAN_TX_FLAG)) {
12594         tx_start_bd->vlan = cpu_to_le16(vlan_tx_tag_get(skb));
12595         tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield |= ETH_TX_BD_FLAGS_VLAN_TAG;
12596     } else
12597 #endif
12598         tx_start_bd->vlan = cpu_to_le16(pkt_prod);
12599 
12600     /* turn on parsing and get a BD */
12601     bd_prod = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_prod));
12602     pbd = &fp->tx_desc_ring[bd_prod].parse_bd;
12603 
12604     memset(pbd, 0, sizeof(struct eth_tx_parse_bd));
12605 
12606     if (xmit_type & XMIT_CSUM) {
12607         hlen = (skb_network_header(skb) - skb->data) / 2;
12608 
12609         /* for now NS flag is not used in Linux */
12610         pbd->global_data =
12611             (hlen | ((skb->protocol == cpu_to_be16(ETH_P_8021Q)) <<
12612                  ETH_TX_PARSE_BD_LLC_SNAP_EN_SHIFT));
12613 
12614         pbd->ip_hlen = (skb_transport_header(skb) -
12615                 skb_network_header(skb)) / 2;
12616 
12617         hlen += pbd->ip_hlen + tcp_hdrlen(skb) / 2;
12618 
12619         pbd->total_hlen = cpu_to_le16(hlen);
12620         hlen = hlen*2;
12621 
12622         tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield |= ETH_TX_BD_FLAGS_L4_CSUM;
12623 
12624         if (xmit_type & XMIT_CSUM_V4)
12625             tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield |=
12626                         ETH_TX_BD_FLAGS_IP_CSUM;
12627         else
12628             tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield |=
12629                         ETH_TX_BD_FLAGS_IPV6;
12630 
12631         if (xmit_type & XMIT_CSUM_TCP) {
12632             pbd->tcp_pseudo_csum = swab16(tcp_hdr(skb)->check);
12633 
12634         } else {
12635             s8 fix = SKB_CS_OFF(skb); /* signed! */
12636 
12637             pbd->global_data |= ETH_TX_PARSE_BD_UDP_CS_FLG;
12638 
12639             DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED,
12640                "hlen %d  fix %d  csum before fix %x\n",
12641                le16_to_cpu(pbd->total_hlen), fix, SKB_CS(skb));
12642 
12643             /* HW bug: fixup the CSUM */
12644             pbd->tcp_pseudo_csum =
12645                 bnx2x_csum_fix(skb_transport_header(skb),
12646                            SKB_CS(skb), fix);
12647 
12648             DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED, "csum after fix %x\n",
12649                pbd->tcp_pseudo_csum);
12650         }
12651     }
12652 
12653     mapping = pci_map_single(bp->pdev, skb->data,
12654                  skb_headlen(skb), PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
12655 
12656     tx_start_bd->addr_hi = cpu_to_le32(U64_HI(mapping));
12657     tx_start_bd->addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(U64_LO(mapping));
12658     nbd = skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags + 2; /* start_bd + pbd + frags */
12659     tx_start_bd->nbd = cpu_to_le16(nbd);
12660     tx_start_bd->nbytes = cpu_to_le16(skb_headlen(skb));
12661     pkt_size = tx_start_bd->nbytes;
12662 
12663     DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED, "first bd @%p  addr (%x:%x)  nbd %d"
12664        "  nbytes %d  flags %x  vlan %x\n",
12665        tx_start_bd, tx_start_bd->addr_hi, tx_start_bd->addr_lo,
12666        le16_to_cpu(tx_start_bd->nbd), le16_to_cpu(tx_start_bd->nbytes),
12667        tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield, le16_to_cpu(tx_start_bd->vlan));
12668 
12669 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12670     if (xmit_type & XMIT_GSO) {
12671 
12672         DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED,
12673            "TSO packet len %d  hlen %d  total len %d  tso size %d\n",
12674            skb->len, hlen, skb_headlen(skb),
12675            skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_size);
12676 
12677         tx_start_bd->bd_flags.as_bitfield |= ETH_TX_BD_FLAGS_SW_LSO;
12678 
12679         if (unlikely(skb_headlen(skb) > hlen))
12680             bd_prod = bnx2x_tx_split(bp, fp, tx_buf, &tx_start_bd,
12681                          hlen, bd_prod, ++nbd);
12682 
12683         pbd->lso_mss = cpu_to_le16(skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_size);
12684         pbd->tcp_send_seq = swab32(tcp_hdr(skb)->seq);
12685         pbd->tcp_flags = pbd_tcp_flags(skb);
12686 
12687         if (xmit_type & XMIT_GSO_V4) {
12688             pbd->ip_id = swab16(ip_hdr(skb)->id);
12689             pbd->tcp_pseudo_csum =
12690                 swab16(~csum_tcpudp_magic(ip_hdr(skb)->saddr,
12691                               ip_hdr(skb)->daddr,
12692                               0, IPPROTO_TCP, 0));
12693 
12694         } else
12695             pbd->tcp_pseudo_csum =
12696                 swab16(~csum_ipv6_magic(&ipv6_hdr(skb)->saddr,
12697                             &ipv6_hdr(skb)->daddr,
12698                             0, IPPROTO_TCP, 0));
12699 
12700         pbd->global_data |= ETH_TX_PARSE_BD_PSEUDO_CS_WITHOUT_LEN;
12701     }
12702 #endif
12703     tx_data_bd = (struct eth_tx_bd *)tx_start_bd;
12704 
12705     for (i = 0; i < skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags; i++) {
12706         skb_frag_t *frag = &skb_shinfo(skb)->frags[i];
12707 
12708         bd_prod = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_prod));
12709         tx_data_bd = &fp->tx_desc_ring[bd_prod].reg_bd;
12710         if (total_pkt_bd == NULL)
12711             total_pkt_bd = &fp->tx_desc_ring[bd_prod].reg_bd;
12712 
12713         mapping = pci_map_page(bp->pdev, frag->page, frag->page_offset,
12714                        frag->size, PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
12715 
12716         tx_data_bd->addr_hi = cpu_to_le32(U64_HI(mapping));
12717         tx_data_bd->addr_lo = cpu_to_le32(U64_LO(mapping));
12718         tx_data_bd->nbytes = cpu_to_le16(frag->size);
12719         le16_add_cpu(&pkt_size, frag->size);
12720 
12721         DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED,
12722            "frag %d  bd @%p  addr (%x:%x)  nbytes %d\n",
12723            i, tx_data_bd, tx_data_bd->addr_hi, tx_data_bd->addr_lo,
12724            le16_to_cpu(tx_data_bd->nbytes));
12725     }
12726 
12727     DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED, "last bd @%p\n", tx_data_bd);
12728 
12729     bd_prod = TX_BD(NEXT_TX_IDX(bd_prod));
12730 
12731     /* now send a tx doorbell, counting the next BD
12732      * if the packet contains or ends with it
12733      */
12734     if (TX_BD_POFF(bd_prod) < nbd)
12735         nbd++;
12736 
12737     if (total_pkt_bd != NULL)
12738         total_pkt_bd->total_pkt_bytes = pkt_size;
12739 
12740     if (pbd)
12741         DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED,
12742            "PBD @%p  ip_data %x  ip_hlen %u  ip_id %u  lso_mss %u"
12743            "  tcp_flags %x  xsum %x  seq %u  hlen %u\n",
12744            pbd, pbd->global_data, pbd->ip_hlen, pbd->ip_id,
12745            pbd->lso_mss, pbd->tcp_flags, pbd->tcp_pseudo_csum,
12746            pbd->tcp_send_seq, le16_to_cpu(pbd->total_hlen));
12747 
12748     DP(NETIF_MSG_TX_QUEUED, "doorbell: nbd %d  bd %u\n", nbd, bd_prod);
12749 
12750     /*
12751      * Make sure that the BD data is updated before updating the producer
12752      * since FW might read the BD right after the producer is updated.
12753      * This is only applicable for weak-ordered memory model archs such
12754      * as IA-64. The following barrier is also mandatory since FW will
12755      * assumes packets must have BDs.
12756      */
12757     wmb();
12758 
12759     fp->tx_db.data.prod += nbd;
12760     barrier();
12761     DOORBELL(bp, fp->index, fp->tx_db.raw);
12762 
12763     mmiowb();
12764 
12765     fp->tx_bd_prod += nbd;
12766 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061f) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12767     /* In kernels starting from 2.6.31 netdev layer does this */
12768     dev->trans_start = jiffies;
12769 #endif
12770 
12771     if (unlikely(bnx2x_tx_avail(fp) < MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 3)) {
12772 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12773         netif_tx_stop_queue(txq);
12774 #else
12775         netif_stop_queue(dev);
12776 #endif
12777         /* We want bnx2x_tx_int to "see" the updated tx_bd_prod
12778            if we put Tx into XOFF state. */
12779         smp_mb();
12780         fp->eth_q_stats.driver_xoff++;
12781         if (bnx2x_tx_avail(fp) >= MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 3)
12782 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12783             netif_tx_wake_queue(txq);
12784 #else
12785             netif_wake_queue(dev);
12786 #endif
12787     }
12788     fp->tx_pkt++;
12789 
12790     return NETDEV_TX_OK;
12791 }
12792 
12793 /* called with rtnl_lock */
12794 int bnx2x_open(struct net_device *dev)
12795 {
12796     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
12797 
12798     netif_carrier_off(dev);
12799 
12800     bnx2x_set_power_state(bp, PCI_D0);
12801 
12802     return bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_OPEN);
12803 }
12804 
12805 /* called with rtnl_lock */
12806 int bnx2x_close(struct net_device *dev)
12807 {
12808     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
12809 
12810     /* Unload the driver, release IRQs */
12811     bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_CLOSE);
12812 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12813     if (atomic_read(&bp->pdev->enable_cnt) == 1)
12814 #endif
12815         if (!CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
12816             bnx2x_set_power_state(bp, PCI_D3hot);
12817 
12818     return 0;
12819 }
12820 
12821 /* called with netif_tx_lock from dev_mcast.c */
12822 static void bnx2x_set_rx_mode(struct net_device *dev)
12823 {
12824     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
12825     u32 rx_mode = BNX2X_RX_MODE_NORMAL;
12826     int port = BP_PORT(bp);
12827 
12828     if (bp->state != BNX2X_STATE_OPEN) {
12829         DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP, "state is %x, returning\n", bp->state);
12830         return;
12831     }
12832 
12833     DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP, "dev->flags = %x\n", dev->flags);
12834 
12835     if (dev->flags & IFF_PROMISC)
12836         rx_mode = BNX2X_RX_MODE_PROMISC;
12837 
12838     else if ((dev->flags & IFF_ALLMULTI) ||
12839          ((dev->mc_count > BNX2X_MAX_MULTICAST) && CHIP_IS_E1(bp)))
12840         rx_mode = BNX2X_RX_MODE_ALLMULTI;
12841 
12842     else { /* some multicasts */
12843         if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp)) {
12844             int i, old, offset;
12845             struct dev_mc_list *mclist;
12846             struct mac_configuration_cmd *config =
12847                         bnx2x_sp(bp, mcast_config);
12848 
12849             for (i = 0, mclist = dev->mc_list;
12850                  mclist && (i < dev->mc_count);
12851                  i++, mclist = mclist->next) {
12852 
12853                 config->config_table[i].
12854                     cam_entry.msb_mac_addr =
12855                     swab16(*(u16 *)&mclist->dmi_addr[0]);
12856                 config->config_table[i].
12857                     cam_entry.middle_mac_addr =
12858                     swab16(*(u16 *)&mclist->dmi_addr[2]);
12859                 config->config_table[i].
12860                     cam_entry.lsb_mac_addr =
12861                     swab16(*(u16 *)&mclist->dmi_addr[4]);
12862                 config->config_table[i].cam_entry.flags =
12863                             cpu_to_le16(port);
12864                 config->config_table[i].
12865                     target_table_entry.flags = 0;
12866                 config->config_table[i].target_table_entry.
12867                     clients_bit_vector =
