12868                         cpu_to_le32(1 << BP_L_ID(bp));
12869                 config->config_table[i].
12870                     target_table_entry.vlan_id = 0;
12871 
12872                 DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP,
12873                    "setting MCAST[%d] (%04x:%04x:%04x)\n", i,
12874                    config->config_table[i].
12875                         cam_entry.msb_mac_addr,
12876                    config->config_table[i].
12877                         cam_entry.middle_mac_addr,
12878                    config->config_table[i].
12879                         cam_entry.lsb_mac_addr);
12880             }
12881             old = config->hdr.length;
12882             if (old > i) {
12883                 for (; i < old; i++) {
12884                     if (CAM_IS_INVALID(config->
12885                                config_table[i])) {
12886                         /* already invalidated */
12887                         break;
12888                     }
12889                     /* invalidate */
12890                     CAM_INVALIDATE(config->
12891                                config_table[i]);
12892                 }
12893             }
12894 
12895             if (CHIP_REV_IS_SLOW(bp))
12896                 offset = BNX2X_MAX_EMUL_MULTI*(1 + port);
12897             else
12898                 offset = BNX2X_MAX_MULTICAST*(1 + port);
12899 
12900             config->hdr.length = i;
12901             config->hdr.offset = offset;
12902             config->hdr.client_id = bp->fp->cl_id;
12903             config->hdr.reserved1 = 0;
12904 
12905             bp->set_mac_pending++;
12906             smp_wmb();
12907 
12908             bnx2x_sp_post(bp, RAMROD_CMD_ID_ETH_SET_MAC, 0,
12909                    U64_HI(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, mcast_config)),
12910                    U64_LO(bnx2x_sp_mapping(bp, mcast_config)),
12911                       0);
12912         } else { /* E1H */
12913             /* Accept one or more multicasts */
12914             struct dev_mc_list *mclist;
12915             u32 mc_filter[MC_HASH_SIZE];
12916             u32 crc, bit, regidx;
12917             int i;
12918 
12919             memset(mc_filter, 0, 4 * MC_HASH_SIZE);
12920 
12921             for (i = 0, mclist = dev->mc_list;
12922                  mclist && (i < dev->mc_count);
12923                  i++, mclist = mclist->next) {
12924 
12925 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061b) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
12926                 DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP, "Adding mcast MAC: %pM\n",
12927                    mclist->dmi_addr);
12928 #else
12929                 DP(NETIF_MSG_IFUP, "Adding mcast MAC: "
12930                    "%02x:%02x:%02x:%02x:%02x:%02x\n",
12931                    mclist->dmi_addr[0], mclist->dmi_addr[1],
12932                    mclist->dmi_addr[2], mclist->dmi_addr[3],
12933                    mclist->dmi_addr[4], mclist->dmi_addr[5]);
12934 #endif
12935 
12936                 crc = crc32c_le(0, mclist->dmi_addr, ETH_ALEN);
12937                 bit = (crc >> 24) & 0xff;
12938                 regidx = bit >> 5;
12939                 bit &= 0x1f;
12940                 mc_filter[regidx] |= (1 << bit);
12941             }
12942 
12943             for (i = 0; i < MC_HASH_SIZE; i++)
12944                 REG_WR(bp, MC_HASH_OFFSET(bp, i),
12945                        mc_filter[i]);
12946         }
12947     }
12948 
12949     bp->rx_mode = rx_mode;
12950     bnx2x_set_storm_rx_mode(bp);
12951 }
12952 
12953 /* called with rtnl_lock */
12954 static int bnx2x_change_mac_addr(struct net_device *dev, void *p)
12955 {
12956     struct sockaddr *addr = p;
12957     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
12958 
12959     if (!is_valid_ether_addr((u8 *)(addr->sa_data)))
12960         return -EINVAL;
12961 
12962     memcpy(dev->dev_addr, addr->sa_data, dev->addr_len);
12963     if (netif_running(dev)) {
12964         if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp))
12965             bnx2x_set_eth_mac_addr_e1(bp, 1);
12966         else
12967             bnx2x_set_eth_mac_addr_e1h(bp, 1);
12968     }
12969 
12970     return 0;
12971 }
12972 
12973 /* called with rtnl_lock */
12974 static int bnx2x_mdio_read(struct net_device *netdev, int prtad,
12975                int devad, u16 addr)
12976 {
12977     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(netdev);
12978     u16 value;
12979     int rc;
12980     u32 phy_type = XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
12981 
12982     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "mdio_read: prtad 0x%x, devad 0x%x, addr 0x%x\n",
12983        prtad, devad, addr);
12984 
12985     if (prtad != bp->mdio.prtad) {
12986         DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "prtad missmatch (cmd:0x%x != bp:0x%x)\n",
12987            prtad, bp->mdio.prtad);
12988         return -EINVAL;
12989     }
12990 
12991     /* The HW expects different devad if CL22 is used */
12992     devad = (devad == MDIO_DEVAD_NONE) ? DEFAULT_PHY_DEV_ADDR : devad;
12993 
12994     bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(bp);
12995     rc = bnx2x_cl45_read(bp, BP_PORT(bp), phy_type, prtad,
12996                  devad, addr, &value);
12997     bnx2x_release_phy_lock(bp);
12998     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "mdio_read_val 0x%x rc = 0x%x\n", value, rc);
12999 
13000     if (!rc)
13001         rc = value;
13002     return rc;
13003 }
13004 
13005 /* called with rtnl_lock */
13006 static int bnx2x_mdio_write(struct net_device *netdev, int prtad, int devad,
13007                 u16 addr, u16 value)
13008 {
13009     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(netdev);
13010     u32 ext_phy_type = XGXS_EXT_PHY_TYPE(bp->link_params.ext_phy_config);
13011     int rc;
13012 
13013     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "mdio_write: prtad 0x%x, devad 0x%x, addr 0x%x,"
13014                " value 0x%x\n", prtad, devad, addr, value);
13015 
13016     if (prtad != bp->mdio.prtad) {
13017         DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "prtad missmatch (cmd:0x%x != bp:0x%x)\n",
13018            prtad, bp->mdio.prtad);
13019         return -EINVAL;
13020     }
13021 
13022     /* The HW expects different devad if CL22 is used */
13023     devad = (devad == MDIO_DEVAD_NONE) ? DEFAULT_PHY_DEV_ADDR : devad;
13024 
13025     bnx2x_acquire_phy_lock(bp);
13026     rc = bnx2x_cl45_write(bp, BP_PORT(bp), ext_phy_type, prtad,
13027                   devad, addr, value);
13028     bnx2x_release_phy_lock(bp);
13029     return rc;
13030 }
13031 
13032 /* called with rtnl_lock */
13033 static int bnx2x_ioctl(struct net_device *dev, struct ifreq *ifr, int cmd)
13034 {
13035     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13036     struct mii_ioctl_data *mdio = if_mii(ifr);
13037 
13038     DP(NETIF_MSG_LINK, "ioctl: phy id 0x%x, reg 0x%x, val_in 0x%x\n",
13039        mdio->phy_id, mdio->reg_num, mdio->val_in);
13040 
13041     if (!netif_running(dev))
13042         return -EAGAIN;
13043 
13044     switch(cmd) {
13045 #if defined(VMWARE_ESX_DDK_VERSION) && (VMWARE_ESX_DDK_VERSION >= 40000) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13046 #define SIOBNX2CIM     0x89F0
13047     case SIOBNX2CIM:
13048         return bnx2x_ioctl_cim(dev, ifr);
13049 #endif
13050     default:
13051         return mdio_mii_ioctl(&bp->mdio, mdio, cmd);
13052     }
13053 }
13054 
13055 /* called with rtnl_lock */
13056 static int bnx2x_change_mtu(struct net_device *dev, int new_mtu)
13057 {
13058     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13059     int rc = 0;
13060 
13061     if ((new_mtu > ETH_MAX_JUMBO_PACKET_SIZE) ||
13062         ((new_mtu + ETH_HLEN) < ETH_MIN_PACKET_SIZE))
13063         return -EINVAL;
13064 
13065     /* This does not race with packet allocation
13066      * because the actual alloc size is
13067      * only updated as part of load
13068      */
13069     dev->mtu = new_mtu;
13070 
13071     if (netif_running(dev)) {
13072         bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_NORMAL);
13073         rc = bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_NORMAL);
13074     }
13075 
13076     return rc;
13077 }
13078 
13079 static void bnx2x_tx_timeout(struct net_device *dev)
13080 {
13081     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13082 
13083 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
13084     if (!bp->panic)
13085         bnx2x_panic();
13086 #endif
13087     /* This allows the netif to be shutdown gracefully before resetting */
13088     schedule_work(&bp->reset_task);
13089 }
13090 
13091 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
13092 /* called with rtnl_lock */
13093 static void bnx2x_vlan_rx_register(struct net_device *dev,
13094                    struct vlan_group *vlgrp)
13095 {
13096     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13097 
13098     bp->vlgrp = vlgrp;
13099 
13100     /* Set flags according to the required capabilities */
13101     bp->flags &= ~(HW_VLAN_RX_FLAG | HW_VLAN_TX_FLAG);
13102 
13103     if (dev->features & NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_TX)
13104         bp->flags |= HW_VLAN_TX_FLAG;
13105 
13106     if (dev->features & NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_RX)
13107         bp->flags |= HW_VLAN_RX_FLAG;
13108 
13109     if (netif_running(dev))
13110         bnx2x_set_client_config(bp);
13111 }
13112 
13113 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020616) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13114 static void bnx2x_vlan_rx_kill_vid(struct net_device *dev, uint16_t vid)
13115 {
13116     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13117 
13118     if (bp->vlgrp)
13119         vlan_group_set_device(bp->vlgrp, vid, NULL);
13120 }
13121 #endif
13122 #endif
13123 
13124 #if defined(HAVE_POLL_CONTROLLER) || defined(CONFIG_NET_POLL_CONTROLLER)
13125 static void poll_bnx2x(struct net_device *dev)
13126 {
13127     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13128 
13129     disable_irq(bp->pdev->irq);
13130 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020613) && (VMWARE_ESX_DDK_VERSION < 40000)
13131     bnx2x_interrupt(bp->pdev->irq, dev, NULL);
13132 #else /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13133     bnx2x_interrupt(bp->pdev->irq, dev);
13134 #endif
13135     enable_irq(bp->pdev->irq);
13136 }
13137 #endif
13138 
13139 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061e) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13140 static const struct net_device_ops bnx2x_netdev_ops = {
13141     .ndo_open       = bnx2x_open,
13142     .ndo_stop       = bnx2x_close,
13143     .ndo_start_xmit     = bnx2x_start_xmit,
13144 #ifdef BNX2X_SAFC /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13145     .ndo_select_queue   = bnx2x_select_queue,
13146 #endif
13147     .ndo_set_multicast_list = bnx2x_set_rx_mode,
13148     .ndo_set_mac_address    = bnx2x_change_mac_addr,
13149     .ndo_validate_addr  = eth_validate_addr,
13150     .ndo_do_ioctl       = bnx2x_ioctl,
13151     .ndo_change_mtu     = bnx2x_change_mtu,
13152     .ndo_tx_timeout     = bnx2x_tx_timeout,
13153 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
13154     .ndo_vlan_rx_register   = bnx2x_vlan_rx_register,
13155 #endif
13156 #if defined(HAVE_POLL_CONTROLLER) || defined(CONFIG_NET_POLL_CONTROLLER)
13157     .ndo_poll_controller    = poll_bnx2x,
13158 #endif
13159 };
13160 #endif
13161 
13162 static int __devinit bnx2x_init_dev(struct pci_dev *pdev,
13163                     struct net_device *dev)
13164 {
13165     struct bnx2x *bp;
13166     int rc;
13167 
13168 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020618) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13169     SET_MODULE_OWNER(dev);
13170 #endif
13171 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020419) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13172     SET_NETDEV_DEV(dev, &pdev->dev);
13173 #endif
13174     bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13175 
13176     bp->dev = dev;
13177     bp->pdev = pdev;
13178     bp->flags = 0;
13179     bp->func = PCI_FUNC(pdev->devfn);
13180 
13181     rc = pci_enable_device(pdev);
13182     if (rc) {
13183         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot enable PCI device, aborting\n");
13184         goto err_out;
13185     }
13186 
13187     if (!(pci_resource_flags(pdev, 0) & IORESOURCE_MEM)) {
13188         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot find PCI device base address,"
13189                " aborting\n");
13190         rc = -ENODEV;
13191         goto err_out_disable;
13192     }
13193 
13194     if (!(pci_resource_flags(pdev, 2) & IORESOURCE_MEM)) {
13195         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot find second PCI device"
13196                " base address, aborting\n");
13197         rc = -ENODEV;
13198         goto err_out_disable;
13199     }
13200 
13201 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13202     if (atomic_read(&pdev->enable_cnt) == 1) {
13203 #endif
13204         rc = pci_request_regions(pdev, DRV_MODULE_NAME);
13205         if (rc) {
13206             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot obtain PCI resources,"
13207                    " aborting\n");
13208             goto err_out_disable;
13209         }
13210 
13211         pci_set_master(pdev);
13212 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02060b) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13213         pci_save_state(pdev);
13214 #else
13215         pci_save_state(pdev, bp->pci_state);
13216 #endif
13217 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13218     }
13219 #endif
13220 
13221     bp->pm_cap = pci_find_capability(pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_PM);
13222     if (bp->pm_cap == 0) {
13223         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot find power management"
13224                " capability, aborting\n");
13225         rc = -EIO;
13226         goto err_out_release;
13227     }
13228 
13229     bp->pcie_cap = pci_find_capability(pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_EXP);
13230     if (bp->pcie_cap == 0) {
13231         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot find PCI Express capability,"
13232                " aborting\n");
13233         rc = -EIO;
13234         goto err_out_release;
13235     }
13236 
13237     if (pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(64)) == 0) {
13238         bp->flags |= USING_DAC_FLAG;
13239         if (pci_set_consistent_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(64)) != 0) {
13240             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "pci_set_consistent_dma_mask"
13241                    " failed, aborting\n");
13242             rc = -EIO;
13243             goto err_out_release;
13244         }
13245 
13246     } else if (pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32)) != 0) {
13247         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "System does not support DMA,"
13248                " aborting\n");
13249         rc = -EIO;
13250         goto err_out_release;
13251     }
13252 
13253     dev->mem_start = pci_resource_start(pdev, 0);
13254     dev->base_addr = dev->mem_start;
13255     dev->mem_end = pci_resource_end(pdev, 0);
13256 
13257     dev->irq = pdev->irq;
13258 
13259 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061c) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13260     bp->regview = pci_ioremap_bar(pdev, 0);
13261 #else
13262     bp->regview = ioremap_nocache(dev->base_addr,
13263                       pci_resource_len(pdev, 0));
13264 #endif
13265     if (!bp->regview) {
13266         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot map register space, aborting\n");
13267         rc = -ENOMEM;
13268         goto err_out_release;
13269     }
13270 
13271     bp->doorbells = ioremap_nocache(pci_resource_start(pdev, 2),
13272                     min_t(u64, BNX2X_DB_SIZE,
13273                           pci_resource_len(pdev, 2)));
13274     if (!bp->doorbells) {
13275         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot map doorbell space, aborting\n");
13276         rc = -ENOMEM;
13277         goto err_out_unmap;
13278     }
13279 
13280     bnx2x_set_power_state(bp, PCI_D0);
13281 
13282     /* clean indirect addresses */
13283     pci_write_config_dword(bp->pdev, PCICFG_GRC_ADDRESS,
13284                    PCICFG_VENDOR_ID_OFFSET);
13285     REG_WR(bp, PXP2_REG_PGL_ADDR_88_F0 + BP_PORT(bp)*16, 0);
13286     REG_WR(bp, PXP2_REG_PGL_ADDR_8C_F0 + BP_PORT(bp)*16, 0);
13287     REG_WR(bp, PXP2_REG_PGL_ADDR_90_F0 + BP_PORT(bp)*16, 0);
13288     REG_WR(bp, PXP2_REG_PGL_ADDR_94_F0 + BP_PORT(bp)*16, 0);
13289 
13290 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061e) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13291 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020618) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13292     dev->get_stats = bnx2x_get_stats;
13293 #endif
13294     dev->hard_start_xmit = bnx2x_start_xmit;
13295 #endif
13296     dev->watchdog_timeo = TX_TIMEOUT;
13297 
13298 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061e) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13299     dev->netdev_ops = &bnx2x_netdev_ops;
13300 #endif
13301     dev->ethtool_ops = &bnx2x_ethtool_ops;
13302 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x02061e) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13303     dev->open = bnx2x_open;
13304     dev->stop = bnx2x_close;
13305     dev->set_multicast_list = bnx2x_set_rx_mode;
13306     dev->set_mac_address = bnx2x_change_mac_addr;
13307     dev->do_ioctl = bnx2x_ioctl;
13308     dev->change_mtu = bnx2x_change_mtu;
13309     dev->tx_timeout = bnx2x_tx_timeout;
13310 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
13311     dev->vlan_rx_register = bnx2x_vlan_rx_register;
13312 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020616) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13313     dev->vlan_rx_kill_vid = bnx2x_vlan_rx_kill_vid;
13314 #endif
13315 #endif
13316 #if defined(HAVE_POLL_CONTROLLER) || defined(CONFIG_NET_POLL_CONTROLLER)
13317     dev->poll_controller = poll_bnx2x;
13318 #endif
13319 #endif
13320     dev->features |= NETIF_F_SG;
13321     dev->features |= NETIF_F_HW_CSUM;
13322     if (bp->flags & USING_DAC_FLAG)
13323         dev->features |= NETIF_F_HIGHDMA;
13324 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13325     dev->features |= (NETIF_F_TSO | NETIF_F_TSO_ECN);
13326 #endif
13327 #ifdef NETIF_F_TSO6 /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13328     dev->features |= NETIF_F_TSO6;
13329 #endif
13330 #ifdef BCM_VLAN
13331     dev->features |= (NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_TX | NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_RX);
13332     bp->flags |= (HW_VLAN_RX_FLAG | HW_VLAN_TX_FLAG);
13333 
13334 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13335     dev->vlan_features |= NETIF_F_SG;
13336     dev->vlan_features |= NETIF_F_HW_CSUM;
13337     if (bp->flags & USING_DAC_FLAG)
13338         dev->vlan_features |= NETIF_F_HIGHDMA;
13339     dev->vlan_features |= (NETIF_F_TSO | NETIF_F_TSO_ECN);
13340     dev->vlan_features |= NETIF_F_TSO6;
13341 #endif
13342 #endif
13343 
13344     /* get_port_hwinfo() will set prtad and mmds properly */
13345     bp->mdio.prtad = MDIO_PRTAD_NONE;
13346     bp->mdio.mmds = 0;
13347     bp->mdio.mode_support = MDIO_SUPPORTS_C45 | MDIO_EMULATE_C22;
13348     bp->mdio.dev = dev;
13349     bp->mdio.mdio_read = bnx2x_mdio_read;
13350     bp->mdio.mdio_write = bnx2x_mdio_write;
13351 
13352     return 0;
13353 
13354 err_out_unmap:
13355     if (bp->regview) {
13356         iounmap(bp->regview);
13357         bp->regview = NULL;
13358     }
13359     if (bp->doorbells) {
13360         iounmap(bp->doorbells);
13361         bp->doorbells = NULL;
13362     }
13363 
13364 err_out_release:
13365 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13366     if (atomic_read(&pdev->enable_cnt) == 1)
13367 #endif
13368         pci_release_regions(pdev);
13369 
13370 err_out_disable:
13371     pci_disable_device(pdev);
13372     pci_set_drvdata(pdev, NULL);
13373 
13374 err_out:
13375     return rc;
13376 }
13377 
13378 static void __devinit bnx2x_get_pcie_width_speed(struct bnx2x *bp,
13379                          int *width, int *speed)
13380 {
13381     u32 val = REG_RD(bp, PCICFG_OFFSET + PCICFG_LINK_CONTROL);
13382 
13383     *width = (val & PCICFG_LINK_WIDTH) >> PCICFG_LINK_WIDTH_SHIFT;
13384 
13385     /* return value of 1=2.5GHz 2=5GHz */
13386     *speed = (val & PCICFG_LINK_SPEED) >> PCICFG_LINK_SPEED_SHIFT;
13387 }
13388 
13389 #if defined(BNX2X_UPSTREAM) && !defined(BNX2X_USE_INIT_VALUES) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13390 static int __devinit bnx2x_check_firmware(struct bnx2x *bp)
13391 {
13392     const struct firmware *firmware = bp->firmware;
13393     struct bnx2x_fw_file_hdr *fw_hdr;
13394     struct bnx2x_fw_file_section *sections;
13395     u32 offset, len, num_ops;
13396     u16 *ops_offsets;
13397     int i;
13398     const u8 *fw_ver;
13399 
13400     if (firmware->size < sizeof(struct bnx2x_fw_file_hdr))
13401         return -EINVAL;
13402 
13403     fw_hdr = (struct bnx2x_fw_file_hdr *)firmware->data;
13404     sections = (struct bnx2x_fw_file_section *)fw_hdr;
13405 
13406     /* Make sure none of the offsets and sizes make us read beyond
13407      * the end of the firmware data */
13408     for (i = 0; i < sizeof(*fw_hdr) / sizeof(*sections); i++) {
13409         offset = be32_to_cpu(sections[i].offset);
13410         len = be32_to_cpu(sections[i].len);
13411         if (offset + len > firmware->size) {
13412             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Section %d length is out of "
13413                         "bounds\n", i);
13414             return -EINVAL;
13415         }
13416     }
13417 
13418     /* Likewise for the init_ops offsets */
13419     offset = be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->init_ops_offsets.offset);
13420     ops_offsets = (u16 *)(firmware->data + offset);
13421     num_ops = be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->init_ops.len) / sizeof(struct raw_op);
13422 
13423     for (i = 0; i < be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->init_ops_offsets.len) / 2; i++) {
13424         if (be16_to_cpu(ops_offsets[i]) > num_ops) {
13425             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Section offset %d is out of "
13426                         "bounds\n", i);
13427             return -EINVAL;
13428         }
13429     }
13430 
13431     /* Check FW version */
13432     offset = be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->fw_version.offset);
13433     fw_ver = firmware->data + offset;
13434     if ((fw_ver[0] != BCM_5710_FW_MAJOR_VERSION) ||
13435         (fw_ver[1] != BCM_5710_FW_MINOR_VERSION) ||
13436         (fw_ver[2] != BCM_5710_FW_REVISION_VERSION) ||
13437         (fw_ver[3] != BCM_5710_FW_ENGINEERING_VERSION)) {
13438         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Bad FW version:%d.%d.%d.%d."
13439                     " Should be %d.%d.%d.%d\n",
13440                fw_ver[0], fw_ver[1], fw_ver[2],
13441                fw_ver[3], BCM_5710_FW_MAJOR_VERSION,
13442                BCM_5710_FW_MINOR_VERSION,
13443                BCM_5710_FW_REVISION_VERSION,
13444                BCM_5710_FW_ENGINEERING_VERSION);
13445         return -EINVAL;
13446     }
13447 
13448     return 0;
13449 }
13450 
13451 static inline void be32_to_cpu_n(const u8 *_source, u8 *_target, u32 n)
13452 {
13453     const __be32 *source = (const __be32 *)_source;
13454     u32 *target = (u32 *)_target;
13455     u32 i;
13456 
13457     for (i = 0; i < n/4; i++)
13458         target[i] = be32_to_cpu(source[i]);
13459 }
13460 
13461 /*
13462    Ops array is stored in the following format:
13463    {op(8bit), offset(24bit, big endian), data(32bit, big endian)}
13464  */
13465 static inline void bnx2x_prep_ops(const u8 *_source, u8 *_target, u32 n)
13466 {
13467     const __be32 *source = (const __be32 *)_source;
13468     struct raw_op *target = (struct raw_op *)_target;
13469     u32 i, j, tmp;
13470 
13471     for (i = 0, j = 0; i < n/8; i++, j += 2) {
13472         tmp = be32_to_cpu(source[j]);
13473         target[i].op = (tmp >> 24) & 0xff;
13474         target[i].offset = tmp & 0xffffff;
13475         target[i].raw_data = be32_to_cpu(source[j + 1]);
13476     }
13477 }
13478 
13479 static inline void be16_to_cpu_n(const u8 *_source, u8 *_target, u32 n)
13480 {
13481     const __be16 *source = (const __be16 *)_source;
13482     u16 *target = (u16 *)_target;
13483     u32 i;
13484 
13485     for (i = 0; i < n/2; i++)
13486         target[i] = be16_to_cpu(source[i]);
13487 }
13488 
13489 #define BNX2X_ALLOC_AND_SET(arr, lbl, func) \
13490     do { \
13491         u32 len = be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->arr.len); \
13492         bp->arr = kmalloc(len, GFP_KERNEL); \
13493         if (!bp->arr) { \
13494             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Failed to allocate %d bytes " \
13495                         "for "#arr"\n", len); \
13496             goto lbl; \
13497         } \
13498         func(bp->firmware->data + be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->arr.offset), \
13499              (u8 *)bp->arr, len); \
13500     } while (0)
13501 
13502 static int __devinit bnx2x_init_firmware(struct bnx2x *bp, struct device *dev)
13503 {
13504     const char *fw_file_name;
13505     struct bnx2x_fw_file_hdr *fw_hdr;
13506     int rc;
13507 
13508     if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp))
13509         fw_file_name = FW_FILE_NAME_E1;
13510     else if (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp))
13511         fw_file_name = FW_FILE_NAME_E1H;
13512     else {
13513         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Unsupported chip revision\n");
13514         return -EINVAL;
13515     }
13516 
13517     printk(KERN_INFO PFX "Loading %s\n", fw_file_name);
13518 
13519     rc = request_firmware(&bp->firmware, fw_file_name, dev);
13520     if (rc) {
13521         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Can't load firmware file %s\n",
13522                fw_file_name);
13523         goto request_firmware_exit;
13524     }
13525 
13526     rc = bnx2x_check_firmware(bp);
13527     if (rc) {
13528         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Corrupt firmware file %s\n", fw_file_name);
13529         goto request_firmware_exit;
13530     }
13531 
13532     fw_hdr = (struct bnx2x_fw_file_hdr *)bp->firmware->data;
13533 
13534     /* Initialize the pointers to the init arrays */
13535     /* Blob */
13536     BNX2X_ALLOC_AND_SET(init_data, request_firmware_exit, be32_to_cpu_n);
13537 
13538     /* Opcodes */
13539     BNX2X_ALLOC_AND_SET(init_ops, init_ops_alloc_err, bnx2x_prep_ops);
13540 
13541     /* Offsets */
13542     BNX2X_ALLOC_AND_SET(init_ops_offsets, init_offsets_alloc_err,
13543                 be16_to_cpu_n);
13544 
13545     /* STORMs firmware */
13546     INIT_TSEM_INT_TABLE_DATA(bp) = bp->firmware->data +
13547             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->tsem_int_table_data.offset);
13548     INIT_TSEM_PRAM_DATA(bp)      = bp->firmware->data +
13549             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->tsem_pram_data.offset);
13550     INIT_USEM_INT_TABLE_DATA(bp) = bp->firmware->data +
13551             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->usem_int_table_data.offset);
13552     INIT_USEM_PRAM_DATA(bp)      = bp->firmware->data +
13553             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->usem_pram_data.offset);
13554     INIT_XSEM_INT_TABLE_DATA(bp) = bp->firmware->data +
13555             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->xsem_int_table_data.offset);
13556     INIT_XSEM_PRAM_DATA(bp)      = bp->firmware->data +
13557             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->xsem_pram_data.offset);
13558     INIT_CSEM_INT_TABLE_DATA(bp) = bp->firmware->data +
13559             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->csem_int_table_data.offset);
13560     INIT_CSEM_PRAM_DATA(bp)      = bp->firmware->data +
13561             be32_to_cpu(fw_hdr->csem_pram_data.offset);
13562 
13563     return 0;
13564 
13565 init_offsets_alloc_err:
13566     kfree(bp->init_ops);
13567 init_ops_alloc_err:
13568     kfree(bp->init_data);
13569 request_firmware_exit:
13570     release_firmware(bp->firmware);
13571 
13572     return rc;
13573 }
13574 
13575 #else
13576 
13577 static int __devinit bnx2x_init_firmware(struct bnx2x *bp, struct device *dev)
13578 {
13579     if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp))
13580         bnx2x_init_e1_firmware(bp);
13581 
13582     else if (CHIP_IS_E1H(bp))
13583         bnx2x_init_e1h_firmware(bp);
13584 
13585     else {
13586         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Unsupported chip revision\n");
13587         return -EINVAL;
13588     }
13589 
13590     return 0;
13591 }
13592 #endif
13593 
13594 static int __devinit bnx2x_init_one(struct pci_dev *pdev,
13595                     const struct pci_device_id *ent)
13596 {
13597     struct net_device *dev = NULL;
13598     struct bnx2x *bp;
13599     int pcie_width, pcie_speed;
13600     int rc;
13601 
13602     /* dev zeroed in init_etherdev */
13603 #ifdef BNX2X_MULTI_QUEUE /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13604     dev = alloc_etherdev_mq(sizeof(*bp), MAX_CONTEXT);
13605 #else
13606     dev = alloc_etherdev(sizeof(*bp));
13607 #endif
13608     if (!dev) {
13609         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot allocate net device\n");
13610         return -ENOMEM;
13611     }
13612 
13613     bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13614     bp->msglevel = debug;
13615 
13616     pci_set_drvdata(pdev, dev);
13617 
13618     rc = bnx2x_init_dev(pdev, dev);
13619     if (rc < 0) {
13620         free_netdev(dev);
13621         return rc;
13622     }
13623 
13624     rc = bnx2x_init_bp(bp);
13625     if (rc)
13626         goto init_one_exit;
13627 
13628     /* Set init arrays */
13629     rc = bnx2x_init_firmware(bp, &pdev->dev);
13630     if (rc) {
13631         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Error loading firmware\n");
13632         goto init_one_exit;
13633     }
13634 
13635     rc = register_netdev(dev);
13636     if (rc) {
13637         dev_err(&pdev->dev, "Cannot register net device\n");
13638         goto init_one_exit;
13639     }
13640 
13641     bnx2x_get_pcie_width_speed(bp, &pcie_width, &pcie_speed);
13642     printk(KERN_INFO "%s: %s (%c%d) PCI-E x%d %s found at mem %lx,"
13643            " IRQ %d, ", dev->name, board_info[ent->driver_data].name,
13644            (CHIP_REV(bp) >> 12) + 'A', (CHIP_METAL(bp) >> 4),
13645            pcie_width, (pcie_speed == 2) ? "5GHz (Gen2)" : "2.5GHz",
13646            dev->base_addr, bp->pdev->irq);
13647 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061b) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13648     printk(KERN_CONT "node addr %pM\n", dev->dev_addr);
13649 #else
13650     printk(KERN_CONT "node addr ");
13651     {
13652         int i;
13653 
13654         for (i = 0; i < ETH_ALEN; i++)
13655             printk(KERN_CONT "%2.2x", dev->dev_addr[i]);
13656     }
13657     printk(KERN_CONT "\n");
13658 #endif
13659 #if defined(__VMKLNX__) && defined(__VMKNETDDI_QUEUEOPS__) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13660     if(multi_mode != 0) {
13661         VMKNETDDI_REGISTER_QUEUEOPS(dev, bnx2x_netqueue_ops);
13662         printk(KERN_INFO "%s: VMware NetQueue Ops is registered\n",
13663                dev->name);
13664     }
13665 #endif
13666 
13667     return 0;
13668 
13669 init_one_exit:
13670     if (bp->regview)
13671         iounmap(bp->regview);
13672 
13673     if (bp->doorbells)
13674         iounmap(bp->doorbells);
13675 
13676     free_netdev(dev);
13677 
13678 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13679     if (atomic_read(&pdev->enable_cnt) == 1)
13680 #endif
13681         pci_release_regions(pdev);
13682 
13683     pci_disable_device(pdev);
13684     pci_set_drvdata(pdev, NULL);
13685 
13686     return rc;
13687 }
13688 
13689 static void __devexit bnx2x_remove_one(struct pci_dev *pdev)
13690 {
13691     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
13692     struct bnx2x *bp;
13693 
13694     if (!dev) {
13695         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "BAD net device from bnx2x_init_one\n");
13696         return;
13697     }
13698     bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13699 
13700 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020618) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13701     flush_scheduled_work();
13702 #endif
13703     unregister_netdev(dev);
13704 
13705 #if defined(BNX2X_UPSTREAM) && !defined(BNX2X_USE_INIT_VALUES) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13706     kfree(bp->init_ops_offsets);
13707     kfree(bp->init_ops);
13708     kfree(bp->init_data);
13709     release_firmware(bp->firmware);
13710 #endif
13711 
13712     if (bp->regview)
13713         iounmap(bp->regview);
13714 
13715     if (bp->doorbells)
13716         iounmap(bp->doorbells);
13717 
13718     free_netdev(dev);
13719 
13720 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020614) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13721     if (atomic_read(&pdev->enable_cnt) == 1)
13722 #endif
13723         pci_release_regions(pdev);
13724 
13725     pci_disable_device(pdev);
13726     pci_set_drvdata(pdev, NULL);
13727 }
13728 
13729 static int bnx2x_suspend(struct pci_dev *pdev, pm_message_t state)
13730 {
13731     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
13732     struct bnx2x *bp;
13733 
13734     if (!dev) {
13735         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "BAD net device from bnx2x_init_one\n");
13736         return -ENODEV;
13737     }
13738     bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13739 
13740     rtnl_lock();
13741 
13742 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02060b) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13743     pci_save_state(pdev);
13744 #else
13745     pci_save_state(pdev, bp->pci_state);
13746 #endif
13747 
13748     if (!netif_running(dev)) {
13749         rtnl_unlock();
13750         return 0;
13751     }
13752 
13753 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE < 0x020618) /* ! BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13754     flush_scheduled_work();
13755 #endif
13756     netif_device_detach(dev);
13757 
13758     bnx2x_nic_unload(bp, UNLOAD_CLOSE);
13759 
13760     bnx2x_set_power_state(bp, pci_choose_state(pdev, state));
13761 
13762     rtnl_unlock();
13763 
13764     return 0;
13765 }
13766 
13767 static int bnx2x_resume(struct pci_dev *pdev)
13768 {
13769     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
13770     struct bnx2x *bp;
13771     int rc;
13772 
13773     if (!dev) {
13774         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "BAD net device from bnx2x_init_one\n");
13775         return -ENODEV;
13776     }
13777     bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13778 
13779     rtnl_lock();
13780 
13781 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02060b) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13782     pci_restore_state(pdev);
13783 #else
13784     pci_restore_state(pdev, bp->pci_state);
13785 #endif
13786 
13787     if (!netif_running(dev)) {
13788         rtnl_unlock();
13789         return 0;
13790     }
13791 
13792     bnx2x_set_power_state(bp, PCI_D0);
13793     netif_device_attach(dev);
13794 
13795     rc = bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_OPEN);
13796 
13797     rtnl_unlock();
13798 
13799     return rc;
13800 }
13801 
13802 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02060b) && !defined(__VMKLNX__) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13803 static int bnx2x_eeh_nic_unload(struct bnx2x *bp)
13804 {
13805     int i;
13806 
13807     bp->state = BNX2X_STATE_ERROR;
13808 
13809     bp->rx_mode = BNX2X_RX_MODE_NONE;
13810 
13811     bnx2x_netif_stop(bp, 0);
13812 
13813     del_timer_sync(&bp->timer);
13814     bp->stats_state = STATS_STATE_DISABLED;
13815     DP(BNX2X_MSG_STATS, "stats_state - DISABLED\n");
13816 
13817     /* Release IRQs */
13818     bnx2x_free_irq(bp);
13819 
13820     if (CHIP_IS_E1(bp)) {
13821         struct mac_configuration_cmd *config =
13822                         bnx2x_sp(bp, mcast_config);
13823 
13824         for (i = 0; i < config->hdr.length; i++)
13825             CAM_INVALIDATE(config->config_table[i]);
13826     }
13827 
13828     /* Free SKBs, SGEs, TPA pool and driver internals */
13829     bnx2x_free_skbs(bp);
13830     for_each_queue(bp, i)
13831         bnx2x_free_rx_sge_range(bp, bp->fp + i, NUM_RX_SGE);
13832 #if (defined(BNX2X_NEW_NAPI) && (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02061b)) || defined(USE_NAPI_GRO) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13833     for_each_queue(bp, i)
13834         netif_napi_del(&bnx2x_fp(bp, i, napi));
13835 #endif
13836     bnx2x_free_mem(bp);
13837 
13838     bp->state = BNX2X_STATE_CLOSED;
13839 
13840     netif_carrier_off(bp->dev);
13841 
13842     return 0;
13843 }
13844 
13845 static void bnx2x_eeh_recover(struct bnx2x *bp)
13846 {
13847     u32 val;
13848 
13849     mutex_init(&bp->port.phy_mutex);
13850 
13851     bp->common.shmem_base = REG_RD(bp, MISC_REG_SHARED_MEM_ADDR);
13852     bp->link_params.shmem_base = bp->common.shmem_base;
13853     BNX2X_DEV_INFO("shmem offset is 0x%x\n", bp->common.shmem_base);
13854 
13855     if (!bp->common.shmem_base ||
13856         (bp->common.shmem_base < 0xA0000) ||
13857         (bp->common.shmem_base >= 0xC0000)) {
13858         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("MCP not active\n");
13859         bp->flags |= NO_MCP_FLAG;
13860         return;
13861     }
13862 
13863     val = SHMEM_RD(bp, validity_map[BP_PORT(bp)]);
13864     if ((val & (SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_DEV_INFO | SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_MB))
13865         != (SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_DEV_INFO | SHR_MEM_VALIDITY_MB))
13866         BNX2X_ERR("BAD MCP validity signature\n");
13867 
13868     if (!BP_NOMCP(bp)) {
13869         bp->fw_seq = (SHMEM_RD(bp, func_mb[BP_FUNC(bp)].drv_mb_header)
13870                   & DRV_MSG_SEQ_NUMBER_MASK);
13871         BNX2X_DEV_INFO("fw_seq 0x%08x\n", bp->fw_seq);
13872     }
13873 }
13874 
13883 static pci_ers_result_t bnx2x_io_error_detected(struct pci_dev *pdev,
13884                         pci_channel_state_t state)
13885 {
13886     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
13887     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13888 
13889     rtnl_lock();
13890 
13891     netif_device_detach(dev);
13892 
13893     if (state == pci_channel_io_perm_failure) {
13894         rtnl_unlock();
13895         return PCI_ERS_RESULT_DISCONNECT;
13896     }
13897 
13898     if (netif_running(dev))
13899         bnx2x_eeh_nic_unload(bp);
13900 
13901     pci_disable_device(pdev);
13902 
13903     rtnl_unlock();
13904 
13905     /* Request a slot reset */
13906     return PCI_ERS_RESULT_NEED_RESET;
13907 }
13908 
13915 static pci_ers_result_t bnx2x_io_slot_reset(struct pci_dev *pdev)
13916 {
13917     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
13918     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13919 
13920     rtnl_lock();
13921 
13922     if (pci_enable_device(pdev)) {
13923         dev_err(&pdev->dev,
13924             "Cannot re-enable PCI device after reset\n");
13925         rtnl_unlock();
13926         return PCI_ERS_RESULT_DISCONNECT;
13927     }
13928 
13929     pci_set_master(pdev);
13930     pci_restore_state(pdev);
13931 
13932     if (netif_running(dev))
13933         bnx2x_set_power_state(bp, PCI_D0);
13934 
13935     rtnl_unlock();
13936 
13937     return PCI_ERS_RESULT_RECOVERED;
13938 }
13939 
13947 static void bnx2x_io_resume(struct pci_dev *pdev)
13948 {
13949     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
13950     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
13951 
13952     rtnl_lock();
13953 
13954     bnx2x_eeh_recover(bp);
13955 
13956     if (netif_running(dev))
13957         bnx2x_nic_load(bp, LOAD_NORMAL);
13958 
13959     netif_device_attach(dev);
13960 
13961     rtnl_unlock();
13962 }
13963 
13964 static struct pci_error_handlers bnx2x_err_handler = {
13965     .error_detected = bnx2x_io_error_detected,
13966     .slot_reset     = bnx2x_io_slot_reset,
13967     .resume         = bnx2x_io_resume,
13968 };
13969 #endif
13970 
13971 static struct pci_driver bnx2x_pci_driver = {
13972     .name        = DRV_MODULE_NAME,
13973     .id_table    = bnx2x_pci_tbl,
13974     .probe       = bnx2x_init_one,
13975     .remove      = __devexit_p(bnx2x_remove_one),
13976     .suspend     = bnx2x_suspend,
13977     .resume      = bnx2x_resume,
13978 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02060b) && !defined(__VMKLNX__) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13979     .err_handler = &bnx2x_err_handler,
13980 #endif
13981 };
13982 
13983 static int __init bnx2x_init(void)
13984 {
13985     int ret;
13986 
13987     printk(KERN_INFO "%s", version);
13988 
13989     bnx2x_wq = create_singlethread_workqueue("bnx2x");
13990     if (bnx2x_wq == NULL) {
13991         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot create workqueue\n");
13992         return -ENOMEM;
13993     }
13994 
13995 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x020600) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
13996     ret = pci_register_driver(&bnx2x_pci_driver);
13997 #else
13998     ret = pci_module_init(&bnx2x_pci_driver);
13999 #endif
14000 #if (LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= 0x02060a) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
14001     if (ret) {
14002         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot register driver\n");
14003         destroy_workqueue(bnx2x_wq);
14004     }
14005 #endif
14006     return ret;
14007 }
14008 
14009 static void __exit bnx2x_cleanup(void)
14010 {
14011     pci_unregister_driver(&bnx2x_pci_driver);
14012 
14013     destroy_workqueue(bnx2x_wq);
14014 }
14015 
14016 module_init(bnx2x_init);
14017 module_exit(bnx2x_cleanup);
14018 
14019 #ifdef BCM_CNIC
14020 
14021 /* count denotes the number of new completions we have seen */
14022 static void bnx2x_cnic_sp_post(struct bnx2x *bp, int count)
14023 {
14024     struct eth_spe *spe;
14025 
14026 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
14027     if (unlikely(bp->panic))
14028         return;
14029 #endif
14030 
14031     spin_lock_bh(&bp->spq_lock);
14032     bp->cnic_spq_pending -= count;
14033 
14034     for (; bp->cnic_spq_pending < bp->cnic_eth_dev.max_kwqe_pending;
14035          bp->cnic_spq_pending++) {
14036 
14037         if (!bp->cnic_kwq_pending)
14038             break;
14039 
14040         spe = bnx2x_sp_get_next(bp);
14041         *spe = *bp->cnic_kwq_cons;
14042 
14043         bp->cnic_kwq_pending--;
14044 
14045         DP(NETIF_MSG_TIMER, "pending on SPQ %d, on KWQ %d count %d\n",
14046            bp->cnic_spq_pending, bp->cnic_kwq_pending, count);
14047 
14048         if (bp->cnic_kwq_cons == bp->cnic_kwq_last)
14049             bp->cnic_kwq_cons = bp->cnic_kwq;
14050         else
14051             bp->cnic_kwq_cons++;
14052     }
14053     bnx2x_sp_prod_update(bp);
14054     spin_unlock_bh(&bp->spq_lock);
14055 }
14056 
14057 static int bnx2x_cnic_sp_queue(struct net_device *dev,
14058                    struct kwqe_16 *kwqes[], u32 count)
14059 {
14060     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
14061     int i;
14062 
14063 #ifdef BNX2X_STOP_ON_ERROR
14064     if (unlikely(bp->panic))
14065         return -EIO;
14066 #endif
14067 
14068     spin_lock_bh(&bp->spq_lock);
14069 
14070     for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
14071         struct eth_spe *spe = (struct eth_spe *)kwqes[i];
14072 
14073         if (bp->cnic_kwq_pending == MAX_SP_DESC_CNT)
14074             break;
14075 
14076         *bp->cnic_kwq_prod = *spe;
14077 
14078         bp->cnic_kwq_pending++;
14079 
14080         DP(NETIF_MSG_TIMER, "L5 SPQE %x %x %x:%x pos %d\n",
14081            spe->hdr.conn_and_cmd_data, spe->hdr.type,
14082            spe->data.mac_config_addr.hi,
14083            spe->data.mac_config_addr.lo,
14084            bp->cnic_kwq_pending);
14085 
14086         if (bp->cnic_kwq_prod == bp->cnic_kwq_last)
14087             bp->cnic_kwq_prod = bp->cnic_kwq;
14088         else
14089             bp->cnic_kwq_prod++;
14090     }
14091 
14092     spin_unlock_bh(&bp->spq_lock);
14093 
14094     if (bp->cnic_spq_pending < bp->cnic_eth_dev.max_kwqe_pending)
14095         bnx2x_cnic_sp_post(bp, 0);
14096 
14097     return i;
14098 }
14099 
14100 static int bnx2x_cnic_ctl_send(struct bnx2x *bp, struct cnic_ctl_info *ctl)
14101 {
14102     struct cnic_ops *c_ops;
14103     int rc = 0;
14104 
14105     mutex_lock(&bp->cnic_mutex);
14106     c_ops = bp->cnic_ops;
14107     if (c_ops)
14108         rc = c_ops->cnic_ctl(bp->cnic_data, ctl);
14109     mutex_unlock(&bp->cnic_mutex);
14110 
14111     return rc;
14112 }
14113 
14114 static int bnx2x_cnic_ctl_send_bh(struct bnx2x *bp, struct cnic_ctl_info *ctl)
14115 {
14116     struct cnic_ops *c_ops;
14117     int rc = 0;
14118 
14119     rcu_read_lock();
14120     c_ops = rcu_dereference(bp->cnic_ops);
14121     if (c_ops)
14122         rc = c_ops->cnic_ctl(bp->cnic_data, ctl);
14123     rcu_read_unlock();
14124 
14125     return rc;
14126 }
14127 
14128 /*
14129  * for commands that have no data
14130  */
14131 static int bnx2x_cnic_notify(struct bnx2x *bp, int cmd)
14132 {
14133     struct cnic_ctl_info ctl = {0};
14134 
14135     ctl.cmd = cmd;
14136 
14137     return bnx2x_cnic_ctl_send(bp, &ctl);
14138 }
14139 
14140 static void bnx2x_cnic_cfc_comp(struct bnx2x *bp, int cid)
14141 {
14142     struct cnic_ctl_info ctl;
14143 
14144     /* first we tell CNIC and only then we count this as a completion */
14145     ctl.cmd = CNIC_CTL_COMPLETION_CMD;
14146     ctl.data.comp.cid = cid;
14147 
14148     bnx2x_cnic_ctl_send_bh(bp, &ctl);
14149     bnx2x_cnic_sp_post(bp, 1);
14150 }
14151 
14152 static int bnx2x_drv_ctl(struct net_device *dev, struct drv_ctl_info *ctl)
14153 {
14154     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
14155     int rc = 0;
14156 
14157     switch (ctl->cmd) {
14158     case DRV_CTL_CTXTBL_WR_CMD: {
14159         u32 index = ctl->data.io.offset;
14160         dma_addr_t addr = ctl->data.io.dma_addr;
14161 
14162         bnx2x_ilt_wr(bp, index, addr);
14163         break;
14164     }
14165 
14166     case DRV_CTL_COMPLETION_CMD: {
14167         int count = ctl->data.comp.comp_count;
14168 
14169         bnx2x_cnic_sp_post(bp, count);
14170         break;
14171     }
14172 
14173     /* rtnl_lock is held.  */
14174     case DRV_CTL_START_L2_CMD: {
14175         u32 cli = ctl->data.ring.client_id;
14176 
14177         bp->rx_mode_cl_mask |= (1 << cli);
14178         bnx2x_set_storm_rx_mode(bp);
14179         break;
14180     }
14181 
14182     /* rtnl_lock is held.  */
14183     case DRV_CTL_STOP_L2_CMD: {
14184         u32 cli = ctl->data.ring.client_id;
14185 
14186         bp->rx_mode_cl_mask &= ~(1 << cli);
14187         bnx2x_set_storm_rx_mode(bp);
14188         break;
14189     }
14190 
14191     default:
14192         BNX2X_ERR("unknown command %x\n", ctl->cmd);
14193         rc = -EINVAL;
14194     }
14195 
14196     return rc;
14197 }
14198 
14199 static void bnx2x_setup_cnic_irq_info(struct bnx2x *bp)
14200 {
14201     struct cnic_eth_dev *cp = &bp->cnic_eth_dev;
14202 
14203 #ifdef CONFIG_PCI_MSI /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
14204     if (bp->flags & USING_MSIX_FLAG) {
14205         cp->drv_state |= CNIC_DRV_STATE_USING_MSIX;
14206         cp->irq_arr[0].irq_flags |= CNIC_IRQ_FL_MSIX;
14207         cp->irq_arr[0].vector = bp->msix_table[1].vector;
14208     } else {
14209 #else
14210     {
14211 #endif
14212         cp->drv_state &= ~CNIC_DRV_STATE_USING_MSIX;
14213         cp->irq_arr[0].irq_flags &= ~CNIC_IRQ_FL_MSIX;
14214     }
14215     cp->irq_arr[0].status_blk = bp->cnic_sb;
14216     cp->irq_arr[0].status_blk_num = CNIC_SB_ID(bp);
14217     cp->irq_arr[1].status_blk = bp->def_status_blk;
14218     cp->irq_arr[1].status_blk_num = DEF_SB_ID;
14219 
14220     cp->num_irq = 2;
14221 }
14222 
14223 static int bnx2x_register_cnic(struct net_device *dev, struct cnic_ops *ops,
14224                    void *data)
14225 {
14226     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
14227     struct cnic_eth_dev *cp = &bp->cnic_eth_dev;
14228 
14229     if (ops == NULL)
14230         return -EINVAL;
14231 
14232     if (atomic_read(&bp->intr_sem) != 0)
14233         return -EBUSY;
14234 
14235     bp->cnic_kwq = kzalloc(PAGE_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
14236     if (!bp->cnic_kwq)
14237         return -ENOMEM;
14238 
14239     bp->cnic_kwq_cons = bp->cnic_kwq;
14240     bp->cnic_kwq_prod = bp->cnic_kwq;
14241     bp->cnic_kwq_last = bp->cnic_kwq + MAX_SP_DESC_CNT;
14242 
14243     bp->cnic_spq_pending = 0;
14244     bp->cnic_kwq_pending = 0;
14245 
14246     bp->cnic_data = data;
14247 
14248     cp->num_irq = 0;
14249     cp->drv_state = CNIC_DRV_STATE_REGD;
14250 
14251     bnx2x_init_sb(bp, bp->cnic_sb, bp->cnic_sb_mapping, CNIC_SB_ID(bp));
14252 
14253     bnx2x_setup_cnic_irq_info(bp);
14254     bnx2x_set_iscsi_eth_mac_addr(bp, 1);
14255     bp->cnic_flags |= BNX2X_CNIC_FLAG_MAC_SET;
14256     rcu_assign_pointer(bp->cnic_ops, ops);
14257 
14258     return 0;
14259 }
14260 
14261 static int bnx2x_unregister_cnic(struct net_device *dev)
14262 {
14263     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
14264     struct cnic_eth_dev *cp = &bp->cnic_eth_dev;
14265 
14266     mutex_lock(&bp->cnic_mutex);
14267     if (bp->cnic_flags & BNX2X_CNIC_FLAG_MAC_SET) {
14268         bp->cnic_flags &= ~BNX2X_CNIC_FLAG_MAC_SET;
14269         bnx2x_set_iscsi_eth_mac_addr(bp, 0);
14270     }
14271     cp->drv_state = 0;
14272     rcu_assign_pointer(bp->cnic_ops, NULL);
14273     mutex_unlock(&bp->cnic_mutex);
14274     synchronize_rcu();
14275     kfree(bp->cnic_kwq);
14276     bp->cnic_kwq = NULL;
14277 
14278     return 0;
14279 }
14280 
14281 struct cnic_eth_dev *bnx2x_cnic_probe(struct net_device *dev)
14282 {
14283     struct bnx2x *bp = netdev_priv(dev);
14284     struct cnic_eth_dev *cp = &bp->cnic_eth_dev;
14285 
14286     cp->drv_owner = THIS_MODULE;
14287     cp->chip_id = CHIP_ID(bp);
14288     cp->pdev = bp->pdev;
14289     cp->io_base = bp->regview;
14290 #if defined(RHEL_RELEASE_CODE) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
14291 #if RHEL_RELEASE_CODE >= RHEL_RELEASE_VERSION(5,5) /* BNX2X_UPSTREAM */
14292     cp->io_base2 = bp->doorbells;
14293 #endif
14294 #endif
14295     cp->max_kwqe_pending = 8;
14296     cp->ctx_blk_size = CNIC_CTX_PER_ILT * sizeof(union cdu_context);
14297     cp->ctx_tbl_offset = FUNC_ILT_BASE(BP_FUNC(bp)) + 1;
14298     cp->ctx_tbl_len = CNIC_ILT_LINES;
14299     cp->starting_cid = BCM_CNIC_CID_START;
14300     cp->drv_submit_kwqes_16 = bnx2x_cnic_sp_queue;
14301     cp->drv_ctl = bnx2x_drv_ctl;
14302     cp->drv_register_cnic = bnx2x_register_cnic;
14303     cp->drv_unregister_cnic = bnx2x_unregister_cnic;
14304 
14305     return cp;
14306 }
14307 EXPORT_SYMBOL(bnx2x_cnic_probe);
14308 
14309 #endif /* BCM_CNIC */
